1:25.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering)

runners.name: Amiata
runners.comment: Dark Angel colt; 85,000gns yearling; speedy pedigree and yard can ready one.
runners.spotlight: Dark Angel colt; cost 85,000gns as a yearling; half-brother to Norwegian 5.8f 2yo winner Icon Bling; dam 6f winner (RPR 72), closely related to two 5f 2yo winners, half-sister to useful winners Boston Rocker (Group-placed 6f 2yo) and Mustallib (6f); speedy pedigree and yard can ready one but this could be an above average maiden.

runners.name: First Approach
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

prev_owners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier

runners.comment: Showed speed when 2nd on debut and likely to take a big step forward; first-string
runners.spotlight: Dam was a Group-placed 6f winner and showed speed when hitting the crossbar at Dundalk on debut with Award Ceremony just behind; yard's representatives often take big steps forward from their initial outings; first-string on jockey bookings.

runners.name: Kansas
runners.comment: Nice pedigree but will probably need further and he's the yard's second-string
runners.spotlight: Wootton Bassett colt; dam 7.4f 2yo winner (RPR 94), sister to winners Mars (very smart up to 1m4f), Gustav Klimt (7f 2yo Group 2), Wonderfully (7f 2yo Group 3) and three Listed (at 6f 2yo, 7f 2yo and 1m), half-sister to Italian 1m 2yo Group 1 winner Nayarra; nice pedigree but will probably need further and he's the yard's second-string.

runners.name: Award Ceremony
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.comment: Touched off for 2nd by First Approach on debut and looked green; needs to improve
runners.spotlight: Only just touched off for second by First Approach at Dundalk on her debut last month; looked green and will need to improve with her re-opposing rival likely to take a sizeable step forward.

runners.name: Cheaperbythebottle
runners.comment: Cotai Glory filly; speed in her pedigree but this looks tough on debut
runners.spotlight: Cotai Glory filly; cost 16,000euros as a yearling; sister to French/Italian 4.5f/6f 2yo winner Bottle Of Bubbles (including Group 3; RPR 91); dam 5f AW 2yo winner (65), closely related to prolific 5f-6f winner Your Pal Tal, half-sister to four winners at up to 7f; speed in her pedigree but this looks tough on debut.

runners.name: Luna Beaux
runners.comment: Minor promise at Cork on debut but only beat one home here since; up against it here
runners.spotlight: Minor promise at Cork on debut but only beat one home here since; up against it in this field.

runners.name: Mini Cotai
runners.comment: Cotai Glory filly; yard get 2yo winners but likely best watched in this field
runners.spotlight: Cotai Glory filly; dam 6f AW 2yo winner (RPR 91), out of Listed-placed 1m2f/10.7f winner Zamoura; yard gets 2yo winners but likely best watched in this field.

runners.name: Soulful Diva
runners.comment: Soldier's Call filly; this looks tough for a newcomer but speed in her pedigree
runners.spotlight: Soldier's Call filly; half-sister to French 6f-8.5f winner Reconnect (including 2yo; RPR 70); dam French 5.5f 2yo winner, is granddaughter of 7f/1m winning half-sister to French 1,000 Guineas winner Elusive Wave; this looks tough for a newcomer but speed in her pedigree.

runners.name: Taiyi
runners.comment: Starspangledbanner filly; dam German Listed-placed 1m2f/1m3f winner; tough ask on debut
runners.spotlight: Starspangledbanner filly; dam German Listed-placed 1m2f/1m3f winner, out of German Listed-placed 1m3f winner; yard gets winning newcomers but this looks tough.

2:00.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering)

runners.name: Irish Rumour
runners.comment: Off the mark from 4lb lower last term over 5f last term; respectable return at Curragh
runners.spotlight: Off the mark from 4lb lower over 5f last term at Navan and respectable return at the Curragh when drawn on the wrong side; ought to go well back at 5f with Keane booked.

quotes.race: Simonstown Handicap
quotes.quote: Irish Rumour handled the 5f very well at the Curragh last time so we were confident today, although I was a little worried about the ground. She has a plenty of boot and comes good for you in the second half of the race - Dylan Browne McMonagle, rider.

runners.name: Surpass And Shine
runners.comment: Improved for 7f last term; below form on return and vulnerable at 5f
runners.spotlight: Improved for the step up to 7f last season, going close at Leopardstown and Cork; below form on return and looks vulnerable over this trip.

runners.name: Platino Bianco
runners.comment: A 14-race maiden; barely beat a rival on return and probably needs softer ground over 5f
runners.spotlight: A 14-race maiden; barely beat a rival on return and probably needs softer ground over this trip.

runners.name: Hero Of The Hour
runners.comment: Course winner; ground against him last time and lurks 2lb below last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Course winner; ground against him when last of 20 at Navan (5f) a fortnight ago; lurks 2lb below last winning mark and one to consider.

quotes.race: Join Us On Instagram @dundalk_stadium Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: What could go wrong did go wrong but Hero Of The Hour still won - Chris Hayes, jockey, speaking on RTV.

runners.name: Beano Power
runners.comment: Career best with soft ground win latest but up 8lb and different conditions; wing draw
runners.spotlight: Career best when getting off the mark at the 11th attempt at Navan (soft, 5f) a fortnight ago having been narrowly denied on AW on penultimate run; up 8lb, different conditions here and she's drawn out on the wing; not sure to follow up.

runners.name: Inishmot Prince
runners.comment: Has a record of 10-52 but 9 on AW and well below best in 2 recent turf starts
runners.spotlight: Has a record of 10-52 but nine of those wins have come on AW and he's been well below his best in two recent turf starts.

quotes.race: Kilberry Handicap
quotes.quote: I would have been disappointed if Inishmot Prince had got beaten because of the form he was in at home. Since Bellewstown, he really came on very well. He is 21lb lower on grass than he is on all-weather, but he needed every yard of it! - Tom McCourt, trainer.

runners.name: Rion Rubette
runners.comment: Narrowly denied in first 2 runs in maidens last term; lost her way since; first try at 5f
runners.spotlight: Narrowly denied in her first two runs in maidens last season including over 6f here; lost her way a bit since and 5f isn't sure to suit.

runners.name: Shes Smart

prev_owners.owner: John Abbey, Jimmy Fairhurst & Emma Evans
John Abbey, Jimmy Fairhurst & Emma Evans

runners.comment: Best runs for this yard over 5f at Down Royal; form dipped at the Curragh on Monday
runners.spotlight: Best efforts for this yard have been over 5f at Down Royal but ran with credit when runner-up to Beano Power on soft at Navan on her penultimate start; however, backwards step at the Curragh on Monday and her yard is a bit quieter than usual.

runners.name: Zaragoza
runners.comment: Won over extended 6f at Curragh last term; suspicion 5f is too short on return here
runners.spotlight: Won over the extended 6f at the Curragh on last season's return and ran a couple of solid races in defeat in big field handicaps since; suspicion 5f is too short on return from 205 days off.

runners.name: Sarahmae
runners.owner: Mary B Hogan & Michael M Obrien
runners.comment: Left previous form behind with 6-runner success latest but 7lb rise is harsh
runners.spotlight: Left all previous form behind with six-runner handicap success at Tipperary last month; however, 7lb rise looks harsh and quicker ground here.

runners.name: Tomarlo
runners.comment: 6f AW winner in Nov' and held form well; too keen behind Sarahmae latest; tongue-tie on
runners.spotlight: A 6f AW winner in November and held his form well since; can be keen and that probably cost him behind Sarahmae on return; tongue-tie now tried.

quotes.race: Book Online At dundalkstadium.com Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Tomarlo will actually end up being a nice horse. I think there is a nursery for him here in two weeks' time over five, so we'll see - David Marnane, trainer

runners.name: Arctic Steps
runners.comment: Improved with each run and drop in trip may help her settle on h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Improved with each run in maidens so far, beaten 6l in a 7f Gowran maiden last time out; has speed and drop in trip may help her settle better; intriguing handicap debutante.

runners.name: Dark Enigma
runners.comment: Beaten 1l in 2 early season h'caps last term; shaped like she needed return
runners.spotlight: Beaten just over a length in two early season handicaps last season and shaped like she needed her return at Sligo last week; not obviously well treated.

runners.name: Tillys Company
runners.comment: Promising 4th in Cork maiden last summer; nothing since inc' h'caps last term; blinkers on
runners.spotlight: Promising run when fourth in Cork maiden last summer but nothing since including two 5f turf handicaps this term; wears first-time blinkers.

runners.name: My Girl Sioux
runners.comment: 1-44 and 0-19 on turf; best turf form on slower ground than what she gets here
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-44 and 0-19 on turf; best turf form on slower ground than what she'll get here; respectable fifth behind some of these at Navan last month but others look more likely.

runners.name: Far At Sea
runners.comment: Step forward when 3rd in Sligo maiden but mark suffered as result; drops back to 5f
runners.spotlight: Took a step forward when third in a 6f Sligo maiden on Sunday but handicap mark has suffered as a result; probably has the speed for the drop back to 5f but may be flattered by the Sligo run.

runners.name: Step Back In Time
runners.comment: Both wins at Navan, latest over 6f; didn't build on that over 5f since
runners.spotlight: Both wins at Navan, the latest over 6f last month; didn't manage to build on that over 5f subsequently; needs best effort for some time to land this.

quotes.race: Simonstown Handicap
quotes.quote: Step Back In Time got away with it today over the stiff five, she probably wants six. She ground it out really well. She has not been running badly and came out of the Cork race very well - Chris Timmons, trainer.

runners.name: Bamako
runners.comment: Promise in a 7f Down Royal maiden but didn't kick on in h'caps and off 218 days
runners.spotlight: Promise in a 7f Down Royal maiden but didn't kick on in handicap company and has been off 218 days.

runners.name: Hell Left Loose
runners.comment: Well held at Laytown when last seen on the level in 2023 and lengthy absence to overcome
runners.spotlight: Well held at Laytown when last seen on the level in 2023 and lengthy absence to overcome here.

quotes.race: King John's Castle Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: He's after winning three now and the only day he was beaten was over five (furlongs) at the Curragh. Between six and seven furlongs is ideal and today's ground was fine - Denis Hogan, trainer of Hell Left Loose

quotes.race: Navanracecourse.ie Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: He travelled really well. The shorter trip the last day didn't suit him and the bit extra trip today was more up his street. He likes him and hopefully there is another day or two in him - Joe Doyle, rider of Hell Left Loose

runners.name: No Speed Limit
runners.breeder: T De La Heronniere & Ms E Morin
runners.comment: Can go well from the front but on a lengthy losing run since 2023 and he's 1-34 on turf
runners.spotlight: Can go well from the front but on a lengthy losing run since 2023 and he's 1-34 on turf; tough ask.

quotes.race: William Hill Extra Places Everyday Handicap
quotes.quote: No Speed Limit runs his heart out every time. He ran so many times last year and was very consistent. He's just very genuine - Pat McKenna, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Bet 5 Euro Get 30 Euro Offer Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: No Speed Limit had been working really well at home. He has loads of ability and a good turn of foot, he just handled the surface better than I thought. I thought he wanted soft ground. He'll stay on the go now - Aidan Fogarty, trainer.

2:35.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering)

runners.name: Albert Einstein
runners.owner: D Smith, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, Westerberg
runners.comment: By a top sire from the family of Giant's Causeway; has been well-touted; watch market
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam Group-placed 5f AW 2yo winner (RPR 92), half-sister to Group-placed 7f AW 2yo winner Carracci, out of Group-placed 1m 2yo winning half-sister to 7f-1m2f Group 1 winner Giant's Causeway; by a top sire and from a legendary damline; has been well-touted this spring; watch the market on debut.

runners.name: Arakiel
runners.comment: A E25,000 yearling; by a top sire but yard not readily associated with 2yo winners
runners.spotlight: Third foal; half-brother to French 1m1f winner Starzo Fal; dam French 1m2f 2yo winner, half-sister to 1m4f Listed winner Merveillo, from the family of 1m 2yo Group 1/1m4f Grade 1 winner Ectot; E25,000 yearling comes from a yard not readily associated with 2yo winners.

runners.name: Chicago Call
runners.comment: By a quality sire; a E125,000 vendor buyback as a yearling; yard is in good form
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam Group-placed 6f winner (RPR 96), half-sister to US winners Fashion Runaway (stakes-placed 6.5f dirt) and A Terrific Shot (6f/7f dirt), out of US 5.5f dirt 2yo winner; E125,000 vendor buyback as a yearling; yard is in good form; can run well.

runners.name: Dialin For Dollars
runners.comment: Unsold for 115,000GBP at recent breeze-up sale; half-brother to Norfolk winner
runners.spotlight: Eighth foal; half-brother to winners The Lir Jet (5f/6.5f including 2yo, GB Group 2 Norfolk Stakes and US Grade 2; RPR 110), Special Angel (1m1f; 69) and Fast Dreams (Italian 5f/6f including 2yo); E74,000 yearling was unsold for 115,000GBP at a recent breeze-up sale but is bred to be a smart 2yo so respected.

runners.name: Evening Blues
runners.comment: Not hard ridden after meeting trouble in running on debut; benefit from that; big player
runners.spotlight: Moyglare homebred is by a leading young sire and from a fine family; not hard ridden after meeting trouble in running on debut over 5f at the Curragh; can benefit from that run and this trip can suit better; big player.

runners.name: Gstaad
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: Half-brother to Prix Morny and Middle Park winner but looks the yard second-string
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-brother to five winners including Vandeek (6f 2yo including Group 1 Prix Morny and Middle Park; RPR 117), Mine's A Double (5f/6f; 97) and Becker (5f AW; 77); dam placed 5f AW (58); fine pedigree and cost 450,000gns as a foal but looks the yard second-string on debut.

runners.name: Manifest Destiny
runners.owner: Team Valor International Llc & A Oliver
runners.comment: Cost E31,000 as a yearling; by a leading sire and related to lots of winners
runners.spotlight: Tenth foal; brother to 6f 2yo winner Jazz Club (RPR 101), half-brother to four winners including Bloody Love (Italian Listed-placed 6f/7.5f including 2yo; 93) and Mappa Mundi (6f 2yo; 88); dam Japanese 7f winner; E31,000 yearling by leading sire; related to winners so can run well on debut.

runners.name: Monocle Rocket
runners.comment: By a useful sire and from a quality damline, tracing back to a Yorkshire Oaks winner
runners.spotlight: By a useful sire and from a quality damline, granddam was a dual stakes winner over 1m2f out of the 1989 Yorkshire Oaks winner Roseate Tern; can run well on debut but others appeal more.

runners.name: Mokheefa
runners.owner: Mohammed Bin Hamad Khalifa Al Attiyah
runners.comment: Hails from a decent Japanese pedigree but cost only 1,400gns as a yearling
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam Japanese 7f winner, closely related to Japanese Group 3 1m winner Musee Sultan, out of Japanese 1m-1m2f winner Ask Deputy; by a quality sire in Japan but made only 1,400gns as a yearling; best watched on debut.

3:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering)

runners.name: Jered Maddox
runners.comment: Won twice over 5f at Dundalk this winter and 11-52 on AW but not as good on turf (1-23)
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 5f at Dundalk this winter and he's 11-52 on AW but not as good on turf (1-23); while return to 6f is fine, the handicapper has probably caught up again now.

runners.name: Staysound Susie
runners.comment: Career best to land fillies' h'cap last season and raced away from action latest
runners.spotlight: Career best to land a fillies' handicap at Cork last season and went close over this C&D too; probably wasn't helped by racing away from the action here 12 days ago but still needs a career best to defy this mark.

runners.name: Pinar Del Rio
runners.comment: Dual winner on testing ground last term and off 266 days; best watched
runners.spotlight: Won back-to-back last season but all his best form is on very different ground to this and he's been off 266 days; probably best watched unless market suggests otherwise.

quotes.race: Ryans Cleaning Handicap
quotes.quote: Pinar Del Rio is improving. We got him right over the winter and got him right, he's paying us back. We'll try and run him as often as we can for now because he does want t bit of juice in the ground - Joe Conlon, trainer.

quotes.race: Holden Plant Rentals Handicap
quotes.quote: Pinar Del Rio has plenty of ability but is a bit of a rogue. On a good day he's a grand horse - Joe Conlon, trainer

quotes.race: Tally Ho Stud Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Pinar Del Rio had a lovely first run, and I was hoping coming today that he would do something like that. He did it well, he'll have no trouble getting further than that and he will improve on nicer ground - Paddy Twomey, trainer.

runners.name: Escaping Thejungle
runners.comment: Both wins from the front over 5f; low-key return and needs to prove as effective at 6f
runners.spotlight: Both wins from the front over 5f at Bellewstown; low-key return, albeit in Listed class and needs to prove she's as effective at this distance; others more likely.

quotes.race: Byrne Marquees Handicap
quotes.quote: Escaping Thejungle came back from a little upset last year and we did pick this out back a little while ago. She has been improving every time and coming down a bit in the weights. Laytown brought her on brilliantly - Alan Delany, owner.

runners.name: Rappell
runners.comment: All 3 wins at 6f; real threat when he gets pace to aim at; needed recent return
runners.spotlight: All three wins at 6f and he's a real threat when he gets a decent pace to aim at; will have needed his return on unsuitable ground and looks like a big player with Keane on board.

quotes.race: Castle Arch Hotel Handicap
quotes.quote: Rappell is a fine, big horse and learning away. He jumped and travelled and always had something to aim at. Once he gets to the front he thinks he has done enough - Billy Lee, rider.

quotes.race: Friday Fairynights 7th June Handicap
quotes.quote: Rappell  was green and ran really well. He's definitely come on a lot from it. I think he's a grand horse, his mother was very good - Paul Flynn, trainer

runners.name: Never Shout Never
runners.comment: A 1l defeat latest; up 2lb but remains on workable mark and won't mind the return to 6f
runners.spotlight: Consistent on AW this winter and only beaten 1l back on turf at the Curragh latest; up 2lb but remains on workable mark and won't mind the return to 6f.

quotes.race: Christmas Party Nights At Dundalk Stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Never Shout Never is a horse that can progress through the winter months. We will mix it between five and six, more than likely keep him fresh for the next five. We'll see where it takes us then - Stephen Thorne, trainer.

quotes.race: Buy Tickets Online At www.corkracecourse.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: I spoke to Fozzy and Joey Sheridan about Never Shout Never and we were keen on going forward and not pulling out of him, just to get him breathing right. I knew he would get through the ground well as he's a big, strong horse - Jamie Powell, jockey.

runners.name: Altimara
runners.comment: Is 0-8; went close on AW end of 2024 but those runs over 7f and low-key return
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden but went close on AW twice towards the end of last year; however, those runs were over 7f and she was well held over 1m on return; others look stronger.

runners.name: Prime Sign
runners.comment: Nothing in maidens but big 50-1 upset on h'cap debut and completely unexposed
runners.spotlight: Showed very little in maidens but it was a big upset on handicap debut when winning a 6f Curragh handicap at 50-1; up 9lb but she's entirely unexposed and ought to go well again with similar conditions.

runners.name: Dynamic Force
runners.comment: Started well for new yard but lost his way more recently; opposable in competitive h'cap
runners.spotlight: Started brightly for this yard last season but lost his way a bit recently and opposable in a competitive handicap.

quotes.race: EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Dynamic Force did it nicely. He was a bit laid-back so he took time to learn and adjust as the race progressed, but he's got a lovely big stride and is a horse who has a future. I'll have to talk to the Middleham Park team about plans and we might just feel our way gradually and have a bigger target towards the end of the year or we could pitch him in somewhere nicer next time, but we'll see how he is. He's an exciting horse, but he's still got a bit to learn and is a bit raw. He'd shown enough at home, plenty to be honest, but he's so laid-back, which was a little concern of mine and that's maybe why he was a longer price than he should have been. I think he's more 6f than 5f and he may get further next year; his stride is quite eyecatching and he seems to do everything effortlessly as you could see with Danny, who didn't have to give him any urgings. He's a Kodiac with a good, strong, powerful action and I think he'd get through easier ground as well; extremes of either ground would not be right - Robert Cowell, trainer.

runners.name: Improve Your Move
runners.comment: 4th in Listed race in France; wasn't disgraced on Irish debut; may need this
runners.spotlight: Fourth in below par Listed race in France and wasn't disgraced on Irish debut in October; might need this on return though and not obviously well treated.

runners.name: Tawaazon
runners.comment: Came in for support over 5f recently and ran okay before Curragh 4th; no wins since 2023
runners.spotlight: Came in for market support when eighth over 5f at Navan and respectable run at the Curragh over 7f since; feasibly treated but no wins since 2023.

runners.name: Star Mind
runners.comment: Below form in four runs for this yard and drop to 6f unlikely to help.
runners.spotlight: Below form in four runs for new yard and drop to 6f unlikely to help.

runners.name: Skillman Ave
runners.comment: Good runs in defeat in h'caps but not obviously well treated and may need this
runners.spotlight: Some good runs in defeat since switch to handicaps but doesn't look obviously well treated and likely to need this after 157 days off.

3:45.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering)

runners.name: Smoke Them Out
runners.comment: Fourth at Cork and the runner-up was since second in a Listed race; can go close
runners.spotlight: Cork nursery winner last year was narrowly beaten in the Birdcatcher nursery over C&D next time; fine return to action when fourth at Cork and runner-up was since second in a Listed race; can go close off same mark.

runners.name: Jorge Alvares
runners.comment: Made all to win a Dundalk maiden over this trip; the blinkers worn are retained; big shout
runners.spotlight: Some fine efforts in defeat including when third on stable debut at Bellewstown (1m) to a subsequent Group 3 winner; made all to win Dundalk maiden since back to this trip; blinkers worn then are retained; big shout.

runners.name: Passing Phase
runners.comment: Runner-up over 5f at Tipperary last time; visors are added; maybe better on easy ground
runners.spotlight: All starts at 5f-6f; has run well in defeat numerous times in varying ground conditions; runner-up over 5f at Tipperary last time and visors are added; perhaps better on easier ground.

runners.name: No Return

prev_owners.owner: N W T Dalzell & R P Behan

runners.comment: Raised 5lb for Curragh maiden win but seems to be improving and is a player
runners.spotlight: Had been consistent in defeat until getting off the mark in a Curragh maiden over this trip last time, making all; raised 5lb for that but seems to be improving and is a player.

runners.name: Gazelle Dor

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Renata Coleman & Aidan Gleeson & M C Grassick

runners.comment: C&D winner won at Curragh on return; raised 5lb; should be competitive under same claimer
runners.spotlight: Won a 5f Bellewstown maiden last year before taking a C&D nursery on final start; notched a third win on return in a Curragh handicap against older horses and was raised 5lb; should be competitive under the same claimer.

quotes.race: Slane Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I think Gazelle D'or has done very well to win that. The whole thing today was about just switching her off and getting her to come home good. She travelled lovely the whole way and, just when she got there, she just idled a small bit underneath me - Jack Cleary, rider.

runners.name: Green Icon
runners.comment: Was poor over 1m at this track even allowing for the trip; questions down to 6f
runners.spotlight: Won on AW and turf over 7f when trained in UK last year; not a bad return/stable debut at Cork but was poor over 1m at this track even allowing for the trip; questions down to 6f.

runners.name: Temperance
runners.comment: 3lb better off with Jorge Alvares for a 2l beating at Dundalk last time; can be involved
runners.spotlight: Maiden has run well several times in defeat including over C&D and also behind some of these rivals; is 3lb better off with Jorge Alvares for a 2l beating at Dundalk last time; can be involved.

runners.name: Garden Of Eden
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.comment: Beaten approx' 5l both starts this term over 1m but this step up in trip should suit
runners.spotlight: Won a 7f maiden at this track last year and best run since was a close second in a Leopardstown 1m Listed race; beaten approximately 5l both starts this term over 1m but this step up in trip should suit; one of three runners for yard.

runners.name: Gotomylovely
runners.owner: Mrs M V Magnier & Mrs Paul Shanahan
runners.comment: Won well at Gowran last time; has a tendency to hang right; up in trip on faster ground
runners.spotlight: Had hung right in first two starts this term (bit slipped one occasion) but put everything together at Gowran last time, going clear against the far rail over 1m (soft); can't afford to hang on this left-handed track; up in trip on faster ground.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies & Mares Maiden
quotes.quote: Gotomylovely is straightforward but she got stage fright the first day in Dundalk and then ran well in a maiden. The last day wasn't anything to do with her, the bit went through her mouth and she didn't know what to do. I tried to use her experience out in front and she quickened up smartly in the straight. I gave her her own space and she's showed us in her work at home that she quite likes that. There's an engine there - Joey Sheridan, jockey.

runners.name: Hollys Graces
runners.comment: The form of maiden win will need plenty of improving upon in this company; bred to stay
runners.spotlight: Won a 7f Dundalk maiden on debut last September but the form of that race will need plenty of improving upon in this company; bred to stay this trip, though.

runners.name: Island Hopping
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Beaten 6.5l in a Navan Group 3 on return over this trip and will have to improve on that
runners.spotlight: Won Gowran maiden over 1m last year and close fifth in Group 3 next time; beaten 6.5l in Navan Group 3 on return over this trip and will have to improve on that; seems to be the yard's first-string on jockey bookings.

quotes.race: Staffordstown Stud Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Ronan said he thought Island Hopping came home very well. She will get a mile and a quarter easily and she should be a Group filly for next year - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Jaliyah
runners.owner: Giselle De Aguiar & Amo Racing Limited
runners.comment: Won a conditions race over this trip at Cork last time; can be a player if repeating that
runners.spotlight: Won Cork maiden over 1m (gd/fm) last autumn and put up an improved effort back at that track last time when winning conditions race over this trip on soft; can be a player if repeating that form at this much different track.

runners.name: Kalixa
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Won a C&D maiden recently on yielding; this demands plenty more but is worth her place
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in two maidens last year over 1m but improved form on return when winning a C&D maiden recently on yielding; this demands plenty more but is worth her place.

runners.name: Medici Venus
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Decent run in a Navan Group 3 on return; wasn't far behind her stablemate Island Hopping
runners.spotlight: Third runner for yard; got off the mark in a Listowel rated race over 1m last autumn and ran creditably in a Navan Group 3 on return; wasn't far behind her stablemate Island Hopping and has a bit to find with her.

runners.name: Tamam Desert
runners.comment: Won a Galway maiden over 7f last September; every chance that she can stay this trip
runners.spotlight: Beat today's rival Medici Venus narrowly in a Galway maiden over 7f last September on second start; every chance that she can stay this trip on breeding but needs to be ready on first outing since.

4:55.race_name: ALTO EQUINE Building Solutions Rated Race
4:55.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering)

runners.name: Tangapour
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Beaten a long way in the Madrid Handicap (7f) here on return; has to rebound up in trip
runners.spotlight: Won a 1m Killarney maiden on heavy last year; was beaten a long way in similar conditions over 7f in the Madrid Handicap at this track on return; has to rebound up in trip on faster ground.

runners.name: Galveston
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier/Michael Tabor/Derrick Smith/Peter M Brant
runners.comment: Course maiden winner; beaten 6.25l in a Leopardstown handicap on return; blinkers added
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden over 1m at this track on second start last October; below that form when beaten 6.25l in a Leopardstown handicap over this trip on return, beaten when squeezed for room; can do better with blinkers added.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Galveston is a big, strong colt and he was very good from the gates today. He's travelled around plenty idle and green and raw, so he will come on from it. He's had to do the donkey work the whole way and he was never headed. It's a long way up the straight here and the ground has gone a bit testing for two-year-olds too. He was probably always looking for a little bit of company. My lad is tough and when something came to him he's gone on again - Gavin Ryan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Marazion
runners.comment: Solid return to action over this trip at Cork last time and needs to improve on that
runners.spotlight: Wasn't far behind Lake Victoria on debut last year but below that level at Galway next time; a solid return to action over this trip at Cork last time (winner runs in preceding race); needs to improve on that.

stable_tour.quote: She's a half-sister to Trevaunance and ran a lovely race in a winners' race at Cork on Saturday. She was fresh and well early on, but she relaxed in the middle part of the race. She took a blow at the furlong pole but ran through the line really well. We're looking forward to bringing her back for a maiden in the coming weeks. 23-04-25

runners.name: Red King
runners.comment: Well below best on return over this trip at Cork; has to rebound; faster ground might help
runners.spotlight: Three solid efforts in defeat in 1m maidens last year but was well below that level on return over this trip at Cork; has to rebound in a major way but faster ground might help.

runners.name: Heather
runners.comment: Won a 1m2.5f Dundalk maiden; runner-up won a handicap off 75 since;  looks a big player
runners.spotlight: Raced prominently when a snug enough winner of a 1m2.5f Dundalk maiden back in February; runner-up won a handicap off 75 since; reverting to turf should be no problem and she looks a big player.

runners.name: William F Browne
runners.comment: Poor on return for this yard in soft ground at Cork (1m4f); can do better but best watched
runners.spotlight: Won claimers over 1m at this track and 7f at Dundalk last year; was poor on return for this yard in soft ground at Cork (1m4f); can do better but best watched for now.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Claiming Maiden
quotes.quote: William F Browne is a lovely horse and is going the right way. We had no option really but to come here as he needs every yard of the trip - Ger Lyons, trainer.

runners.name: Pallatine Hills
runners.comment: Perhaps found 1m4f too far on return at Cork; tongue-tie removed and blinkers added
runners.spotlight: Best effort in five runs was when beaten 3l in a 1m Curragh maiden last October; perhaps found 1m4f too far on return/handicap bow at Cork; tongue-tie removed and blinkers added.

5:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering)

runners.name: Shades Of Gray
runners.comment: Mastercraftsman filly; dam 5.7f winner (RPR 79);  tough ask on belated debut
runners.spotlight: Mastercraftsman filly; dam 5.7f winner (RPR 79), half-sister to winners Top Lock (1m3f AW/German Derby third), Chain Of Events (1m2f) and Carnivore (7f-8.6f); tough ask on belated debut.

runners.name: Bearwithus
runners.comment: Promising debut 4th; not as good on softer ground on return; 1m an unknown
runners.spotlight: Promising debut when fourth at Galway and may have needed her return on softer ground; not sure to appreciate a mile; now tried with tongue-tie.

runners.name: Bond International
runners.breeder: Ecurie Des Monceaux, Rifa Mustang Europe Ltd & Z Bifov
runners.comment: Lope De Vega filly; 240,000euros yearling; nice pedigree but hood perhaps not good sign
runners.spotlight: Lope De Vega filly; cost 240,000euros as a yearling; half-sister to German 1m1f AW winner Bavaria; dam 9.4f-1m4f winner (including AW/Listed; RPR 102), sister to unraced dam of 6f Group 1 winner Shaquille, out of 5f Group 2 winner Danehurst; plenty to like about her pedigree but a hood for debut perhaps not a good sign.

runners.name: Calrissiana
runners.comment: Only beaten 1l in AW maiden; testing ground against her on return; big player
runners.spotlight: Only beaten 1l in Dundalk maiden in December and testing ground probably against her on low-key return; big player with that run under her belt.

runners.name: Chipsrdown
runners.comment: Kodi Bear filly and half-sisters stayer this trip; worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Kodi Bear filly; dam maiden from 6f-1m2f (RPR 63), half-sister to winners Babbo's Boy (useful 1m2f-1m4f) and Lanansaak (Listed-placed 7f/1m), out of 1m 2yo winning granddaughter of Cheveley Park winner Desirable; worth a market check.

runners.name: Gee Gee Hadid
runners.comment: Well held 33-1 shot when ridden prominently on debut last month; may need time
runners.spotlight: Well held 33-1 shot when ridden prominently on debut last month; likely more a long term project.

runners.name: Glasheen Girl
runners.breeder: Mary Hogan, Martin Lynn & Nigel Lynn
runners.comment: Tailed off 100-1 shot when missing the break on debut; now tried with visor; off 178 days
runners.spotlight: Tailed off 100-1 shot when missing the break on debut; now tried with visor; off 178 days.

runners.name: Kashel Spring
runners.comment: Minor promise on testing ground on debut; however, struggled at Cork earlier this week
runners.spotlight: Minor promise on testing ground on Galway debut; however, struggled at Cork earlier this week; likely best watched if turned out again quickly.

runners.name: Katashuna
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Well bred newcomer; may be a middle distance prospect but certainly worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Night Of Thunder filly; half-sister to French 1m2f winner Khalidiya (RPR 94); dam 1m3f/1m4f winner (including Group 3; 104), half-sister to 1m2f Group 2 winner Katiyra, out of 1m4f/1m6f Listed winner; well bred newcomer; might be more of a middle distance prospect but certainly worth a market check.

runners.name: Senti Qua
runners.comment: Always behind when sent off at 50-1 for her debut 15 days ago; best watched for now
runners.spotlight: Always behind when sent off at 50-1 for her debut 15 days ago; best watched for now.

runners.name: Sharayka
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Joint favourite when fourth on debut; possibly quicker ground will help
runners.spotlight: Joint favourite when fourth of 14 in a Naas maiden on debut in March; possible quicker ground this time will help.

runners.name: Smiling
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Big run when 2nd on AW (form worked out); beaten fav on return but 1m may be a big help
runners.spotlight: Took a decent step forward from a promising debut when runner-up at Dundalk and had subsequent winners in behind; beaten favourite on return but could be a different proposition at this new trip; wears first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Ventress
runners.comment: Minor promise on debut but showed nothing when tailed off on return; may be one for h'caps
runners.spotlight: Minor promise on debut but showed nothing when tailed off on return and may be one for handicaps.

1:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Watering)

runners.name: Galilean Prince
runners.comment: Triple-figure odds when tailed off here & at Kilbeggan; safe to rule out; cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Triple-figure odds when tailed off here and at Kilbeggan; safe to rule out; first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Hillstar Blues
runners.comment: Some debut promise in Punchestown bumper; wasn't disgraced on hurdle debut; more needed
runners.spotlight: Some debut promise in Punchestown bumper; took backward step at Thurles following month; wasn't disgraced on hurdle debut here last month; more needed.

runners.name: Kellys Cosmos
runners.comment: Best work at finish when remote sixth at Kilbeggan (2m); needs handicaps & step up in trip
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in pair of point-to-points; remote fourth on hurdling debut at Limerick (21.5f); best work at finish when remote sixth at Kilbeggan (2m); needs handicaps and step up in trip.

runners.name: Killeaney Bear
runners.comment: Third to subsequent Grade 1-winning hurdler Hello Neighbour on last Flat start; big player
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner on the Flat over 1m1f on a sound surface and rated 76; third to subsequent Grade 1-winning hurdler Hello Neighbour on last Flat start at Roscommon; big player if translating that form to timber after a break.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Lengthen The Odds Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Killeaney Bear didn't handle the track or the ground at Galway, but he pulled out of the race well and we chanced it. He's a big, raw horse and I would say there is more to come, especially next year - Andy Slattery, trainer.

runners.name: Kingston Fire
runners.comment: 2,000euros foal; half-brother to several French winners; dam sister to German G3 winner
runners.spotlight: 2,000euros foal; half-brother to French winners Good Smash (7f-9.5f), Whole World (1m4f/12.5f), Ascension Directe (1m) and Ludella (1m1f Flat/2m5f chase); dam maiden sister to German 1m2f Group 3 winner; best watched.

runners.name: Lets Go Mans
runners.breeder: M Gerard Antone Delorme, Mme Valerie Elisabete Fuzy & Mme Le
runners.comment: Behind throughout on Naas debut last month when a 33-1 shot; likely to need more time
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to Willie Mullins-trained winning hurdlers Coquin Mans and Egality Mans; behind throughout on Naas debut last month when a 33-1 shot; likely to need more time.

runners.name: Los Toldos
runners.comment: Led for much of the way when 5th here in maiden hurdle on stable bow; chance on that form
runners.spotlight: AW winner over 1m4f for Charlie Appleby last year; bought for £27,000 in October; led for much of the way when fifth here in maiden hurdle on stable debut; tailed off last on the Flat (1m6f) at Gowran last month on soft; better ground should help.

quotes.race: Try Our Price Boosts At Unibet Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Los Toldos is a lovely staying type. He's still learning on the job and is not the finished article but I always felt he was doing enough - William Buick, jockey, talking to RacingTV.

runners.name: Mick Collins
runners.comment: 82-rated on Flat after Bellewstown win; run here in October too bad to be true; player
runners.spotlight: 82-rated on the Flat after maiden win at Bellewstown (1m4f, good) last month; made calamitous hurdles debut here (2m) in October (keen, mistakes, slipped badly and burst blood vessel); surely capable of better than that.

runners.name: Pistocchi
runners.comment: Dam French 1m4f Flat (RPR 101)/2m2f hurdle winner; market will guide on debut
runners.spotlight: Dam French 1m4f Flat (RPR 101)/2m2f hurdle winner, sister to 1m4f-12.5f winner Swertia, out of Group-placed 1m 2yo winning half-sister to 1m2f-1m4f Group 1 winner Sarafina and 1m Group 3 winner Sandagiyr; market will guide.

runners.name: Sixtripleeight
runners.breeder: Mr B Cloney & Mr O Cloney
runners.comment: Behind Los Toldos when ninth of 19 here (2m) on latest; still early days for top yard
runners.spotlight: Disputing fourth when falling two out in Gowran maiden hurdle won by odds-on stablemate on debut; behind Los Toldos when ninth of 19 here (16.5f) on latest; still early days for top yard and should improve.

runners.name: Tassarolo
runners.comment: 2l behind Yosemite Gold on hurdle bow; won't need to improve much to play a leading role
runners.spotlight: Ordinary enough on the Flat (rated 64 on AW) but outran large odds when fifth of 15 here on hurdling debut (2m, soft) last month, 2l behind Yosemite Gold; won't need to improve much to play a leading role.

runners.name: Temple City
runners.comment: Looked in need of experience when distant seventh at Kilbeggan on hurdle debut 15 days ago
runners.spotlight: 76-rated Flat maiden in Britain; too keen and paid the price on yard debut at Dundalk in January; looked in need of experience when distant seventh of 14 at Kilbeggan on hurdle debut 15 days ago.

runners.name: Tyder
runners.comment: Hurdles effort at Killarney was full of promise when fifth behind now 123-rated Teriferma
runners.spotlight: 14-race maiden was only beaten 1l on the Flat at Dundalk in March; hasn't built on that but sole hurdles effort at Killarney last August was full of promise when fifth behind now 123-rated Teriferma; not discounted.

runners.name: Yosemite Gold
runners.comment: Ran much better in new headgear combination when fourth here (16.5f, soft) last month
runners.spotlight: 74-rated Flat maiden in Britain for William Haggas; no show first two hurdle outings at Limerick; ran much better in new headgear combination when fourth of 15 at this course (16.5f, soft) last month; enters the discussion.

runners.name: You Played Well
runners.comment: Promise when 7th to subsequent Cheltenham Festival winner Puturhandstogether here in Dec'
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in three Flat maidens; showed promise when seventh behind subsequent Cheltenham Festival winner Puturhandstogether at this course (15.5f, soft) in December; backed from 100-1 into 20-1 when disappointing at Punchestown next time.

runners.name: Kentucky Bluebird
runners.comment: Hasn't shown much in 3 maiden hurdles, although ran a bit better at Limerick last month
runners.spotlight: Hasn't shown much in three maiden hurdles, although ran a bit better at Limerick last month; may need more time.

runners.name: Lucky This Time
runners.comment: No-show in a pair of maiden hurdles; will be one for handicaps; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; triple-figure odds when a no-show in a pair of maiden hurdles; will be one for handicaps.

runners.name: Guess What
runners.comment: Never a factor on hurdle debut at Limerick last month; readily passed over; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; never a factor on hurdle debut at Limerick last month; readily passed over.

runners.name: Wild Wild Wind
runners.comment: Limited appeal on breeding & ran accordingly when tailed off at Limerick on debut; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; limited appeal on breeding and ran accordingly when tailed off at Limerick on debut.

2:15.race_name: Buy Tickets Online At www.corkracecourse.ie Rated Novice Hurdle
2:15.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Watering)

runners.name: Black Heather
runners.comment: Readily won Naas maiden hurdle last month; unlucky on the Flat two days later; big player
runners.spotlight: Ballinrobe bumper winner last summer (good to yielding); readily landed Naas maiden (2m, good to yielding) on hurdling debut last month; slowly away when beaten 0.5l on the Flat at Bellewstown two days later; first run for Gavin Cromwell; big player.

quotes.race: Pat O'Hare Bookmakers Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Black Heather is a smart horse. I've liked him for a long time. He doesn't handle that real winter ground. We have him in on Saturday in a Flat maiden [at Bellewstown] and I don't think he got overextended today so all roads might lead there. He's a lovely dual purpose horse. He's for sale, like a lot of mine, and could be one for Galway - Harry Kelly, trainer.

runners.name: Allo Al Khawaneej
runners.comment: Off the mark on second start for this yard when winning Kilbeggan maiden hurdle; chance
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to Delegator; weak form on the Flat for Owen Burrows but off the mark on second start for this yard when winning Kilbeggan maiden hurdle (15.5f, good to yielding) last month (Following Orders in sixth); this is tougher but he's respected.

runners.name: Chortal
runners.comment: Won a Bellewstown maiden hurdle by 13l last time; has a leading chance at the weights
runners.spotlight: Flat maiden broke his duck in this code at the sixth attempt when landing the odds in Bellewstown maiden (2m1f, good) by 13l four weeks ago, prominent throughout; has a leading chance at the weights.

runners.name: Party President
runners.comment: Perfect two from two since sent handicapping; respected but this demands more
runners.spotlight: Didn't show much in point-to-points or maiden hurdles but was successful on handicap debut at Naas (2m, good to yielding) and followed up two weeks later off 7lb higher at Clonmel (2m1f, good to yielding); this demands more.

runners.name: Following Orders
runners.comment: Below best when 11l behind Allo Al Khawaneej at Kilbeggan but was sent off favourite
runners.spotlight: Placed in a point-to-point; excellent Leopardstown debut second (fourth won since); would have been second at Thurles but for ploughing through the last; below best when 11l behind Allo Al Khawaneej at Kilbeggan but is worth another chance.

runners.name: Ma Belle Etoile
runners.owner: P Haughey & P M Haughey & John Ball
runners.comment: Turned over at odds-on last 2 starts, including on debut for this stable; likes it soft
runners.spotlight: Decent form in bumpers, featuring Limerick win on heavy in November 2023; solid hurdling efforts but turned over at odds-on last two starts, including on debut for this yard on latest; might want it softer.

runners.name: Ask The Bookie
runners.comment: Regressed over hurdles and didn't improve for the switch to chasing; cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Regressed over hurdles and didn't improve for the switch to chasing; 13-race maiden is unlikely to feature; cheekpieces.

runners.name: King In Love
runners.comment: Ready winner at Naas; narrow second after; pulled up sharply after second hurdle on latest
runners.spotlight: Progressive since fitted with a hood this spring; ready winner at Naas (2m, soft) and narrowly beaten on better ground over 2m3f at same venue; pulled up sharply after second hurdle at Fairyhouse which is a concern.

2:50.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Maiden Hurdle
2:50.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Watering)

runners.name: Alpha Zeta
runners.comment: Closely matched with Tiffiny's Girl on Wexford hurdling debut effort; each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Couple of solid runs in bumpers last summer on decent ground at Listowel and Tipperary; respectable hurdling debut when third of 14 in Wexford mares' maiden (20.5f, yielding); closely matched with Tiffiny's Girl on that effort; each-way chance.

runners.name: Cameletta Vega
runners.comment: Daughter of the top-class Quevega; won Galway bumper but regressive since; sights lowered
runners.spotlight: Daughter of the top-class Quevega; won on debut at Galway; limitations exposed in Listed bumpers at Gowran and Navan; made little impact in DRF event won by Bambino Fever; sights lowered on hurdling debut.

runners.name: Cathryns Ruby
runners.comment: Good first run for yard after seven-month break when third over C&D last month; chance
runners.spotlight: Remote third to Aurora Vega here on debut last August; well below that form both starts afterwards on softer ground; encouraging first run for this yard after seven-month break when third over C&D (soft) last month; chance.

runners.name: Danielle D
runners.comment: Career-best when 5th of 20 in Naas mares' maiden hurdle (2m), making good late headway
runners.spotlight: Good run on sole start for former yard in Kilbeggan bumper last June; struggled in four subsequent outings; career-best when fifth of 20 in Naas mares' maiden hurdle (2m) on latest, making good late headway; more needed.

runners.name: Dippedinmoonlight
runners.comment: Had Cameletta Vega and Seo Linn behind when third in Listed bumper at Gowran; big chance
runners.spotlight: Runner-up to Mozzies Sister at Down Royal on debut before readily winning at Downpatrick (2m2f, good); had Cameletta Vega and progressive bumper horse Seo Linn behind when third in Listed bumper at Gowran in October; hurdling debutante looks a real staying type; stable in red-hot form.

stable_tour.quote: She's acquitted herself well in three bumpers, winning at Downpatrick before finishing third in a good Listed race at Gowran which has worked out well with a Cheltenham winner behind her. She's a filly for better ground, so she's on a break and probably won't be back until next summer for a hurdles campaign. We'll mind her as she's only four. 25-11-24

runners.name: Dorans Mill
runners.comment: Sent off at 125-1 for belated debut at Down Royal five days ago and was never a factor
runners.spotlight: Sent off at 125-1 for belated debut at Down Royal five days ago and was never a factor; readily passed over.

runners.name: Doyen Og
runners.comment: Well beaten all six starts, two in maiden hurdles and four in bumpers; hard to make a case
runners.spotlight: Well beaten all six starts, two in maiden hurdles and four in bumpers; hard to make a case for on form.

runners.name: Emily Love
runners.comment: Runner-up of 22 runners at Fairyhouse; deserves to be near the head of the market
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner has run well in defeat in a pair of bumpers at Limerick and on hurdling bow at Fairyhouse last month when runner-up of 22 runners (2m, soft to heavy); deserves to be near the head of the market.

runners.name: Joshsue
runners.comment: Made little impact at Ballinrobe last summer and same story over C&D last month; avoid
runners.spotlight: Made little impact at Ballinrobe last summer and same story over C&D last month; avoid.

runners.name: Kaleo Ametsa
runners.comment: Best run yet at Limerick last month, 5.5l behind Emily Love; more needed on hurdle bow
runners.spotlight: Large odds and never on terms all four bumper starts, but ran best race yet at Limerick last month when sixth, 5.5l behind Emily Love; more needed on hurdle bow.

runners.name: Larkins Lane
runners.comment: No show in a trio of maiden hurdles at 2m3f-3m; looks a future handicap project
runners.spotlight: No show in a trio of maiden hurdles at 2m3f-3m; looks a future handicap project; passed over.

runners.name: Merrywick Lady
runners.comment: Pulled up in all three point starts; first run for new stable; impossible to recommend
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in all three point-to-point starts; first run for new stable; impossible to recommend on rules debut.

runners.name: Pippa Mo Chroi
runners.comment: Down the field in Thurles maiden on debut; unseated rider at the fifth there in November
runners.spotlight: Down the field in Thurles maiden hurdle on debut; unseated rider at the fifth hurdle there in November; hard to fancy.

runners.name: Stylish Composer
runners.comment: Tailed off only start for Nicky Henderson in Warwick bumper; never a factor on Irish debut
runners.spotlight: Tailed off (having forced pace) on only start for Nicky Henderson in Warwick bumper; never a factor on first start for new yard.

runners.name: Tiffinys Girl
runners.comment: 0.75l behind Alpha Zeta when fourth at Wexford last month; Darragh O'Keeffe booked
runners.spotlight: Remote third to runaway winner Whimsy at Gowran (2m, soft) in March; finished 0.75l behind Alpha Zeta when fourth of 14 at Wexford (20.5f, yielding) last month; Darragh O'Keeffe booked for the first time; place possibilities.

runners.name: Tomorrow At Dawn
runners.owner: Michael Odowd/Damien Odowd/Mrs Carolyn Nolan/Aidan Odowd
runners.comment: Wasn't disgraced on debut when seventh at Limerick last month (Emily Love third)
runners.spotlight: Wasn't disgraced on debut when seventh of 14 at Limerick (19.5f, good) last month (Emily Love third), awkward on the first bend when losing ground briefly; not entirely discounted for all major improvement needed.

runners.name: Ladies Well
runners.comment: Never a factor on debut at Roscommon last September; likely to need more time; reserve
runners.spotlight: Reserve; never a factor on debut at Roscommon last September; likely to need more time.

3:25.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Watering)

runners.name: Penny Jar
runners.comment: Won 3 handicap hurdles back in 2022 but losing run since; chance judged on Gowran second
runners.spotlight: Won three handicap hurdles back in 2022 but losing run since; showed he's fairly treated when runner-up at Gowran in October but tailed off back over timber at Navan and fell at the second at Leopardstown in December; handles the ground if he can bounce back.

quotes.race: Kathleen Walsh Memorial Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: All Penny Jar does is stay and he kept at it well - Pat Downey, trainer.

runners.name: Tippinaway
runners.comment: Narrow win in 2m4f Clonmel maiden hurdle last month; tough enough opening handicap mark
runners.spotlight: Tailed off first two outings but built on encouraging fourth of 16 at Thurles (2m) when narrowly winning Clonmel maiden hurdle (2m4f, good to yielding) last month; tough enough opening handicap mark but respected.

runners.name: Friends N Commerce
runners.comment: 21-race maiden; best form on ground with juice in it; market will reveal expectations
runners.spotlight: 21-race maiden; ran okay in defeat over timber before runner-up finish over fences at Thurles in 2023-24 season; best form on ground with juice in it; market will reveal expectations on return from 420-day absence.

runners.name: Idol
runners.comment: Last win in Jan' 2024; needed the run when tailed off here on yard debut but best watched
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner for Willie Mullins; sole win for Sam Curling came off 97 in mares' handicap hurdle at Punchestown (20.5f, soft) in January 2024; needed the run when tailed off here on yard debut but is best watched.

runners.name: Monroes Hollow
runners.comment: Always detached and fell four from home on handicap hurdle debut at Thurles in December
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability in a trio of maiden hurdles but was always detached and fell four from home on handicap hurdle debut at Thurles in December; hails from shrewd yard but hard to fancy.

runners.name: Arctic Piper
runners.comment: Running a nice race in third when a faller at the second-last at Clonmel; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Third in a Ballinrobe bumper last spring; four attempts hurdling have been ordinary enough but was in the process of running a nice race in third when a faller at the second-last at Clonmel; makes handicap debut.

runners.name: Crowsatedappletart
runners.comment: Won at Limerick and over C&D in recent times; leading player for local yard; fair mark
runners.spotlight: Won 2m5f handicap hurdle off 88 at Limerick (good) in October; hit form again in December with C&D victory off 95 (yielding); found only one too good from this mark next time at Limerick; third over fences at Clonmel in March; leading player for local yard.

runners.name: Next Stop Paris
runners.comment: Raced keenly when third of seven at Bellewstown four weeks ago; shout if bouncing back
runners.spotlight: Has run respectably in some strong maiden hurdles; fell when favourite on handicap debut at Fairyhouse; beaten 40l next time at Clonmel; raced keenly when third of seven at Bellewstown four weeks ago; has a shout if bouncing back.

runners.name: Noble Hilltop

prev_owners.owner: Anthony Vaughan & H Jefferies & Mark Phillips

runners.comment: Punchestown winner over 2m4f around this time last year off 95; largely regressive since
runners.spotlight: Punchestown winner around this time last year off 95 (20.5f, good to yielding); largely regressive since, tailed off in three runs on the Flat at the end of last year and never a factor at Kilbeggan 15 days ago; visored.

quotes.race: Thank You To Our Track Team Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Noble Hilltop had bits and pieces of form and we thought there was a little bit of improvement in her. We thought she wanted this trip - Edward Buckley, trainer.

runners.name: Lucky Storm
runners.comment: Heavy defeat in Tramore claiming hurdle on first start for this yard latest; best watched
runners.spotlight: 1-10 over hurdles when trained by Gordon Elliott; won handicap at Bellewstown (20.5f, good) last July off 97; heavy defeat in Tramore claiming hurdle on first start for this yard last month; best watched.

runners.name: Hidalgo Des Mottes
runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie Des Mottes
runners.comment: Looks nicely treated based on placed efforts off marks in the 100s in the summer of 2023
runners.spotlight: Maiden after 17 starts; in the frame several times over hurdles, and looks nicely treated based on placed efforts off marks in the 100s in the summer of 2023; has 234-day absence to overcome.

runners.name: Ballinoe Blaze
runners.comment: Went close off this mark in 3rd at Limerick; 6th has won over fences since; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Struggled off marks in the 100s in testing conditions since sent handicapping but went close off this mark when third at Limerick (21.5f, good) last time, beaten 2.75l; the sixth has won over fences since; shortlisted.

runners.name: Derby Rock
runners.comment: Promise on debut; half-brother to classy Benefficient needs a market check on handicap bow
runners.spotlight: Fifth of 11 in decent 2m Listowel maiden hurdle in September; well beaten over 2m4f at Punchestown next time before distant fifth at Thurles; half-brother to classy Benefficient needs a market check on handicap debut.

runners.name: Tannery Park
runners.comment: Solid fifth at Punchestown around this time last year off 93; good Flat runs since
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose maiden ran a solid fifth at Punchestown around this time last year off 93; good efforts in defeat on the Flat last summer; returns from break off workable mark.

runners.name: Cullagh Pride
runners.comment: Showed promise in couple of maidens in 2023 but has struggled in handicaps; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; showed promise in couple of maidens in 2023 but has struggled in handicaps, pulling up on her last three starts; passed over.

runners.name: Backfromtheraces
runners.comment: Good run at Wexford last time but didn't see out this sort of trip on penultimate; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; fine efforts in defeat in her first two handicaps; good run at Wexford last time but didn't see out this sort of trip on her penultimate outing.

runners.name: Jekiki
runners.comment: 0-6 over hurdles for Harrington; beaten out of sight first 2 starts for this yard; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; 0-6 over hurdles for Jessica Harrington; beaten out of sight first two starts for this yard.

4:35.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Watering)

runners.name: Ask Phil
runners.comment: Late headway when mistake two out halted his run at Limerick last month; should improve
runners.spotlight: Was making some late headway when mistake two out halted his run at Limerick last month on debut; should improve for that.

runners.name: Coup Detat
runners.comment: Bumper form here on good; brother to 3m hurdles winner so could stay
runners.spotlight: Standout bumper effort when second here last October on good (2m3f); not so effective on last month's comeback in similar contest and now upped markedly in trip for hurdles debut (brother won over 3m).

runners.name: Daws Cross
runners.comment: Hooded for debut when jumping let him down at Limerick last month
runners.spotlight: Doyen half-brother to winners Castle Field Boy (2m4f/3m hurdle) and Out The Glen (2m4f-3m1f hurdle/chase); dam placed 2m-2m3f hurdles; hooded for debut when jumping let him down at Limerick last month.

runners.name: Empire Succes
runners.breeder: M Damien Bellanger & M Nicola Bellanger
runners.comment: Disqualifed after winning at Wexford last summer; Clonmel run below best, tries a new trip
runners.spotlight: Made all in 2m4f Wexford maiden last summer but subsequently disqualified for a banned substance; not at that level both starts since, fading quite tamely when strong favourite at Clonmel latest; tries a new trip here.

runners.name: Fancy A Tipple
runners.comment: Half-brother to 2m hurdle winner Roccos Inspiration; market best guide on debut
runners.spotlight: Youmzain half-brother to 2m hurdle winner Roccos Inspiration; dam unraced sister to 3m/3m1f hurdle winner Knighton Lad and 2m/2m1f hurdle winner Curvacious; market best guide on debut.

runners.name: Foxy Rock
runners.comment: Well-bred staying sort but needs to improve markedly on previous two runs; blinkers added
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to the useful Foxy Jacks has been beaten 30l on opening two maiden runs over staying trips; bred to do better in time and blinkers fitted here.

runners.name: Jacovec Cavern
runners.breeder: G Hedley & Mike Channon Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: Fell last when likely winner of 2m4f handicap here in March; major player if staying trip
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner in Britain in 2022 (good/soft); now 0-11 hurdling although healthy lead when fell last in 2m4f handicap here in March (good); well below best at Wetherby since; back in maiden company here and major player if staying trip.

quotes.race: Gardner Mechanical Services Handicap
quotes.quote: We've been waiting all year for this ground and he's very well handicapped in these conditions. He's in the sales next week and should appeal to the jumps trainers, his brother Greystoke has won over hurdles and but Jacovec Cavern is a more athletic type and stays well - Jack Channon, trainer's son.

runners.name: Kasanovas Dream
runners.breeder: M Julien Lebrun & M Anthony Pierre Yves Lebrun
runners.comment: Encouraging Tramore debut over inadequate trip; more expected now upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Buck's Boum 5yo cost 60,000euros as a 3yo; second foal; dam French 1m2f Flat and 2m4f/2m5f chase winner; staying on third on debut over 2m at Tramore suggests he wants a stiffer test and gets it here upped markedly in distance.

runners.name: Native Dream
runners.comment: Recent C&D fourth a step in the right direction although more needed
runners.spotlight: Maiden pointer showed more on third outing hurdling when upped to today's C&D last month albeit well beaten fourth (yielding); more needed however.

runners.name: Rhythmic Tune
runners.comment: Newcomer of limited appeal on breeding
runners.spotlight: Newcomer of limited appeal on breeding.

runners.name: Rowdy
runners.comment: Mild bumper promise in Britain; needs to improve markedly on recent C&D hurdles debut
runners.spotlight: 0-7 in point-to-points; mild promise in a couple of bumpers in Britain for Tom Lacey last year but needs to improve markedly on recent C&D hurdles debut.

runners.name: Skid Row Joe
runners.comment: Behind throughout on bumper debut a year ago; can only be watched on hurdles debut
runners.spotlight: Behind throughout on bumper debut at Ballinrobe a year ago; can only be watched on hurdles debut after such an absence.

runners.name: Sky And Sand
runners.comment: Didn't count when midfield in maiden at Naas and Fairyhouse last month; upped in trip now
runners.spotlight: Brother to bumper/hurdles winner Cappucino made the frame in three point-to-points for Jonathan Fogarty; didn't count when midfield in maiden hurdles at both Naas and Fairyhouse last month; upped in trip here.

runners.name: Je Suis
runners.comment: Recent Limerick run over this trip encouraging but probably more one for handicaps
runners.spotlight: Winner and twice runner-up in points; latest of three maiden hurdle runs (3m Limerick) mildly encouraging but probably more one for handicaps.

runners.name: Nytol
runners.comment: Good second here last month and should appreciate return to 3m; big player
runners.spotlight: Solid level of form in maidens including chasing home (clear of remainder) a decent sort over this trip at Limerick (yielding) and latest when second over inadequate 2m3f in mares' contest here last month (soft); return to 3m to suit and big player.

5:10.race_name: Dine In Our Panoramic Restaurant Handicap Hurdle
5:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Watering)

runners.name: Backonthegoagain
runners.comment: Has struggled in handicaps on soft/heavy; could have more to offer back on better ground
runners.spotlight: Dual point-to-point winner on decent ground but has struggled in handicap hurdles so far on soft/heavy; could have more to offer back on better ground here.

runners.name: Lucky Lioness
runners.comment: Opening handicap effort at Tramore was tame; cheekpieces now fitted
runners.spotlight: Point winner on testing ground; handicapped on good fifth in 2m4f Punchestown maiden (soft) but opening handicap effort at Tramore was tame; cheekpieces now fitted.

runners.name: Driveonwill
runners.comment: Opening handicap efforts at 2m4f give him claims if staying longer trip
runners.spotlight: Hints of ability in maidens and opening 2m4f handicap efforts off this mark have merit; perhaps unlucky not to finish a little closer when fourth in 17-runner Punchestown contest and lost shoe and suffered overeach injury when fourth in a competitive Navan contest in early March; better ground may suit; one to consider if staying longer trip.

runners.name: Kellys Birr
runners.owner: John P Kelly & Eoin Gerard Kelly
runners.comment: No show on last month's Naas return over 2m3f; hard to assess but step up in trip to suit
runners.spotlight: Won 2m6f handicap on her debut for Gordon Elliott at Downpatrick in 2023; off for a year when making no impression in Tramore beginners' chase last May and again no show on last month's return over 2m3f at Naas; hard to assess but step up in trip should suit.

runners.name: No Fussing
runners.comment: Long losing run and ideally wants softer ground
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner at Thurles two years ago, her only success from 23 starts; just mild promise in 2m6f handicap there on latest; wants it softer.

quotes.race: Holycross Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: No Fussing ran well last time and I thought she had an each-way chance - Tim Doyle, trainer

runners.name: Stellar Symphony
runners.comment: Down 3lb since last hurdles run and has favoured ground so don't rule out
runners.spotlight: Both hurdle wins have been at 3m on decent ground, including at Clonmel last October; had looked in handicapper's grasp and belatedly tried over fences at Wexford last month when well held; down 3lb since last hurdles run and returns to better ground so don't rule out.

runners.name: Leading Endeavour
runners.comment: Encouraging handicap debut upped in trip, could have more to offer at 3m
runners.spotlight: Won a three-runner point-to-point by 20l for Shane Roche in November; no impact in maiden hurdles but much-improved when upped in trip for handicap debut at Ballinrobe last month, staying on well in third (2m6f, good); could have more to offer upped further in trip here.

runners.name: Yorkshire Escape
runners.comment: Did too much in front at Tramore last month in first-time visor; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Tricky customer has been pointing without success this year (refused once when leading and ran out another day); headstrong and did too much in front on hurdles return at Tramore last month in first-time visor (now ditched); others preferred.

runners.name: Neska Blue
runners.comment: Mildly encouraging effort on second maiden hurdle run, others preferred on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Placed in a point-to-point; mildly encouraging effort on second maiden hurdle run (2m, good to yielding); back up in trip for handicap debut with tongue-tie back on.

runners.name: Kiln Time
runners.comment: Bounced back to form for recent Naas win at this trip; ideally wants it softer
runners.spotlight: Back to form to record third hurdles win in 3m Naas contest last month, getting up late on ground plenty quick (good to yielding); 5lb higher but still on a fair mark although would ideally want more give in the ground.

runners.name: Free Parking
runners.comment: Maiden 8yo's best bits of form have been on this sort of ground so don't rule out entirely
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 8yo returned from over a year's absence when tailed off at Naas in November and after further break never counted in midfield at Limerick in March; best bits of form have been on this sort of ground so don't rule out entirely.

runners.name: He Might Be Lucky
runners.comment: Tame enough handicap hurdle debut at Limerick last month; lots to find
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner a year ago (soft); tame enough handicap hurdle debut at Limerick last month; lots to find.

runners.name: Heidis Frontiere
runners.comment: Ground okay, stamina unproven at this trip but on a fair mark
runners.spotlight: Improvement in Clonmel handicaps, strong-finishing third over 2m and disputing second when brought down two out in 2m3f contest (good); never counted however at Kilbeggan latest but still one to keep in mind on first attempt at this trip.

runners.name: Wyoming Baby

prev_owners.owner: Maurice Sheehan & Dan Sheehan & William Sheehan

runners.comment: Better chase form of late, one to consider back hurdling
runners.spotlight: Point winner and placed in a bumper; showed little over hurdles but better form over fences of late, placed at Limerick and clear second over 2m6f at Tramore, having had every chance; one to consider back hurdling.

runners.name: Depeche Mo
runners.comment: Best placed form at shorter trips; back from points and tries a new trip
runners.spotlight: Placed at up to 2m3f in handicaps in recent seasons; back from winter break when modest third in Stradbally maiden point-to-point last month and now tries a new trip back hurdling.

runners.name: Moonshine Girl
runners.comment: Lots of improvement needed from recent handicap debut effort at Ballinrobe
runners.spotlight: Showed just a glimpse of ability in maiden hurdles; lots of improvement needed from recent handicap debut effort at Ballinrobe.

runners.name: Roxboro River
runners.comment: Improvement at today's trip at Warwick; one to consider if getting a run; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; improvement when upped in trip on latest in 3m1f Warwick handicap last month, chasing home a ready winner after mistake two out (good); one to consider if getting a run.

runners.name: Evans Secret
runners.comment: Comeback run encouraging, could improve enough to have a say on favoured ground; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; maiden twice went close last summer on decent ground; recent Ballinrobe comeback run encouraging and could improve enough to have a say here on favoured ground.

runners.name: Rose Boum
runners.breeder: Mme Catherine Savare & M Daniel Timmers
runners.comment: Blinkers brought improvement at Ballinrobe on similar ground; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; promise in bumpers and improved in first-time blinkers in 2m6f Ballinrobe handicap last month, forcing much of pace when beaten under 5l (good).

5:45.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF 4-y-o Fillies INH Flat Race
5:45.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Watering)

runners.name: Annarubyrose
runners.comment: Top yard, has to be noted for market support
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam 1m-11.6f Flat (inc AW; RPR 81)/2m hurdle winner, half-sister to winners Racehorse (1m) and Mosstang (5f 2yo), out of maiden half-sister to US 1m1f and 1m2f Grade 1 winner Janet; top yard, has to be noted for market support.

runners.name: Aodhas Arrow
runners.comment: First foal of a bumper winner; best watched unless market suggests otherwise
runners.spotlight: Crystal Ocean filly is fourth foal of a bumper winner, half-sister to bumper and 2m-3m1f hurdle/chase winner Riviera Sun; debutante probably best watched.

runners.name: Boogie On Down
runners.comment: Shirocco filly probably best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: Shirocco filly is second foal of an unraced half-sister to winners Tarqueens Glory (2m hurdle) and Fashionistalady (point), out of unraced sister to 3m/3m1f hurdle winner Knighton Lad; probably best watched on debut.

runners.name: Cinnabar Moth
runners.comment: Plenty keen on C&D debut in March then so could improve if settling better
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; half-sister to six-time winner Frere D'Armes; well-backed on debut here in March under Jody Townend, plenty keen then so could improve if settling better.

runners.name: Circus Hill
runners.comment: Fastnet Rock filly, market best guide on debut
runners.spotlight: Fastnet Rock half-sister to winners Mr Everest (1m4f-1m6f Flat, RPR 90; 2m hurdle) and Acclamatio (1m3f/1m4f; 75); dam unraced half-sister to 1m-1m2f winner Grandorio; market best guide.

runners.name: Double Order
runners.comment: First foal of a point winner; probably best watched
runners.spotlight: Order Of St George filly is first foal of a point winner, a half-sister to winners Daily Present (useful 2m4f-3m2f hurdle/chase) and Go Millie Go (2m6f/2m7f hurdle); probably best watched.

runners.name: Georges Angel
runners.comment: Order Of St George filly; second foal of a French 1m3f-2m winner
runners.spotlight: Order Of St George filly; second foal of a French 1m3f-2m winner (RPR 86), half-sister to French winners Yonna (1m2f/10.5f) and Terre Espace (1m4f/1m7f); likely outsider.

runners.name: Georginas Jet
runners.comment: Half-sister to some useful types including 2 bumper winners; don't rule out
runners.spotlight: Jet Away half-sister to winners The Butcher Said (useful 2m4f-3m hurdle/chase), Carrarea (bumper/2m hurdle) and Jerry From Kerry (bumper); dam unraced half-sister to 2m3f hurdle winner Meetmeathemoon, out of sister to leading 2m hurdler Valiramix; not one to rule out on debut.

runners.name: Jessie Roe
runners.comment: Tailed off on Limerick debut last month; tongue-tie tried now
runners.spotlight: Tailed off on Limerick debut last month; tongue-tie tried now.

runners.name: Jigs And Reels
runners.comment: Highland Reel filly, from family of Champion Bumper winner Fayonagh
runners.spotlight: Highland Reel filly is first foal of an unraced dam, family of Champion Bumper winner and winning hurdler Fayonagh.

runners.name: Master Sydney
runners.comment: Kept on into midfield on recent Ballinrobe debut; noted jockey booking and likely improver
runners.spotlight: Mastercraftsman filly kept on into midfield on recent Ballinrobe debut; noteworthy jockey booking and likely improver.

runners.name: Miss Kingston
runners.comment: Didn't count on recent Ballinrobe debut when just behind Master Sydney in midfield
runners.spotlight: Kingston Hill filly didn't count on recent Ballinrobe debut when just behind Master Sydney in midfield; more needed.

runners.name: Sadies Word
runners.comment: Newcomer best watched
runners.spotlight: Poet's Word half-sister to winners Dreamsoftheatre (prolific 2m6f-3m2f hurdle/chase), Definitly Grey (2m4f hurdle/2m7f chase) and Saracen Beau (2m hurdle); dam unraced half-sister to 10.7f-12.5f Flat and 2m-2m4f jumps winner Dom Fontenail; newcomer best watched.

runners.name: Samba Train
runners.comment: Not discredited in midfield on last month's Limerick debut; could have more to offer here
runners.spotlight: Blue Bresil half-sister to winners Lady Chuffnell (2m hurdle) and Femme Magnifique (bumper/2m3f hurdle); dam 2m4f hurdle winner; easy to back, no threat but not discredited in midfield on last month's Limerick hurdles debut; could have more to offer here in a bumper.

runners.name: Thats So True
runners.owner: F W Healy & Philip Bowe & Ms Margaret Mullins
runners.comment: Nicely bred and top jockey booking so has to be considered
runners.spotlight: Yeats filly cost 14,000euros as a 3yo; half-sister to 2m6f hurdle winner Talk In The Park; dam bumper winner, closely related to smart 2m-2m3f hurdle/chase winner Down In Neworleans, half-sister to smart 2m-2m5f hurdle winner Chomba Womba; nicely bred and top jockey booking so has to be considered.

runners.name: Woodland Adventure
runners.comment: 115,000gns yearling; Flat-bred making belated debut for top yard, obvious appeal
