runners.spotlight: Camelot filly cost 50,000gns as a foal and 115,000gns as a yearling; sister to Japanese 7.5f-1m2f dirt winner Albus Draco, half-sister to 6f and 7f (Group 3) winner Iveagh Gardens (RPR 109); dam unraced half-sister to Coventry Stakes winner CD Europe; Flat-bred making belated debut for top yard, obvious appeal.

runners.name: Super Freak
runners.comment: Half-sister to bumper and 2m5f/3m2f hurdle winner Maid Of The Night; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; Jukebox Jury filly cost 7,000euros as a foal; half-sister to point bumper and 2m5f/3m2f hurdle winner Maid Of The Night; dam placed bumpers/2m2f hurdle, closely related to bumper/high-class 2m-3m1f hurdle/chase winner Menorah.

runners.name: Chosen Comrade
runners.comment: Borris House point winner also due to run at Tipperary on Thursday; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; Walk In The Park filly won Borris House 4yo point-to-point in March for Garrett Murphy; won at Tipperary on Thursday.

4:00.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Watering)

runners.name: The Nagger Reidy
runners.breeder: Mill House Stud & Mr N Farrell
runners.comment: Topweight back to form last month and respected but needs to be more fluent
runners.spotlight: 2m4f Listowel winner on handicap debut last September and back to form last month at Limerick and Naas, cheekpieces worn second occasion now replaced by a tongue-tie; topweight respected but needs to be more fluent.

runners.name: Due Course
runners.comment: Held off this mark over C&D in November, chasing since to no avail; bit to find
runners.spotlight: Two-time hurdles winner last year including over this trip off 99 at Punchestown (good); held off this mark over today's C&D afterwards and been chasing since to little avail; probably has a bit to find at the weights on hurdles return.

runners.name: Tell Nobody Nothin
runners.comment: Ground to suit and recent Down Royal second puts him in the frame
runners.spotlight: Won Downpatrick maiden last autumn and a solid handicap run there next time; back from underwhelming start to chasing career with good second in 2m6f Down Royal novice handicap hurdle last month (good); cheekpieces left off on latest now reinstated.

quotes.race: Downpatrick Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Tell Nobody Nothin travelled great. He had a break over the summer and I'm thrilled with him. We'll take it steady, we'll look for a rated novice with him or something like that - Noel Meade, trainer.

runners.name: Onefortheditch
runners.comment: Fine form last summer; back from winter break but may just need this
runners.spotlight: Notched up back-to-back wins at Kilbeggan and Cork last summer and has remained competitive in the autumn; back from winter break but may just need this.

runners.name: Way Down South
runners.comment: Tough task when running above this mark here last month; may have more to offer
runners.spotlight: Off the mark hurdling in 2m3f Limerick maiden at Christmas but pulled up in Fairyhouse handicap before stiff task when well beaten (ran above handicap mark) in 2m conditions event here last month; may yet have more to offer.

quotes.race: Cuchulainn Maiden Hurdle (In Memory Of Andrew McNamara)
quotes.quote: Way Down South can be quite hard on himself, so we said we'd jump him out in front and see how we get on. I'm delighted it worked out and he is a nice horse for the future - Gillian Scott, trainer.

runners.name: Aurea Fortuna
runners.comment: Okay comeback run at Fairyhouse and probably won't have to improve too much to have a say
runners.spotlight: Placed over 3m and 2m4f in first two handicap hurdle starts at premier tracks (yielding); okay comeback run at Fairyhouse last month and probably won't have to improve too much to have a say here.

runners.name: General Clermont
runners.breeder: S C E A Elevage De Clermont
runners.comment: Good chase seconds last month so entitled to be in the mix here off 10lb lower hurdle mark
runners.spotlight: Kilbeggan hurdles winner (3m) and dual chase winner; returned last month off higher chase mark to finish second at both Limerick and Tramore so entitled to be in the mix here off 10lb lower hurdles mark.

runners.name: Story Rory
runners.comment: Long losing run and well held on yard debut on last month's return; best watched for now
runners.spotlight: Shown nothing in four runs since a handicap hurdle success in 2023 (2m6f Tramore) and well held on yard debut on last month's return; best watched for now.

runners.name: Jeu De Pic
runners.breeder: E A R L Trinquet, Marc Trinquet, Olivier Trinquet
runners.comment: Placed in good-ground maidens last summer, plenty to find on recent handicap efforts
runners.spotlight: Placed twice in good-ground maidens last summer; recent handicap efforts leave him with plenty to find.

runners.name: You Done Well
runners.comment: Back from a break with ground in his favour but trip an unknown
runners.spotlight: Narrowly beaten in good-ground Gowran 3yo maiden last autumn but not at same level since on softer ground; back from a break with ground in his favour but trip an unknown.

runners.name: Aboy Joey
runners.comment: Placed form all on softer ground so going concerns on quicker ground here
runners.spotlight: Maiden was twice runner-up in soft-ground 2m handicaps this time last year; placed at Limerick over Christmas when headgear went on but needs to improve on recent efforts; quicker ground a concern.

runners.name: Mags Nelson
runners.comment: Midfield finishes in all three maiden hurdles; potential improver entering handicaps
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner (yielding) with midfield finishes in all three maiden hurdles; potential improver entering handicaps.

runners.name: T Or Coffey
runners.comment: Not a progressive profile but only a 4yo so improvement can't be ruled out
runners.spotlight: Modest Flat maiden was a fine third on hurdling debut at Killarney last August but hasn't progressed, dropping away tamely at Kilbeggan last time; previous Down Royal run over this trip not without merit so not one to totally rule out.

runners.name: Mister Persistence
runners.comment: Well held on last month's comeback run for new yard; hard to make a case for
runners.spotlight: Well held in maiden hurdles and again in two handicaps, latest after lengthy absence at Clonmel last month for new yard; hard to give a chance to on scant evidence so far.

runners.name: Kingkong Ciergues
runners.comment: Penultimate Fairyhouse second puts him in the mix if handling quicker ground; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; point-to-point winner but little of note hurdling until much-improved when just denied over this trip at Fairyhouse in February (soft); not quite at same level in similar Gowran contest following month but remains off interest if handling these quicker conditions.

runners.name: Mellem
runners.comment: Has to bounce back from below-par recent runs and drops in trip; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; maiden's best run came when close third over 3m at Leopardstown in March (yielding), hasn't got home nearly as well twice since at same trip; back in trip here.

runners.name: The Dooner Citizen
runners.comment: Best efforts when close third over C&D and last month when third over 2m; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; 0-9 over hurdles, best efforts when close third over C&D and last month when third over 2m when forcing it; place claims if getting a run.

2:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (GoingStick: Stands' side: 7.4, Centre: 7.5, Far side: 7.3. Round Course: 6.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Witch Hunter
runners.comment: Big chance on peak form but has failed to win since 2023, which doesn't inspire confidence
runners.spotlight: Good chance on peak form, namely 7f wins at Royal Ascot (handicap) and Newbury (Group 2) in 2023; has failed to score since, which doesn't inspire confidence back in a highly competitive field.

quotes.race: BetVictor Hungerford Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: I was intending to run Witch Hunter in the Great St Wilfrid but I put him in this as well as with the rain coming I thought I might not run Chindit and it might open up for him. I ran Chindit and it still opened up for him so I'm delighted.  He was unlucky not to win at the All-Weather Championships at Lingfield which I thought was his Derby. He's improved all year - Richard Hannon, trainer.

quotes.race: Buckingham Palace Stakes (Handicap)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted for William (Stobart, owner) - he rang me one day and said he'd like to buy a horse to go to Royal Ascot; we got here, 100/1, no chance, and he looked like he had no chance, sitting last, and he's gone and won. It does happen to nice people sometimes. Jamie's given him a lovely ride - I hate the way he rides, why does he keep doing that to us?! He gave Witch Hunter a super ride and the horse kind of enjoyed that. When he passes one he gets his momentum. And when they pass him, sometimes he just goes, sod it, I'll go another day. He's a very good horse on his day and I don't care what price he is - Richard Hannon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: If it's a Saturday, he's probably running in a good race somewhere. He's been a star for us and, if he has an odd bad day, he soon bounces back. I used to think he needed to be held up off a fast pace on a straight track to be at his best, but that's not so rigid anymore, as he's shown us he can do different things and be ridden different ways, including in decent races on the all-weather. He ran moderately in the Doncaster Mile last time but he'll bounce back. 22-04-25

runners.name: Roi De France
runners.comment: Record is largely solid; creditable second on AW finals day most recently; should go well
runners.spotlight: Below par in the 2024 Cambridgeshire but otherwise has a solid record, creditable second at Newcastle (1m) on AW finals day most recently; likely to cope with drop back to 7f on this track; in the mix.

runners.name: English Oak
runners.comment: Sole C&D attempt resulted in a ready success at Royal Ascot last year; interesting
runners.spotlight: Readily justified favouritism in Royal Ascot handicap (sole C&D attempt) last year, continuing his progress; inconsistent since but is interesting returned to this scenario with Haydock reappearance under his belt.

quotes.race: Buckingham Palace Stakes (Handicap)
quotes.quote: English Oak is clearly a classy sort, he travelled superbly through the race. We had a massive advantage on the stands' side, even after going a furlong or so we were a long way ahead of the others. He's very speedy. He's got a high cruising speed, he does feel pretty fast. When I let him go there he quickened up pretty smartly. It will be interesting to see what the guys want to do - James Doyle, rider.

quotes.race: British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: He's a slow-maturing horse who was like a rabbit in the headlights first time. English Oak has seen the trip out really well and is definitely one to keep on the right side - P J McDonald, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: Our confidence is a little knocked after two disappointing runs since Ascot but we still think there's more to come. We felt he had a legitimate excuse in the Lennox, when he lost a shoe, and I was very confident going into the Hungerford but left disappointed. I think tactically I made a hash of it as I was worried about the lack of pace. In hindsight making the running wasn't smart. He'll probably end up going for a Listed race over seven furlongs at Newbury on September 20 and he'll hopefully get a bit of cover this time. We'll also consider the Park Stakes. 11-09-24

He was a bit disappointing after putting up such a good performance when winning the Buckingham Palace at Royal Ascot, so we hope we can get him back on track this year. He's been gelded and I hope that will help him. He's a bit behind and is taking a long time to come in his coat, so we're not in a rush with him. He'll probably start back in a conditions or Listed race. I think he's best at that specialist trip of 7f but we'll see how we go. 16-04-25

runners.name: Ten Pounds
runners.comment: Newmarket reappearance win took his record to 4-6; further progress is plausible
runners.spotlight: Campaigned only over 7f; pestered up front but stuck on well at Newmarket (seasonal debut) most recently, taking record to 4-6; doesn't need to lead; one for the shortlist, with further improvement plausible.

runners.name: Jumby
runners.comment: Smart on his day but losing run goes back to 2023; similar type to Witch Hunter
runners.spotlight: Similar type to Witch Hunter, being a smart 7f performer on his day but without a win since 2023; has something to find on his Newmarket efforts this term and can be opposed.

quotes.race: Sky Bet John Of Gaunt Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Seven furlongs is the right trip, but it's the hardest trip to find and Jumby also doesn't want soft ground, so we have to just pick our way through. He's a brilliant horse who is very good in Group 3s, he's won a Group 2 and there's no reason why he couldn't win another one. He'd have to carry a lot of weight in the Wokingham, but when you see the size of him I don't think weight bothers him very much, so we'll see - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Hungerford Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Jumby has won it like a proper horse. I've always thought he had the pace for six furlongs, but not the gate speed. He's growing up and is a big horse. His form's there to be seen and he could even go a mile, but he loves fast ground and running at horses after a good pace. I'll enter in the Prix de la Foret, but we need to see what the ground is like and he's in the City of York next week, and I'm not ruling it out yet. We could then think about Dubai and Bahrain - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

quotes.race: Wokingham Stakes (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: I'm thrilled. I thought we'd won it. We might run Jumby back quick in the Criterion over seven - I think he wants seven because you can hang on to him longer and you don't need to use that turn of foot. We might go for the Bunbury Cup otherwise and he wants this ground - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

quotes.race: Heed Your Hunch At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: Jumby's form looked strong after Creative Force won at Newbury earlier and he got the job done. We were a bit worried about the ground but it was perfect in the end - William Buick, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He is a real star this fellow and this season is better than ever. Last season he managed to win the Group 2 Hungerford Stakes when rated 106, but I feel his latest two runs when successful in the Group 3 John of Gaunt Stakes at Haydock and second at Newmarket in the Group 3 Criterion Stakes were just as good if not better. He came with a lovely run to win at Haydock but at Newmarket it was hard to believe that a field of six would split into two groups, which is what they did. Jumby won his race on the near side but never saw the winner, Audience, on the far side. The key to him is firm ground, which he bounces off and we will try to make hay as they say during the dry summer months. He has several big entries coming up but I would think the Group 2 Lennox Stakes at Glorious Goodwood next month is the likely next target. 11-07-23

runners.name: Qirat
runners.comment: Record of 12112 over 7f includes a good effort at Ascot; big player back at this trip
runners.spotlight: Record of 12112 over 7f features useful handicap performances at Goodwood (two wins, including reappearance) and Ascot (good second) last term; ran creditably in 1m Listed event final outing; strong contender.

quotes.race: William Hill Most Top Price Runners Handicap
quotes.quote: Conditions hadn't gone Qirat's way but he was at his best back on the easier surface. I've always thought he was well handicapped and with a bit of rain he may well have won the Britannia at Royal Ascot - Hector Crouch, rider, speaking to ITV Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He didn't make it in time for the Lincoln and then the ground was relatively quick for the Spring Mile at Newbury, which was a shame because going round a bend suits him. He's in good form and we'll be looking at the Royal Hunt Cup. The big-field handicaps suit him and he might go up in grade as well. 28-04-25

runners.name: Popmaster
runners.comment: Two defeats in this race emphasise that he's far more exposed than some of these rivals
runners.spotlight: Switches back to turf from AW; has plenty of Ascot form but two defeats in this race (down the field in 2022, seventh last year) emphasise that he's far more exposed than some of these rivals.

quotes.race: Howden Challenge Cup (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Tom Marquand just thought Popmaster had a little look at the other horse and it's so unfair [to be beaten in a photo]. He's running out of his skin at the moment and he's a great servant. If he doesn't run on Champions Day I think we'll put him away for the season but I'll have to speak to Ed Walker - Laurence Bellman, owner.

quotes.race: Wokingham Stakes (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: I've been second in so many big handicaps, an Ayr Gold Cup with Great Ambassador and we were second in the Kensington Palace here this week, and second in a Stewards' Cup. It's so frustrating, but they're so hard to win. Popmaster was spot on for today and I remember saying to Laurence (Bellman, owner) at Chelmsford when we were beaten and so disappointed that might have just won us a Wokingham - because it got his confidence back and we didn't have a penalty. It looked like we had a good draw and Tom gave him a peach of a ride, but we've Ryan Moore to blame! We'll go for all the big sprint handicaps and we hope he's got one in him - Ed Walker, trainer.

quotes.race: Fever-Tree Handicap
quotes.quote: We think Popmaster will be better next year and he's a good fun sprinter, who has been a bit unlucky this year - Laurence Bellman, owner.

stable_tour.quote: We're aiming high with him this season and I think he ran well in the Hungerford. We won't see him at his best until it's soft and with some cut in the ground at Doncaster, I wouldn't be surprised to see him run a huge race in the Park Stakes. 11-09-24
He's been running really well on the all- weather through the winter and has come down to a fair mark. We'll probably run him one more time then give him a break. He wants 7f to 1m. 16-04-25

runners.name: No Retreat
runners.comment: Consistent sort who is 1-1 over 7f and looks interesting on debut for another new yard
runners.spotlight: Spells in Britain and UAE have resulted in overall form figures of 3222212; gelded since last run; sole attempt over 7f resulted in his win; interesting returned to this trip on debut for another new yard.

quotes.race: Free Digital Racecard At raceday-ready.com Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I do 100 per cent feel for the punters that will have backed No Retreat and the connections of him too, but we are dealing with horses. They're live animals and have a mind of their own. He'd only run once before and quickened up smartly to go and win his race. He did lug into Hollie's horse, which is when I put my stick down, and then after that he gets a wobble on and spots the winning line. He goes right to try and avoid stepping on it, and then started to go left hand down and I was mindful of the turn. It's like he got spooked by the winning line. I'm not vigorous up to the line as I'm trying to stay on the horse - I'm trying to keep the partnership intact as best as I can. You can see right on the winning line he judders to a halt. That's what got us beat tonight. When you've got a wayward horse underneath you it's virtually impossible to be in full drive as you're mindful of coming off. These happened in the most crucial strides of the race and people say I should be suspended, but horses aren't machines - James Doyle, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well over a mile at Newcastle in February but looks like a middle-distance horse to me and can hopefully win his maiden. He's entered at Leicester on Saturday and Windsor on Monday over ten furlongs and is likely to run in one of those races. He's potentially a nice horse and I wouldn't write him off just because he didn't win his debut. 25-04-24

runners.name: Ebts Guard
runners.comment: Better than ever at Newbury on reappearance but isn't crying out for drop back to 7f
runners.spotlight: Gelded prior to reappearance success at Newbury, producing a career-best performance; however, has done all his winning over 1m and doesn't seem to be crying out for this drop back in distance.

quotes.race: OLBG Spring Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: It's great to be back and it's our first runner on grass [this year]. I didn't know how fit they all were but Ebt's Guard has been working extremely well. - William Muir, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ebt's Guard has been slightly unlucky in his runs. First time out he got beat half a length and then last time we had to go the long way round - William Muir, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Metal Merchant
runners.comment: Close fourth in major handicap over C&D last July; that form puts him in the picture
runners.spotlight: Last three wins over 1m, most recently the 2024 Spring Cup; however, finished a close fourth in major C&D handicap last July and could go well with Haydock reappearance under his belt.

quotes.race: OLBG Spring Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: I was quietly confident Metal Merchant would run a nice race but in these big handicaps you can be on the wrong side and all sorts, but that was a very smart performance. He was a decent 2yo and 3yo but it wasn't until we gelded him that he really flourished. He's going to be a nice horse to go for those big mile handicaps -  Jack Channon, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing Welfare Classified Stakes
quotes.quote: Metal Merchant deserved that. He's a tough horse who has been at the top of his handicap mark all season. He loves his racing and takes it well but there might not be anything else for him this season. He'll be gelded over the winter and should be a nice horse for those big handicaps next season - Jack Channon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won the Spring Cup at Newbury last year and ran some really creditable races in the top handicaps for the rest of the season. He seems to have come back from his winter break in good shape and he's training really well. We initially thought about the Lincoln, but I think we'll go back to Newbury for the Spring Cup again. He'll campaign in those big mile handicaps. He ran well for a long way in the Royal Hunt Cup at Royal Ascot and all those types of races will be on his agenda. We hope he can pick up one of them. 02-04-25

runners.name: Myal
runners.comment: Haydock win last time took his record in 7f handicaps to 5-5; respected kept to this trip
runners.spotlight: Collared towards the finish in the Spring Mile on reappearance; justified favouritism at Haydock since, taking record in 7f handicaps to 5-5; continues to climb the weights but commands respect kept to this trip.

runners.name: Gleneagle Bay
runners.comment: Low-mileage Irish 5yo; has shown signs that there's a good prize in him; major claims
runners.spotlight: Irish 5yo who still has low mileage; ended last season with two good efforts that suggest he's capable of winning a useful handicap; Curragh reappearance run (1m) suggests this return to 7f will suit; major claims.

runners.name: Silver Sword
runners.comment: All wins over 1m and stays 1m2f; drop back to 7f looks a negative
runners.spotlight: All wins over 1m, the most recent at Meydan in March, and stays 1m2f; has come up short since returned to home soil and this drop back to 7f is unlikely to make a difference.

quotes.race: Burj Azizi (Handicap) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I'm absolutely delighted for Dylan, Caroline [Kelly, work rider] and the girls that are here looking after him. They've been very persistent and it's paid off. There were excuses last time [lost shoe] and I think he's a sensitive boy all around, but he had been running consistently. Ideally you want to be in the middle of them but this horse doesn't like to be bullied and they went quick enough early. I had to go a bit wide but he dug deep when I needed him to - Ray Dawson, jockey.

runners.name: Noodle Mission
runners.comment: Largely productive last term but faces a stiffer task at this level
runners.spotlight: Productive last term, mostly on AW, for new stable until form dipped the last twice; faces a stiffer task at this level on reappearance; gained sole turf win off a much lower mark.

runners.name: Tolstoy

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Sir Robert Ogden

runners.comment: Did well last summer; not in the same form since; best watched
runners.spotlight: Did well last summer, completing a 7f hat-trick at York and scoring over 1m on AW; not in the same form since and is best watched unless the market suggests a revival is likely.

quotes.race: William Hill Extra Place Races Daily Handicap
quotes.quote: Tolstoy is unreal. We might step him up to a mile next as he's not stopping in his races. He's settled now and is grand. He'll come back here for something at the Ebor meeting - Brian Ellison, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Proud To Support Macmillan Handicap
quotes.quote: Tolstoy didn't have a penalty so we thought it was worth giving him another shot. Everything was fine this morning and he was a lot more settled in the paddock today. He was very game in the race - he's tough - Brian Ellison, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tolstoy was well entitled to do that and the race didn't look to have too much depth to it. His last run was good and he likes soft ground. He's quick and I can see him staying over six furlongs - he should get stronger and quicker with a winter on his back - Rab Havlin, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: A recent purchase who hasn't run for us yet. He's a grand horse who ran a lot for Stuart Williams. He wouldn't have the best of feet, but he's fine and has quite good form. He'll run through the summer at Saturday meetings at places like York. 03-04-24

runners.name: Metaverse
runners.comment: Both wins off 4lb lower, including on AW last time; now on career-high mark
runners.spotlight: Has gained both handicap wins off 4lb lower, including at Kempton (7f, AW) last time; needs to prove he can defy the assessor and a jump in grade; now on career-high mark.

stable_tour.quote: He was a late maturing horse but managed to win a maiden this winter. We tried to teach him by dropping him to 6f, but he's now on a break and could be back in May. He could be an improving horse and he's still unexposed. 11-04-24

runners.name: Diligent Resdev
runners.comment: Record is 3-8; ran creditably on reappearance; upped in class but may do better still
runners.spotlight: Effective over 6f and 7f; record of 3-8 features a success in last year's Ayr Bronze Cup; creditable third at Musselburgh on reappearance; faces a stiffer assignment in this grade but may do better still.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Ayr Bronze Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: They went a nice gallop throughout, we got cover and at the three-pole I was looking around thinking 'I'm going well here.' I kept it simple, pulled Diligent Resdev out and he steamed home. He's a very quick horse with a high cruising rate and he powered through the line - Lewis Chalkey, jockey.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Best Odds Daily Cock O'The North EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: I don't think that was expected but Billy (Garritty, jockey) was more confident than David (Easterby, joint-trainer). Diligent Resdev did it really well, I think he was on the best part of the track but there were some very expensive horses in that race, costing the best part of half a million - Lee Westwood, part-owner.

runners.name: Hickory
runners.comment: Some good C&D form when with James Fanshawe but is frustrating; no win since 2022
runners.spotlight: Made the frame a few times over C&D, including in this contest last year, when with James Fanshawe; sold for 26,000gns since last run; however, he's a frustrating sort who hasn't won since 2022.

runners.name: Mafnood
runners.comment: Campaigned mostly at longer trips; enough to prove in this hot 7f handicap
runners.spotlight: Campaigned mostly at longer trips (stays 1m3f); ran creditably at Epsom (8.5f) on stable/seasonal debut but has enough to prove in this hot 7f handicap; wears first-time cheekpieces; 2lb out of weights.

2:05.race_name: Peroni Nastro Azzurro 0.0% British EBF Fillies' Handicap
2:05.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (GoingStick: Stands' side: 7.4, Centre: 7.5, Far side: 7.3. Round Course: 6.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Rainbows Edge
runners.owner: Hm The King & Hm The Queen
runners.comment: Won two of three starts last year and should have more to offer for leading yard
runners.spotlight: Progressive in three outings last year, winning over 1m (AW/good to firm) in her first two before second in 1m2f Salisbury Listed event (good to firm again); lightly raced and from a leading yard, so it's likely she can go on to even better things in 2025; leading claims under William Buick.

runners.name: Arisaig
runners.comment: Won at Glorious Goodwood last year; creditable efforts both starts this term; thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Scored against her own sex at Glorious Goodwood (1m, good to firm) last summer; hasn't advanced her form since but she has performed with credit this season when fifth in the Newbury Spring Cup and a Listed race back at Goodwood (both 1m, good); this looks a slightly easier assignment.

runners.name: Finsceal Luas
runners.comment: 1-10 in Ireland; returns for new yard; raced only on good or softer; probably best watched
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful form in ten starts for Jim Bolger in Ireland, belatedly getting off the mark in Leopardstown maiden (1m1f, heavy) last autumn; quick ground is an unknown and a watching brief is advised on reappearance for new yard unless the betting strongly hints otherwise.

quotes.race: Leopardstown Golf And Driving Range Maiden
quotes.quote: It was a nice set up for bFinsceal Luas today, got a nice lead and she likes a bit of room. I think even going up in trip would suit her better. I said to Jim (Bolger) the last day that when I gave her a crack I don't think she liked it and I said I'd resist that today - Declan McDonogh, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

runners.name: Roarin Success
runners.comment: Runner-up over C&D last year but Newbury reappearance four weeks ago was disappointing
runners.spotlight: Runner-up three times last season, including over C&D, but well held on her 1m2f Newbury reappearance four weeks ago and needs to leave that behind; her peak RPRs have been achieved on slower ground than she's likely to face here.

quotes.race: Village Hotels Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Roarin' Success had a little niggle at the beginning of the year so we've taken out time with her. I thought she'd need that on that ground, so I'm nicely surprised with that performance. We'll stick to a mile and find another handicap - Harry Charlton, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Zapphire
runners.comment: Consistent sort who should be spot on for this after last month's reappearance; respected
runners.spotlight: Has a largely consistent record; left the impression the outing was just needed when 3l third of five on 1m1f Musselburgh reappearance three weeks ago and should be spot on now; has won on good to firm; respected.

quotes.race: Hull Asphalt Handicap
quotes.quote: Zapphire is not winning out of turn. She's not entirely straightforward but she has a decent level of ability. I popped her in a fillies' handicap in a fortnight at Leopardstown and that might be interesting. She loves soft ground so if it rained over there we'd be even happier - Steve Brown, trainer's husband and assistant.

quotes.race: Betfred 'Passionate About Sport' Handicap
quotes.quote: I'm pleased with that. Zapphire has definitely got ability and she's done that well but she can be a bit of a madam - Julie Camacho, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She belongs to the Elite Racing Club and is a talented filly who can be a little temperamental at times. The handicapper was kind to her after her Haydock win last month as the front two were three lengths clear of the rest. She's in good form and is ready to run again soon, preferably with some cut in the ground. 06-09-23

runners.name: Bellarchi
runners.comment: Won this last year; got head back in front on AW in March and fair third on turf latest
runners.spotlight: Took this off 7lb higher last year; lost her way in the second half of last season but back to form to take advantage of a reduced mark on her 1m Southwell reappearance in March; flopped there next time but fair third of five at Nottingham (extended 1m, good to firm) 11 days ago.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C And D) (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bellarchi has really deserved to win a race as she's been good from day one. I was disappointed she didn't win on debut at Thirsk, but she jumps and runs and has a great mind. She does her job but she's bumped into one or two along the way. She pretty much runs to her mark every time, the only time she didn't was in the Marygate and we don't know why - Grant Tuer, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: After plenty of places, she finally got her head in front at Catterick last time out. I was a little frustrated that it took me so long to get her to win, but now she has I think she could add to it. She has a mark of 71, which I think she can defy as there's scope for further progress. I'll speak to her owner and see what the plan might be, possibly running her in a nursery at Carlisle this Friday. If we could find the right race we could go for a novice with a penalty, but we'll discuss it. She's a lovely, straightforward filly who jumps off well and always wears her heart on her sleeve. 30-08-23

3:15.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (GoingStick: Stands' side: 7.4, Centre: 7.5, Far side: 7.3. Round Course: 6.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Houstonn
runners.comment: Clear best efforts were his four on good to firm; close third of nine over C&D last August
runners.spotlight: Nine races, the clear best efforts being his four runs on good to firm and that includes his close third of nine over C&D last August; readily excused his last two starts last season, in the mud; one to consider seriously.

runners.name: Victory Shout
runners.breeder: S A S U Ecurie Des Monceaux Et Al
runners.comment: Ran well on first of two Flat runs for yard; won on good to firm as 2yo; needs career best
runners.spotlight: Ex-Karl Burke; first Flat run for new yard was a good second at Southwell (1m4f, AW) in February and he didn't have the run of the race at Kempton 11 days later when cheekpieces were added; they are absent today and he's been gelded; won on good to firm as 2yo but needs a career best today.

runners.name: Ocean Of Dreams

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.comment: Ex-Aidan O'Brien; step back in the right direction last time and 1m4f now looks worth a go
runners.spotlight: Three races for Aidan O'Brien, showing best form on debut (1m, heavy; scored impressively); sold for 32,000gns in October and gelded; hung right throughout on first run for new yard but staying-on third of nine at Pontefract (1m2f, good) in second-time cheekpieces was a step back in the right direction; needs to build on that but 1m4f now looks worth a go.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Ocean Of Dreams just needed two belts and he was gone. I was very impressed and I think he has Classic potential - Seamie Heffernan, rider

stable_tour.quote: He won at Leopardstown impressively and he's getting ready for the Ballysax. He's working lovely and he's a bit of a baby as he's only had one run. He seems a lovely horse. He has a very good pedigree - he goes back to Urban Sea. I think he's a type for a Derby trial, no doubt about that. 03-04-24

runners.name: Calumet
runners.comment: He did not see out his 1m2f Pontefract race last time as well as Ocean Of Dreams
runners.spotlight: 9l winner of a Windsor maiden (1m2f, good to firm) last July; has run in three handicaps since, best effort on first occasion; had some serious traffic issues on reappearance (1m3f, AW) in March but did not see out his 1m2f Pontefract race last time as well as Ocean Of Dreams; that prompts doubts.

runners.name: Turquino
runners.comment: 2-2 in 1m3f/1m4f AW novice events in March; brings clear potential to handicap/turf debut
runners.spotlight: 11-10 for belated debut when ready winner of a 1m3f novice at Southwell (AW) in March, forging clear late on having run green; 4-9 for novice at Newcastle (1m4f, AW) three weeks later, hanging left and having to battle for a half-length win but the first two were 10l clear and the form has been boosted; closely related to a Yorkshire Oaks winner and brings clear potential to this handicap and turf debut.

runners.name: Wahraan
runners.owner: London Design Group Limited And Partner
runners.comment: Slow starts have become a habit and he can look reluctant to race; still won twice in 2024
runners.spotlight: Slow starts have become a habit and he can look reluctant to race; he still won twice last season (1m4f in June and 1m6f in October) and took a few minor honours on the way; his mood may always be a question and recent reappearance was a heavy defeat, so he's probably not the percentage call.

stable_tour.quote: He's very talented and an absolute rogue. He runs the most extraordinary races. At Southwell last week he was probably 30 lengths behind the last horse. He decided to lock on and ended up finishing third having run the most inefficient and energy-consuming race of all time. He'll drop right at some stage and I've just got to unlock his brain. If we can do that there's a good race in him off 84. 'd like to keep him on next year as we might just have a reset over the winter. I could see him charging through the handicap because he's got a lot of talent. 11-09-24

runners.name: Fireblade
runners.owner: Elb Bloodstock Ltd And R L Banks
runners.comment: Off the mark at first attempt for new yard in handicap at Leicester (1m4f, good to firm)
runners.spotlight: 0-6 for the Gosdens (exclusively in novice events) prior to being sold in January for 38,000gns; scored at the first attempt, however, for new yard when the blinkers were removed for ten-runner handicap at Leicester (1m4f, good to firm) five weeks ago and he battled his way to the front in the final 1f; up 5lb but the form has been boosted and he may well have more to offer.

runners.name: Mighty Bandit
runners.comment: Third wind operation before his creditable fourth of ten to Fireblade at Leicester
runners.spotlight: Third wind operation before his creditable fourth of ten to Fireblade at Leicester (1m4f, good to firm) five weeks ago; there's a swing in the weights (his own mark stays the same) and he has each-way claims.

quotes.race: Remembering Paul "Stan" Stansfield Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted for Mighty Bandit, he tries very hard. He came with a big price tag and I think he could go for some big handicaps in the future - Eddy Greatrex, jockey.

quotes.race: John Lynch Carpets 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Mighty Bandit looks a nice horse. He did two bits of work and got light, so we've done very little with him since. We didn't really know what to expect but you would have to be impressed with that - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.name: My Dream World
runners.comment: Off 289 days; gelded; after just four races he may have more to offer, which is needed
runners.spotlight: Strong late bid to justify odds of 4-9 in a maiden at Haydock (11.5f, good to firm) last June; that was in between two good efforts, albeit wandering when third of six on handicap debut at Sandown (1m6f, good) in July latest; gelded this March; after just four races, may have more to offer.

runners.name: Kotari
runners.comment: Hat-trick last spring, final leg this race; 2lb lower today after his more recent results
runners.spotlight: Sole run on good to firm when runner-up in 2022 in France; registered a hat-trick last spring, the final leg of which was in this race (good) on his only visit to Ascot; 2lb lower today, as his fortunes went on the slide in the autumn and he was well beaten at Epsom on recent return; mixed messages.

runners.name: Night Breeze
runners.comment: Won three in a row over about 1m4f last summer; ran respectably over 1m2f on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Won three in a row over about 1m4f last summer, the final leg on good to firm; 1m2f was not an obvious plus on his return at Haydock two weeks ago but he was a respectable fourth of seven and should build on that.

runners.name: Vaynor
runners.comment: Comfortably held in his last four starts and has been off for 11 months
runners.spotlight: Won off a 4lb higher mark at Thirsk (1m4f, good) in September 2023 but comfortably held in his only four subsequent starts; off for 11 months.

quotes.race: Huttie's Handicap
quotes.quote: I was surprised how Vaynor put the race to bed given he was dropping in trip but we got a nice lead off the Johnston horse and he finished off well - Tom Marquand, rider.

quotes.race: Free Tips Daily On attheraces.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Vaynor has obviously taken a while to get off the mark but he couldn't have done it any better there. I thought they went a good gallop for that grade and he's got a lot of stamina and stuck to his task really well - Daniel Muscutt, jockey.

3:50.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (GoingStick: Stands' side: 7.4, Centre: 7.5, Far side: 7.3. Round Course: 6.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Law Of Design
runners.comment: While this handicap debut should be much more realistic, there are now questions to answer
runners.spotlight: Beat his three rivals in novice here (7f, soft) last September on second start; however, he was last of seven in the Group 2 Royal Lodge at Newmarket (1m, soft) three weeks later and tailed-off last in Listed race there (1m1f, good to soft) last month; while this handicap debut should be much more realistic, there are now questions to answer.

quotes.race: tote.co.uk British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was great. I'm delighted with Law Of Design. He's always shown a lot at home and is a big horse so we'll take stock and decide next week what the next step is. I thought this might be a week too soon, but the ground attracted me and he worked really well this week so I thought we'd get on with it. He's a proper horse I'd say - Brian Meehan, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: The Green Mile
runners.comment: Dropped right out when 40-1 for 1m2f Gr 3 in October; left Crisfords for 80,000gns; gelded
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden at Bath (1m, good) on debut and improved when third of five in a conditions stakes at Epsom (8.5f, heavy) two weeks later; he dropped right out, however, when 40-1 for a 1m2f Group 3 in October; this is his first run since leaving the Crisfords for 80,000gns that month and he was soon gelded; should stay but needs improvement.

runners.name: Brindavan
runners.comment: 1-9 tally and his peak efforts have been on AW over 1m; tried 1m2f at Newmarket last time
runners.spotlight: 1-9 tally and his peak efforts have been on AW over 1m; there's plenty of hope for this trip in his pedigree but he raced freely and underperformed when trying it in small field at Newmarket last month.

runners.name: Chartwell Jock
runners.comment: Carries head rather high but 2nd of six on turf/handicap debut at Doncaster (1m2f, good)
runners.spotlight: Three AW runs in the winter, making all in Wolverhampton maiden (9.4f) on third occasion; carries his head rather high but second of six on turf/handicap debut at Doncaster (1m2f, good) six weeks ago was improved form and he should not be far away.

runners.name: Caledonian
runners.comment: Produced late to win a nursery at Southwell (7f, AW) in November; plenty of hope for 1m2f
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a Yarmouth maiden (7f, good to firm) on second start; flopped next time but bounced back when produced late to win a seven-runner nursery at Southwell (7f, AW) in November; up 4lb but that performance and his sire give plenty of hope for 1m2f.

stable_tour.quote: He's a horse for the future. He's been running over seven furlongs but he should get further no problem. He was second to a horse of James Fanshawe's, Back In Black, who I think is quite good. He should be winning his maiden sooner rather than later. 04-09-24

runners.name: Cape Breton
runners.comment: More professional to win on final 2yo start; gelded since; pedigree suggests he will stay
runners.spotlight: 450,000gns Frankel yearling; seemingly well below market expectations on first two starts, inclined to pull hard and hang right at Newmarket on second occasion; favourite nevertheless for novice at Lingfield (1m, AW) in November and he helped set the pace before keeping on to win by a head; gelded since; pedigree suggests he will stay; could still prove capable of better.

runners.name: Kokanee
runners.comment: Up 4lb but he still has plenty of potential after tidy win in a 1m2f handicap at Beverley
runners.spotlight: Progressive in three 1m-1m2f AW novices late last year; gelded before reappearing in six-runner handicap at Beverley (1m2f, good) last month, racing freely and still looking inexperienced but ending up a tidy winner; up 4lb but he still has plenty of potential.

stable_tour.quote: He's a huge horse by Kameko. I thought he was clueless around Beverley last time - apparently there were slits in the grass and he kept looking at them - but he still won despite doing everything wrong. I think he outstayed them and I hope he'll improve as the season goes on. He has big feet and big thighs, so he's not a horse for firm ground. He's a junior model of Superposition and he's my trainer's pick. 30-04-25

5:00.race_name: Peroni Nastro Azzurro 0.0% Blue Ribbon Handicap (Div I)
5:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (GoingStick: Stands' side: 7.4, Centre: 7.5, Far side: 7.3. Round Course: 6.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Smart Vision
runners.owner: J E Abbey And New Vision Bloodstock
runners.comment: All wins at 7f but fully effective at 6f; down in grade but needs extra off current mark
runners.spotlight: Mostly leads; has done his winning over 7f on AW and turf (good to firm and good) but little in it as to whether he's better at that trip or 6f; drops in grade but this could be another step too far off current mark.

runners.name: Northcliff

prev_owners.owner: S Bulmer, P Hebdon & R Taylor

runners.comment: Won this last year; wide-margin wins last week; up 7lb for latest; sold 20,000gns since
runners.spotlight: Won this last year but rather trod water later until a visor replaced cheekpieces back on turf last week, scoring by wide margins at Wetherby and Brighton (6f); left Michael Keady for 20,000gns since; can't be ruled out but the weights task is heavier now, 7lb higher than last time.

runners.name: Dashing Dick
runners.comment: Made all for both 6f wins; tailed off on reappearance at Leicester; best watched
runners.spotlight: Made all for both 6f wins on turf (good and good to firm); still 5lb higher than the latest of them last July and was said to have moved poorly when tailed off on recent Leicester comeback; best watched.

runners.name: Dream Of Mischief
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs Cotton / Mrs Suzanne Conway
runners.owner: Mrs F Cotton, Mr & Mrs P Conway
runners.comment: All 3 wins at 7f and 1m but lost out only narrowly in first 6f handicap (AW); can go well
runners.spotlight: All three wins over 7f and 1m but he showed no lack of early speed in his first 6f handicap, on Kempton AW 19 days ago, when he didn't give an inch in a tight finish; looks worth persevering with at this trip and has a good run in him.

runners.name: Mesaafi
runners.comment: Will be suited by the return to 6f but looks to have his share of weight
runners.spotlight: Flourished over 6f on AW for former trainer when blinkers were first fitted, beating Northcliff in cosy fashion at Newcastle in January; not so effective over 5f at Newmarket on yard debut in April and although the return to 6f will suit he looks on a highish mark now.

runners.name: Lir Speciale
runners.comment: Useful at 6f and 7f in 2022 and 2023; had tough time in 2024; signs of revival in February
runners.spotlight: Useful over 6f and 7f in 2022 and 2023 but he had a hard time of it last year despite taking a brisk drop in the weights; encouraging yard debut on Southwell AW in February on penultimate start and, although he never threatened at Newcastle in March, he isn't ruled out back on turf.

runners.name: Mumayaz
runners.comment: Two 6f AW wins this year and one at 7f (turf) last week; needs more off 3lb higher
runners.spotlight: Three wins already this year, two of them over 6f (AW) and one over 7f at Brighton (good to firm) last Tuesday; ran without a penalty at Brighton again the next day but never in contention behind Northcliff; a 3lb higher mark asks for extra.

quotes.race: knees.co.uk Home And Electrical 145th Anniversary Handicap
quotes.quote: Jack [Doughty] gave Mumayaz a lovely ride. He's been consistent all year. He had a great all-weather campaign and we've been very pleased with him - Tony Carroll, trainer.

quotes.race: Grant Thornton Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Mumayaz was planned to sit in the first three but they went very hard and I rode him with confidence. He's quite versatile and we've always liked him, he seems to have turned a corner. He's an honest horse - Chris Hayes, rider.

runners.name: Rebel Path
runners.breeder: S A S U Ecurie Des Monceaux Et Al
runners.comment: Consistent on AW since 6f win in February; unexposed on turf; chance on best 2024 form
runners.spotlight: Consistent since 6f win on AW in February; seen less often on turf but he had bits of form last summer off similar marks to today's that would see him involved; often apprentice ridden but Rossa Ryan takes over.

runners.name: Arnaz
runners.comment: Solid form at 6f in 2024 and on return; stiff test at 6f can suit; should improve further
runners.spotlight: Sole win over 7f at Brighton last May but he bettered that form in defeat over 6f later, when looking likely to improve for a stiff test at the trip; returned to action with a good second of 17 at Haydock (good) two weeks ago when having to be switched then run down late on; raised 2lb to a career-high mark but can improve further; in-form yard won this in 2019.

runners.name: The Caribbean

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

runners.comment: Won over 6f/7f in Ireland as 2yo; mostly poor since but down weights and better latest
runners.spotlight: Won over 6f and 7f in Ireland as a 2yo; a lost soul for much of the time since but he had dropped a long way in the weights when running his best race for this yard when second of ten at Wolverhampton (7f) in January; worth a look for trainer who's won two of the last nine runnings.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Rated Race
quotes.quote: The Caribbean has run in some good races and we thought after his last run at the Curragh that a step up to seven furlongs would suit him. The conditions for this race worked out nicely for him - Chris Armstrong, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Dicko The Legend
runners.owner: Mrs S Hibbert, Foulrice Park Racing Ltd
runners.comment: One turf win; has had few chances at 6f on good or quicker ground; 1-1 for Hollie Doyle
runners.spotlight: Just one win on turf but he's had few chances over 6f on good or quicker ground and excelled himself when beating a big field at York (good to firm) last July, the only time Hollie Doyle has ridden him; in the melting pot back on turf.

runners.name: Jackson Street
runners.comment: Broke duck in only his 2nd 6f handicap, on AW in December; never involved on yard debut
runners.spotlight: Broke his duck in only his second 6f handicap, on Newcastle AW in December, but never involved on yard debut in January; others are more likely.

4:25.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (GoingStick: Stands' side: 7.4, Centre: 7.5, Far side: 7.3. Round Course: 6.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Morrophore
runners.comment: Carries her head high and has also flashed her tail but she catches the eye today at 1m2f
runners.spotlight: Improved for step up in trip when easily landing a 9.4f novice at Wolverhampton (AW) in October; she's inclined to carry her head high and also flashed her tail on handicap debut at Southwell (AW; weak 9-1) 13 days ago under Luke Catton but the return to 1m was also clearly against her as she finished strongly to be a close third of eight; catches the eye today at 1m2f.

runners.name: Wisper
runners.comment: Last won in May 2023 but on the premises most starts in 2024; has left Marcus Tregoning
runners.spotlight: Five of her six wins were at Brighton and the latest was in May 2023; on the premises most starts in 2024 (nearly all 1m2f) for Marcus Tregoning and her new yard is in good form, so she could be seriously involved again.

runners.name: Miss Dolly Rocker
runners.comment: Reliable; 3-21 for Roger Teal, with last season's win at Bath (11.6f) off 4lb lower
runners.spotlight: Reliable sort who was 3-21 for Roger Teal, with last season's win at Bath (11.6f) in September off 4lb lower than today; exposed and seemingly needs to find a bit extra on this first start for new stable.

runners.name: Pasha
runners.comment: Behind on stable debut (7f, AW; 18-1); now hooded as well and moves back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Sole win (nine races) was a 1m maiden on good to firm at Nottingham last August; rather mixed in her five handicaps since, with two minor honours over 1m2f on AW; sold out of the Cole yard for 20,000gns in January and behind at Newcastle (7f, AW; 18-1) three weeks ago; tongue tied last four starts; now hooded as well and back up in trip.

runners.name: Aiming High
runners.comment: Running well on AW lately and similar level in one of her 2024 turf races (good to firm)
runners.spotlight: Has popped up in front where it matters once in each of the last four years, doing it smoothly this March over 1m4f on Wolverhampton AW; close third at Kempton (AW) one week later and she ran to a similar level in one of her turf races (good to firm) last term, so she's in serious contention for a second win in this campaign.

stable_tour.quote: She loves the all-weather and is due to run this week at Kempton on Wednesday. She loves fast ground and accumulates prize-money in her own little way. She's found out as soon as she hits a mark of 80 but while she's in the 70s she's competitive. 04-09-24

runners.name: Rock Camelot
runners.comment: 2nd on 1m2f handicap debut at Wetherby; lightly raced 3yo who should still progress
runners.spotlight: Four starts, easily her shortest price when always-prominent second of nine on handicap debut at Wetherby (1m2f, good to firm) 13 days ago and that's her best form; up just 1lb, still in need of improvement but she's a lightly raced 3yo who should still be open to progress.

1:30.race_name: Peroni Nastro Azzurro 0.0% Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
1:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (GoingStick: Stands' side: 7.4, Centre: 7.5, Far side: 7.3. Round Course: 6.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Military Code
runners.comment: 5f Newmarket debut winner; useful prospect for his very much in-form stable
runners.spotlight: Wootton Bassett colt who made a winning start to his career in a novice at the Newmarket Craven meeting (5f, good; 6-1) last month; useful prospect who sets a decent standard for the newcomers to aim at.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We came here with a bit of confidence, although he went on the drift in the market, which is probably just been the week we've had. Military Code had done some nice work, as a physical specimen you can't fault him and we've got a couple of two-year-olds around him that we like as well so hopefully they're a little group who will come along together. He was a bit green at the start but he's done it professionally and picked up well. We'd hoped he'd be an Ascot type - Charlie Appleby, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Arjack
runners.comment: Newcomer who represents last year's winning connections; betting informative
runners.spotlight: 72,000gns Ardad half-brother to 1m 2yo winner Storm Alice (RPR 60); dam unplaced at 5f-7f (47), half-sister to winners Gilt Edge Girl (5f Group 1 Prix De L'Abbaye) and Godfrey Street (5f 2yo Group 2); the stable won this race last year with a newcomer in these silks.

runners.name: Astrazar
runners.comment: Starman colt; best watched on debut unless the betting hints otherwise
runners.spotlight: £25,000 yearling by Starman; first foal of a mare who was placed over 7f on AW as a 2yo; best watched unless the betting vibes are strong.

runners.name: Bassenthwaite
runners.comment: Bred to go a bit and the yard had a winning newcomer in these colours recently
runners.spotlight: Ardad colt; dam 6f AW winner from a family which has served the owner well; the stable had a first-time-out 2yo winner in these colours at Leicester a couple of weeks ago, so market support would be interesting.

runners.name: Celestial King
runners.comment: Newcomer who cost a whopping 1,750,000gns at the Craven Breeze-Up sale last month
runners.spotlight: This Havana Grey colt cost a whopping 1,750,000gns at the Craven Breeze-Up sale last month; useful dam won on her 2yo debut; it will be very interesting to see how strong the betting vibes are.

runners.name: Old Is Gold
runners.comment: 200,000gns breeze-up purchase; joined a leading stable and needs a betting check
runners.spotlight: 200,000gns breeze-up buy last month by Mehmas; the first foal of a 5f winner (RPR 72); joined a leading stable and needs a betting check.

runners.name: Fitzella
runners.comment: Makes paper appeal for yard which has had a first-time-out 2yo winner this year
runners.spotlight: £170,000 yearling by Too Darn Hot; half-sister to three winners, including Admiral Nelson (Listed-placed 5f/7f, including 2yo/AW; RPR 100); dam 6f/6.5f 2yo winner (including Listed; 100); the stable has had a first-time-out 2yo winner this year.

5:35.race_name: Peroni Nastro Azzurro 0.0% Blue Ribbon Handicap (Div II)
5:35.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM (GoingStick: Stands' side: 7.4, Centre: 7.5, Far side: 7.3. Round Course: 6.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Counsel
runners.comment: Had purple patch on AW in February; not quite so good back on turf last month; more needed
runners.spotlight: Three good AW runs in February, winning 5f handicaps at Lingfield and Wolverhampton before coming up just shy in his hat-trick bid at Southwell; form dipped on turf last month and he'll need better back up to 6f.

runners.name: Invincible Speed
runners.comment: Better than ever the last twice and should make another bold bid
runners.spotlight: Produced a strong late burst to win at Lingfield on April 1 (6f, AW); similar form when third at Leicester two weeks ago, showing he could be just as effective on turf; needs a career best to win but that's not out of the question in his current form.

runners.name: Jimmy Speaking
runners.comment: C&D win last May off the same mark; wide draw when below par latest; Oisin Murphy booked
runners.spotlight: Won a C&D handicap 12 months ago off this mark; of interest on that run and he also shaped with promise on his seasonal return last month; a lesser effort 13 days ago but he was drawn wide; the booking of Oisin Murphy points to a more prominent showing today.

runners.name: Sondad
runners.comment: Good 2nd at Leicester two weeks ago; needs more up 2lb but a new visor could help matters
runners.spotlight: Finished in front of Invincible Speed when the pair were second and third at Leicester a fortnight ago (6f, good); needs a bit more to defy his revised mark but the addition of a visor could help.

runners.name: Indian Creak
runners.breeder: Mount Coote Stud & New England Stud
runners.comment: Only occasional flashes of form in 2024; starts out for new yard off a reduced mark
runners.spotlight: Solid sprint handicapper for the Channons over the years; only occasional flashes of his old self in 2024 but he has dropped in the weights as a result; can win races for his new stable (same owners) but coming back from 249 days off is perhaps not the time to catch him.

quotes.race: Luxury Lodges For Sale At racecoursemarina.com Handicap
quotes.quote: I think Indian Creak could be a horse on the up. Last year he didn't have the speed for six furlongs, but he's got stronger this year. Hopefully there's a future over this trip for him and he handles all ground. There are no plans; we'll look for something in a few weeks, while he'll likely be gelded over the winter as the owners like to race their horses on - Jack Channon, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Spanish Star
runners.comment: Went the wrong way in 2024 but on a dangerous mark if he's ready to roll after a break
runners.spotlight: Ran well on his reappearance at Newbury last April but that was a rare bright spot in 2024; the handicapper has given him a real chance (last turf run came off 9lb higher) and this strong traveller may well capitalise soon; younger rivals may have his measure here though.

quotes.race: Winners Wear Cavani Handicap
quotes.quote: Spanish Star has been unbelievable. He goes on soft ground and quick ground. He is just incredible. We thought he was quite high in the handicap and to be honest he hasn't run well round here before. He has run twice here before with no luck but we thought we would take the gamble and give it another go. He has got to be held up and come in the last half a furlong really. The longer you can hold on to him the better. Rhys (Clutterbuck) got the rail and he was just amazing. A lot of horses we have had have been at their best at six, seven or eight. I think he is better over six furlongs when the ground is very soft but it was quick today and I was worried it was a bit too quick. I think we will probably look at something at Royal Ascot now - Philippa Chamings, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Doom Bar Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Spanish Star has been going so close and finished second ten days ago at Nottingham so it's brilliant to see him win again. He's been a very lucky horse for us but very unlucky at the same time as he was disqualified twice last year, which must be almost unheard of - Shirley Symonds, part-owner.

quotes.race: F45 Bath No Contract Required Handicap
quotes.quote: Spanish Star had a lot of placed form last year without winning and he has obviously improved a bit for his winter break. The race might have fallen apart behind him but he has done well to win - Liam Keniry, rider.

runners.name: Strike
runners.breeder: S Emmet And Miss R Emmet
runners.owner: S Emmet And Miss R Emmet
runners.comment: Three 6f wins on fast turf in 2024; sharper for reappearance; R Hornby replaces apprentice
runners.spotlight: Won three 6f handicaps on fast turf last year; drawn wide when fourth at Kempton (7f) on his reappearance last month; Rob Hornby back on board this afternoon and a big run could be forthcoming.

runners.name: Justcallmepete
runners.comment: Low-key stable debut two weeks ago but suspicion he'll fare better with blinkers back on
runners.spotlight: Ran well in his one visit here (May 2022); low-key stable debut two weeks ago (behind a couple of reopposing rivals) but you don't have to go far back to find form that gives him good claims; Jack Dace is excellent value for his 7lb claim; could go well with blinkers returned.

runners.name: Last Outlaw
runners.comment: Two 5f wins for M Wigham but stays 6f; new yard quick to fit a tongue-tie; interesting
runners.spotlight: His two wins for Michael Wigham came over 5f but he has form at today's trip; sold for £16,500 in February; interesting contender on stable debut with a tongue-tie fitted.

quotes.race: British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: First time out at Doncaster I just let Last Outlaw find his feet early on and he ran on really nicely, despite hanging away from competition late on. I was confident he'd step forward from that and he was much more straightforward in the closing stages, though I'd expect him to come on again for that run - Sean Kirrane, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Land Of Magic
runners.comment: Front-runner; won twice last year but fast ground is a concern on her reappearance
runners.spotlight: Front-runner; two wins (7f on good and 6f on good to soft) last year; absent since a disappointing run on heavy (handles it well) 197 days ago; something to prove on good to firm.

runners.name: Collusion
runners.comment: On the up on AW this spring; into a deeper race today but could have more to offer
runners.spotlight: New yard has found the key to him and he comes here chasing a four-timer after 6f AW wins at Wolverhampton (two) and Kempton (bare form can be upgraded); improving and a 4lb rise is fair but this is a deeper race.

runners.name: Phoenix Moon
runners.comment: Improving filly but she's into a much stronger race today and is 4lb out of the handicap
runners.spotlight: Two 6f wins at Lingfield in the second half of 2024; pleasing reappearance at that track 17 days ago but she's up in class and has much more on her plate in this race from out of the handicap.

3:55.race_name: Pertemps Network Spring Trophy Stakes (Listed Race)
3:55.going_detailed: Hurdle course - GOOD; Flat course - GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (Inside track) (GoingStick: Hurdle 7.4, Flat 7.7) (Watered)

runners.name: Alyanaabi
runners.comment: 3yo season ended on a low note but he's smart at his best; gelded ahead of reappearance
runners.spotlight: Group 3 winner as a 2yo, when also second in the Group 1 Dewhurst; matched that form when fifth in the 2,000 Guineas and St James's Palace on his first two outings last year but his campaign ended with below-par efforts over 1m2f and 1m1f; gelded ahead of this reappearance back down in trip; bold show assured if anywhere near his best.

quotes.race: Native Trail's Dewhurst Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: Jim (Crowley) said Alyanaabi wasn't in love with the ground, but I don't think Aidan's horse was either. We said it was perhaps the ground at Ascot, but it might have been that he went a bit weak on us and he wasn't quite himself that day. There is only one Dewhurst so you have to have a go at it and he has run a great race. It is a long time until the 2,000 Guineas and hopefully it will be faster ground, but it looks like Aidan's horse will be better on faster ground. It hasn't dented my faith in him and we can't be too disappointed - Owen Burrows, trainer.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Stakes (Registered As The Somerville Tattersall Stakes) (Group 3) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: I thought a furlong out Alyanaabi might run on and be placed but when Jim (Crowley) got the gap he took off. On reflection he would have been an unlucky loser and we thought he was better than he had shown at Ascot last time. He's in the Dewhurst and we'll see how he comes out of this, but he could come back here next month if the ground is like this - Owen Burrows, trainer.

runners.name: Annaf
runners.comment: Smart operator who was placed twice at Listed level on AW over the winter
runners.spotlight: Bagged a big prize over this trip in Saudi at the beginning of 2024; has failed to match that very smart RPR since, including only sixth in this year's running of that Saudi race, but even the level he achieved when placed in AW Listed races this winter would make him very competitive here.

quotes.race: Saudi National Bank 1351 Turf Sprint (Group 2) (4yo+) (Inner Track) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It's all down to Rossa, not my training. Anaaf keeps improving and keeps surprising us. Where we go next, God knows, but he's got that invitation to Japan and we'll possibly go there. These big meetings are becoming quite a habit really. It really feels like the sky's the limit. These international wins mean so much because it really does put the yard on the map -  Mick Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: John Guest Racing Bengough Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I love everything about Annaf. He's something else and he loved getting shifted about and being taken off his racing line today. He's really thriving and you have to give it to Mick Appleby and his team. He's been on the go since the start of the year and has not missed one beat - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfred Portland (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Annaf has been a star to me this year. My only concern was the ground and I knew the race was going to be ridden to suit him perfectly. He's a classy horse and a lot of people are forgetting he was third in the King's Stand and I'd imagine one of those nice Group races will fall for him. To do this off topweight on ground he didn't like, took some doing - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

quotes.race: BetUK Kachy Stakes (Listed Race) (All-Weather Championships Fast-Track Qualifier)
quotes.quote: It wasn't the plan to miss the break like that with Annaf but he did it well in the end. The plan is to go straight to all-weather finals day at Newcastle, although he could be a nice horse on turf later on - Mick Appleby, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him out of Owen Burrows' yard as an unraced two-year-old and he has taken his time to get there. He won twice on the all-weather last year and ran some fine races on turf without winning, but he has really thrived on the all-weather this winter. After a break we brought him back in January at Lingfield, where he won over 6f, and he has since added to that with wins at Kempton and in the Listed Kachy Stakes at Lingfield. Clearly he has improved with age and, although he has risen to a mark of 108, there may be a little more to come and I'd hope to campaign him similarly this summer to last. Before he resumes on the grass he'll go for the 6f race at the all-weather finals meeting on Good Friday, where I hope he'll be hard to beat. 22-03-23

runners.name: Array
runners.comment: Group-winning 2yo but off 546 days prior to 4l third in Thirsk conditions race last month
runners.spotlight: Group 2 winner on heavy ground as a juvenile but well behind Alyanaabi in the Dewhurst on his final 2yo start and not seen again until 4l third in a Thirsk conditions race (7f, good) four weeks ago; entitled to come on for the run; going firmer than good would be an unknown.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Mill Reef Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Array is super relaxed and has really improved from race to race. He got through that ground and hopefully he'll continue to go the right way. I just said to Andrew (Balding, trainer) that I'd love to try him over a little bit further - Oisin Murphy, jockey, talking to RacingTV

quotes.race: JenningsBet British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was like a piece of work for Array, whose dam is a half-sister to Frankel. He won everywhere bar the line at Goodwood last time and it was nice for him to get a win on the board. He has some nice entries and a big future - Anna Lisa Balding, trainer's wife.

quotes.race: British EBF 40th Anniversary Maiden Stakes (IRE Incentive Race) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: A little unfortunate - he's still learning, and I think the winner had the benefit of the rail, which helped, but Array has done everything right without winning. He's a smashing horse and will hopefully have a long career - Andrew Balding, trainer.

runners.name: Kikkuli
runners.comment: Couldn't build on significant early promise at 3 but still time for him to come good
runners.spotlight: Looked an exciting prospect when narrowly denied in last year's Jersey at Royal Ascot (7f, good to firm) on just his fourth start; that made his three subsequent defeats (including fourth to Tiber Flow in Hungerford at Newbury) a little underwhelming but no surprise were he to bounce back with a bang on reappearance for a stable in very good form.

quotes.race: Haras d'Etreham Prix Jean Prat (Group 1) (3yo Colts & Fillies) (Straight Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Ryan [Moore] said Kikkuli was beautifully relaxed for the first two furlongs, but when the two groups joined together, something rushed upsides him and got him too competitive in the middle of the race, which meant he just didn't have that kick in the final furlong - Harry Charlton, trainer.

quotes.race: Jersey Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: We're delighted with Kikkuli. Oisin said it was a bit of a head up, head down - he rode him to follow Haatem and Doyler [James Doyle] on a miler started stretching two down, and Oisin said he's run great. It's a shame to be second twice, but we won't take anything away from the horse, he's run great against a hardened Group One horse who's had a lot more experience than him. Oisin said seven or eight furlongs. I think actually what looked key there was having pace. He travelled probably the best of them; he enjoyed the pace and the quick ground.  I watched them down at the start and he was probably the one horse not sweating. He's from an exuberant family [Kikkuli is a half-brother to Frankel], and by Kingman, and this lad is absolutely bombproof - Harry Charlton, trainer.

quotes.race: Alex Scott Maiden Stakes (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: There is no rush with Kikkuli but Ryan said he would get a mile and we could look at something like the Listed Heron Stakes at Sandown in May - Barry Mahon, racing manager to Juddmonte.

runners.name: Tiber Flow
runners.comment: Won a C&D Group 3 and Newbury Group 2 last year; good shout if close to best on return
runners.spotlight: Won Group 3 John of Gaunt over C&D last June and returned to form to land Group 2 Hungerford at Newbury (7f, good to firm; Kikkuli fourth) two months later; probably unsuited by very testing ground when well held in French Group 1 final start; escapes a penalty for those Group wins but he's taken a couple of runs to find his best form in the last two seasons.

quotes.race: BetVictor Hungerford Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: I thought Tiber Flow was dead at York - it was awful. I took my shoes off and ran down the track and he came cantering past me with his ears pricked. We saw him in the stables afterwards and it didn't seem to bother him. He's the most extraordinary horse. He must be hard as nails. He's tough as old boots.  He's a legend. He ran the next time at Haydock and pushed his way out to get the win. He's absolutely brilliant. I couldn't be more proud of him. He's such a star. He wants to win, which is a hard trait to find it in a lot of horses. I can't get over him - Maureen Haggas, wife of trainer William.

quotes.race: Betfred John Of Gaunt Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: As Tiber Flow gets older he's getting better as he's travelling easier. Going round the bend kept him interested as he usually runs over 6f. I'm not sure there's anything for him at Ascot, but William and the Aisbitts will work it out - Maureen Haggas, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: JenningsBet Chipchase Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: It was hard work. Tiber Flow just ground it out and he's a sweet horse with a great temperament. He's just a thoroughly nice horse and the Aisbitts (owners) have bred some smart horses. We'll see how he is and what the ground is like, but William will work it out where to go next - Maureen Haggas, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Carnarvon Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Tiber Flow is a bloody tough horse [came through health problems as a youngster] and I think at Newcastle last time - and this is no disrespect to Karl Burke's horse (El Caballo) - but I don't think our fella knew how to sprint. They injected pace at the wrong time for him and he was a little bit flat-footed before coming home. He's learning how to sprint now and hopefully he comes on again. He'll be a 12-1/16-1 shot for Ascot, but is the type of horse to run well. Tom said he got there too early. We'll also put him in the Jersey and see, but Tom felt he had the speed today. Both races will be fiercely competitive. I don't know if he'd go on the soft, but I think he'd be okay. He's just a nice horse - William Haggas, trainer.

3:20.going_detailed: Hurdle course - GOOD; Flat course - GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (Inside track) (GoingStick: Hurdle 7.4, Flat 7.7) (Watered)

runners.name: Ziggys Condor
runners.comment: Running well over 6f in this visor and the return to 7f may be a good move
runners.spotlight: Made all in first-time visor (retained since) at Southwell (6f, AW) in February and a respectable fourth the next twice (6f, AW/good); has run well over 7f previously and the step back up in trip may be a good move.

runners.name: Bajan Bandit
runners.comment: 2 AW wins earlier this year; didn't stay 1m2f latest; this C&D winner could be in the mix
runners.spotlight: Two wins at Southwell (1m/7f, AW) earlier this year and latest run can be excused by 1m2f trip; this fast-ground C&D winner could be in the mix now back down in distance.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Extra Places Every Day Handicap
quotes.quote: Bajan Bandit made all when he won at Haydock then we were duped by a shower of rain half an hour before the race last time there and held him up. This looked a competitive event but he won well enough. At some point we'll try him over a mile again but there's no rush - Grant Tuer, trainer.

quotes.race: Due Diligence Standing At Whitsbury Manor British EBF Blagrave Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was very straightforward, very professional and Bahan Bandit travelled nicely. We thought we would sit back before getting a tone of the race but when the split came he got his head down and found the gap nicely. He was a little bit green at one stage, but his raw ability came through and he has hit the line strong. The ground is a touch quick for him so he will improve and he will come on massively from this run. He will improve with a bit more ease in the ground, but it shows that he is a good horse and he will go on anything - Cieren Fallon, rider.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him out of Richard Hannon's yard and when he arrived here he had a mark of 79 but his first run for us was disappointing. We felt a mile stretched him then and dropped him to 7f, which proved to be the right thing as he won at Haydock on his second run. He added to that at York in July off a mark of 80 and he's now shot up to 87. We tried him again over a mile last week at the Ebor meeting as there were no 7f alternatives and he ran a cracking race. That trip on fast ground is definitely him and it looks like there could be a big prize in him. He has a touch of class and it is onwards and upwards. Looking ahead there are options at Doncaster and York to consider. 30-08-23

runners.name: How Impressive
runners.comment: The return to turf may be a negative but the reapplied visor is a plus; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Better strike-rate on AW than turf and well beaten in first-time blinkers at Southwell (AW) last time, but he's now back in blinkers in which he twice went close at Southwell (7f) earlier this spring; not ruled out.

runners.name: Oriental Prince
runners.comment: Four AW wins this year; hasn't run badly on turf the last twice but needs something extra
