runners.spotlight: Four AW wins this year (5f/6f); hasn't run badly on turf the last twice (7f/6f, good/good to firm) but needs something extra to win this.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a brilliant all-weather season. We're at a crossroads with him because we're not sure if he's done enough or not, or if we need to change tactics. He's hard to catch on the all-weather but the turf is slightly different to the all-weather and we're not sure if we're going too hard or not hard enough. He's still quite an exciting horse. If you look at the sectionals at Musselburgh in a very strong race last month it was very good. We probably used up a lot of petrol with Gweedore and I think if we'd have been left alone then we'd have been first or second. That's Ayr Gold Cup form and we're taking on Class 2 handicappers, so he's interesting. He's obviously very fast. 07-05-25

runners.name: Brazilian Rose
runners.comment: Three AW wins in January; needs to transfer form to turf but she's not discounted
runners.spotlight: Three wins at Newcastle (6f, AW) in January and short-headed there (7f) in March; switched to front-running tactics there (7f, AW) last time and ran pretty well in fifth of 14; showed promise last September on her second start and sole run on turf (soft); not discounted.

runners.name: Abduction
runners.breeder: Skymarch Farm Inc & Ecurie Des Charmes
runners.comment: Well handicapped but hasn't shone on recent starts and his losing run is up to 16 races
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on last year's best turf form and returned from break with close third at Southwell (7f, AW) in February; however, three lesser runs have followed and his losing sequence is up to 16 races.

stable_tour.quote: He joined us earlier this month from Charlie Wallis and his first run at Musselburgh was very encouraging when third of 11 over 7f. He ran even better than that last week at Doncaster when beaten only one and a half lengths. For a horse who needs the race to be run at an end-to-end gallop he did not enjoy proceedings on Town Moor as they crawled most of the way before it developed into a sprint, so all things considered it was a fine effort. Both of his runs for me have been over 7f but I am trying him over a mile at Carlisle on Wednesday. His current mark of 73 is very fair and I would be very hopeful of him winning before long. 22-06-22

runners.name: Byzantine Empress
runners.comment: C&D winner who returns from a break with yard among the winners; chance
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D (good to firm) last August and showed some promise in December among her first three runs for this stable; ran well first time up last season and returns from a break with yard among winners; chance.

runners.name: Vince Le Prince
runners.comment: Three turf wins last season and could bounce back with a big run now reverting to grass
runners.spotlight: Well beaten at Southwell a fortnight ago but that was also the case on his only other AW encounter; won three times on turf last season and reappeared with solid fourth at Musselburgh (7f, good) earlier last month; could bounce back with a big performance now reverting to grass.

quotes.race: Spreadex Racing In-Running Spread Betting Handicap
quotes.quote: There is quite a stiff side and head wind now, but he still picked up lovely. I know he's also won at Redcar and Catterick, but he probably has more strengthening to do and confidence to gain - Faye McManoman, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Callianassa
runners.comment: Knocking on door prior to getting off mark at 27th attempt; not ruled out up 3lb
runners.spotlight: Knocking on the door prior to getting off the mark at the 27th attempt under Archie Young at Southwell (7f, AW) a fortnight ago; it remains to be seen if the return to turf will suit but she ran well on grass earlier in her career and is not ruled out up 3lb.

runners.name: American Bay
runners.comment: Fair run on stable debut in March but well beaten the next twice; has to get back on track
runners.spotlight: Won Redcar novice (6f, good to firm) last September and has run well over 7f in the past; fair effort on stable/seasonal debut at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) in March but well beaten the next twice; has to get back on track.

runners.name: Dutch Kingdom
runners.comment: Better on AW but has a much lower turf mark and is not written off
runners.spotlight: Disappointing at Southwell (6f, AW) a fortnight ago and inferior on grass (on which he's 0-7); however, he has a much lower turf mark and showed some promise at Thirsk last May; displayed career-best form when winning at Southwell (7f, AW) two starts ago and is not written off.

runners.name: Follow Your Heart
runners.comment: Two AW wins this year; lower turf mark, but couldn't take advantage last summer
runners.spotlight: Two 7f AW wins from his last four starts; has a lower mark to work with on turf but he had two similar opportunities last summer and was unable to take advantage; 9-40 on AW as opposed to 1-12 on turf.

2:45.going_detailed: Hurdle course - GOOD; Flat course - GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (Inside track) (GoingStick: Hurdle 7.4, Flat 7.7) (Watered)

runners.name: Magellan Cloud
runners.comment: Reappeared with creditable third on handicap debut at Musselburgh and could be in the mix
runners.spotlight: Won at Redcar (7f, soft) last November on third and final 2yo start and reappeared with a creditable third on handicap debut at Musselburgh four weeks ago (1m1f, good; unraced on faster), despite hanging right; open to further improvement and could be in the mix.

runners.name: Boston Run
runners.comment: Runner-up on handicap debut over C&D a fortnight ago and could continue to progress
runners.spotlight: 0-5 but pretty consistent last year and runner-up in first-time cheekpieces (retained) on handicap debut over C&D (good) a fortnight ago; could continue to progress and he's one to consider up 3lb.

stable_tour.quote: He's been gelded, which I hope makes a difference, and has strengthened up over the winter. He handles cut in the ground but should handle better ground too, and he should win some races. 09-04-25

runners.name: Kirkdale
runners.comment: Only 4th on h'cap debut but that run may have got freshness out of him; retains potential
runners.spotlight: Built upon the promise of his first two runs (good to soft/good; including here) to win Catterick novice (7f, soft) last October; held in fourth on last month's seasonal/handicap debut at Southwell (7f, AW) but that run may have got the freshness out of him; yard won this in 2023; retains potential.

runners.name: Footwork
runners.comment: Won Kempton nursery last October and could show benefit of recent Goodwood reappearance
runners.spotlight: Showed promise on fast ground here last August and won at Kempton (7f, AW) in October on second handicap start; fair fifth on reappearance at Goodwood (1m, good) last Saturday and could show the benefit of that run today.

runners.name: Never Let Go
runners.comment: Solid third over 7f at Wetherby on handicap debut and shapes as though 1m could suit
runners.spotlight: Won at Wolverhampton (7f, AW) last December on second run and reappeared with solid third in Wetherby handicap (7f, good to firm) a fortnight ago; shapes as though 1m could suit and in-form trainer has good record here.

runners.name: Defence Missile
runners.breeder: White Birch SC & Lynch Bages Ltd
runners.comment: Consistent 2yo campaign but beaten a long way on last month's stable/seasonal debut
runners.spotlight: Consistent (albeit winless) in five-race 2yo campaign for Eve Johnson Houghton; may have needed last month's stable/seasonal debut at Musselburgh but beaten a long way and needs to leave that run miles behind.

runners.name: Pappa Louis
runners.comment: Won on nursery debut last August but well beaten on both starts since; a visor goes on
runners.spotlight: Won four-runner race on nursery debut at Newmarket (7f, good to firm) last August and it's too soon to write him off, but he was well beaten on his final 2yo start and it was the same story on last month reappearance at Newmarket; a transformation is needed in a first-time visor.

runners.name: Rosemary May
runners.comment: Won Ayr maiden 12 days ago; useful pedigree suggests she could be capable of better still
runners.spotlight: Kept on for promising fourth at Thirsk (7f, good) last month on second start and won at Ayr (1m, good) 12 days ago; makes handicap debut off fair mark and useful pedigree suggests she could be capable of better still.

4:30.going_detailed: Hurdle course - GOOD; Flat course - GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (Inside track) (GoingStick: Hurdle 7.4, Flat 7.7) (Watered)

runners.name: Lever Up
runners.comment: Shaped well on 1m handicap debut and big player if staying the much longer trip
runners.spotlight: Stayed on for a creditable fourth on his handicap debut and reappearance over the extended 1m at Nottingham (good) last month; this is a significant step up in trip but he leaves the impression that he'll stay further and that his best days are ahead of him.

runners.name: Too Darn Seanie
runners.comment: No impact in three qualifying runs but could come into his own in handicaps
runners.spotlight: No impact in three qualifying runs over 1m2f this spring but the type to come into his own now handicapping up in trip (dam won Lancashire Oaks over C&D).

runners.name: Navalanche
runners.comment: In good hands and likely improver now handicapping after a break
runners.spotlight: Comfortably held in three outings over 1m2f on AW but he more than hinted at ability and rates a potential improver in handicaps back from four months off (gelded).

runners.name: Is I Right
runners.comment: Promise when fourth in 1m2f AW handicap on reappearance; this longer trip should suit
runners.spotlight: Stayed on for an encouraging reappearance fourth of 14 in 1m2f Chelmsford handicap on Good Friday; first-time cheekpieces worn on that occasion are retained; this longer trip promises to suit.

runners.name: Requiem
runners.comment: Only seventh on 1m2f handicap debut but the fact he was favourite suggests better expected
runners.spotlight: Only seventh when favourite for his 1m2f Yarmouth handicap debut and reappearance on good to firm 18 days ago but evidently thought capable of better; goes up in trip again; it'll be interesting whether his supporters return.

runners.name: Rosso Levanto
runners.comment: Failed to build on debut promise at 2 but retains potential for handicaps
runners.spotlight: Failed to build on her debut promise in two subsequent outings as a juvenile but there are a couple of useful performers in a pedigree which suggests this longer trip will suit now handicapping,

runners.name: Havachoc
runners.breeder: The Rumble Racing Club - White Chocolate
runners.comment: Three runs over 7f this spring, hinting at ability on debut; up in trip for handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Displayed ability when under 6l seventh of nine on 7f debut at Southwell in April but always behind in two turf outings over the same trip since; up significantly in trip for handicap debut.

1:35.race_name: Pertemps Network Swinton Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
1:35.going_detailed: Hurdle course - GOOD; Flat course - GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (Inside track) (GoingStick: Hurdle 7.4, Flat 7.7) (Watered)

runners.name: Givemefive

prev_owners.owner: Any Excuse For A Holiday Syndicate

runners.comment: Made all over C&D three weeks ago; up 5lb and has a bigger field to deal with now
runners.spotlight: Has won both races since the tongue-tie joined cheekpieces, latterly making all for a narrow success over C&D three weeks ago (good); a 5lb rise isn't the end of the world but dominating this bigger field with likely pressure up front could be challenging.

quotes.race: JCB Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Final Handicap Hurdle (Series Final) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Fair play to Paul, he said why don't we get Givemefive qualified for the Challenger series? He thought this track would really suit him and it has - he gave him a brilliant ride. He could well come back for the Swinton Hurdle.  The tongue tie is down to Hollie Doyle. She rode him two starts ago on the Flat at Lingfield and said he was holding his breath, try him in a tongue tie - Harry Derham, trainer.

quotes.race: Masterson Holdings Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Givemefive has been a fabulous little horse and well found by my cousin Megan [Nicholls]. From the first day we jumped him we knew we'd have some fun. I'm really proud, he's never let us down and this was a plan we've had for a long time and it's paid off. I won't do big handicaps until after Christmas, there's a race for four-year-olds at Fairyhouse next month or we leave him alone. He's got good days ahead of him and I'd love to run him in a Betfair Hurdle - Harry Derham, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Adonis Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with Givemefive. He has run a screamer and there are lots of options but I'd be surprised if he went to Cheltenham as he's had a fair tear up there - Harry Derham, trainer.

quotes.race: Hazelton Mountford Insurance Brokers Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were hoping Givemefive might go and run in the Fred Winter and you could go for the Adonis (Juvenile Hurdle at Kempton Park) before that. Entries close for the Triumph Hurdle tomorrow and I'm going to enter him after winning like that carrying a penalty. To run in the Fred Winter he needs to have another run. If he didn't need to have another run then I would almost certainly run him in the Fred Winter - Harry Derham, trainer.

quotes.race: Download The Rhino.Bet App Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Givemefive held modest form on the Flat, but we loved his last performance. He stayed going well and with a juvenile you need a horse who stays well. He's loved jumping from the start, which is a big advantage, and the form of his last race reads well, so we hoped he'd do that and he did it nicely - Harry Derham, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: We were delighted with his win at Cheltenham last weekend. It was the first time we rode him tucked in behind and he settled. His target after Christmas will be the Betfair Hurdle and whether we go to Fairyhouse at the end of November is up for debate. He has a fabulous attitude. 01-11-24

runners.name: Our Champ
runners.comment: Excellent front-running third at Plumpton latest; Haydock will suit his style
runners.spotlight: Loaded with experience in strong handicaps; won last year's Sussex Champion and, returning to Plumpton off a 13lb higher mark for the same race 20 days ago, he ran another cracker in forcing the pace before left behind by two Willie Mullins raiders; Haydock will suit his style provided he doesn't get too competitive too far out; shortlisted.

quotes.race: Foundation Developments Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (Challenger 2m Hurdle Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I came here pretty confident. I'm usually a pessimistic bugger but I rode Our Champ myself in a bit of work the other day with Aucunrisque and he went extremely well. We don't usually have them off the bridle but Aucunrisque was struggling and I weighed two stone more than the lad on him. There's loads of options for him. I might look at those novice Graded races as time goes on, he's a very experienced jumper and races like the Dovecote could be an option. He's got plenty of pace - Chris Gordon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's doing great and will probably go for the Gerry Feilden Hurdle at Newbury on Coral Gold Cup day. He's done us proud. He was fantastic last time out at Ascot, so Newbury will be the aim as long as we get better ground still. I wouldn't want to run him on too soft; like Annual Invictus, he's a better-ground horse. After that we might look at something like the Betfair Exchange Trophy at Ascot next month. 25-11-24

He'll go for the County Hurdle and he'll run really well if it dries up. He's in good form and is in good order, but we'll want better ground with him than it was at Newbury for the William Hill Hurdle. If we get good ground at Cheltenham on the last day, he'll be handy and prominent and I'll be looking forward to a good run. 26-02-25

runners.name: Shes A Saint
runners.comment: In-form mare who needs a strong pace to chase at this trip and she's likely to get one
runners.spotlight: Stays 3m so always needs a strong pace to chase at this trip, which was the case when winning so well in a big field at the Aintree Grand National meeting (good); never threatened at Plumpton latest but again ran well in keeping on for fifth (behind Our Champ); could well arrive late on the scene to play a part in the finish.

quotes.race: Hallgarten And Novum Wines Handicap Hurdle (Conditional Jockeys'/Amateur Riders' Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I had a conversation with the two owners about an hour ago, and while I wasn't saying we definitely shouldn't run on the ground I wasn't convinced it was going to suit her. Deciding to run today is down to them and I take my hat off to them. I'm so proud of She's A Saint. It just shows what can happen when you give them a bit of time when it's needed. And she's got a great ride off Tristan [Durrell] as they've gone very hard in front - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's taken her racing really well. She won the other day and was down at the last and then stayed on. She's got solid form behind Luccia. She'll be going and she'd have an outside chance. I'm happy with her. 12-2-23

runners.name: Ooh Betty
runners.comment: Likeable mare and has never been in better form; might just get outpaced around here
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer who raised her profile last season and, after getting outpaced, she was coming back at the leaders when a close third in the Scottish Champion Hurdle at Ayr (good to soft); there's a suspicion that something similar might happen here on drying ground but she's a likeable mare.

quotes.race: Bet £10 Get £10 At PlanetSportBet Mares' Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Mares' Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Ooh Betty has won three of her last five races and she's a decent mare. Quick ground is imperative to her and we'll try and find another race in three or four weeks - which is optimistic - otherwise we'll give her a break. Even good to soft is too soft for her - Ben Clarke, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She ran in the Imperial Cup, finishing in the middle of the field behind Go Dante. She's stepped out of novice company this season and has just improved and improved, winning two £20,000 handicaps. She's 15.1hh and is all speed. She'd probably just see out 2m4f on a flat track. We might look at the Scottish Champion Hurdle at Ayr and her season might finish with the Swinton. The wind operation last  summer has certainly helped, but more importantly she needs good ground to be seen to best effect. 12-03-25

runners.name: Glory And Fortune
runners.comment: Will do well to defy a 4lb rise in this deeper race but he'll give it his best shot
runners.spotlight: Winning for the first time since the 2022 Betfair Hurdle when digging deep to edge out Helnwein at Chepstow two weeks ago (2m, good); will do well to defy a 4lb rise in this deeper race but he'll give it his best shot; cheekpieces added.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Christmas Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a massive run - but Glory And Fortune has thrown his handicap mark out of the window. I think they have just gone very fast on soft ground. I don't think he has improved 20lb, anyway - Stan Sheppard, rider.

quotes.race: EBF Stallions & Cheltenham Pony Club (A Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race) (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: We're not going to overrace Glory And Fortune. It's all very well thinking festivals, but we want to look after him - look at the size of him. He's a huge, big unit and it wouldn't surprise me if we didn't run again this season. We'll see how he is in the spring, but he won't be out until mid- to the end of March. I think looking after him will help mentally and physically. he clearly has a huge amount of natural ability. The Aintree bumper could be a possibility, but I'd just be worried now about losing him mentally - Tom Lacey, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I didn't think he ran too bad in the Greatwood Hurdle and I'm not sure he handles the undulations at Cheltenham. He's better than that and he's having a little break now. We'll look to run him through late spring and we may have another pop at the Betfair Hurdle at Newbury. 22-11-21

He lifted us to new heights last season when winning the Welsh Champion Hurdle and Betfair Hurdle. We took him back to Ffos Las last month, but the ground was too quick for him. We subsequently took him to Cheltenham for a hot Grade 2 novice chase where he jumped the first four fences like a seasoned handicapper, but when he missed the fence past the stands he went to pot. He's not an easy ride as he can throw his head back but I'll not be put off by that and we'll persevere over fences. We'll give him some intensive schooling over the next few weeks before hopefully bringing him back at Christmas. I've not lost any faith in him and believe he can be a very effective chaser. 30-11-22

runners.name: Welsh Charger
runners.comment: Arrives here having been on the top of his game and this sharp test won't faze him
runners.spotlight: Continued a good run of form when a length winner of the Scottish County Hurdle at Musselburgh and was only just behind Ooh Betty in the Scottish Champion at Ayr (again on good to soft; fine on good); on the top of his game and this sharp test won't faze him.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a massive flagbearer for us. He's a proper terrier who puts in 100 per cent effort every time he runs. He's been a revelation as we've found he's improved again this season. Things didn't go quite right for him at Newbury on his penultimate start but we tried to be a bit clever by changing his bit and how we rode him slightly and we came away disappointed. We went back to what we know and brought him back to 2m at Musselburgh. He's a strong-travelling 19-02-25

runners.name: Helnwein
runners.comment: Good run in defeat last time but he might be a shade high in the weights to win this
runners.spotlight: Back over hurdles for his last two runs after going 0-4 over fences; appreciated the return to 2m when pushing Glory And Fortune all the way at Chepstow last time (2m, good); might be a shade high in the weights to win this.

quotes.race: Watch On Racing TV Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted. Helnwein will come on a bundle as well, mine are needing a run and there's a lot of improvement to come. He's a lovely horse and has done everything so easily at home, he never comes off the bridle and those are the ones that tend to get quite tired. I'm not getting carried away and I've no plans at the moment but he could possibly run in an introductory hurdle if I find one - Alan King, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's an exciting horse. He won a good novice handicap hurdle at Sandown on the last day of last season and we're sending him chasing. He's had a good summer and has been schooling well. With his current mark, he'll probably start in a novice handicap and we'll see where he goes. We'll keep him to two miles for the moment. 25-10-24

He's an exciting prospect for fences. He won a good novice handicap hurdle at Sandown on the last day of last season and he's always looked the sort who would take to chasing. He's had a good summer and has been schooling well. He'll head to either Aintree or Sandown this weekend. We'll keep him to 2m for the moment. 07-11-24

runners.name: Anyharminasking
runners.comment: Strong in the market when returning to form with a comfortable success at Newcastle
runners.spotlight: Headed to Newcastle five weeks ago with a lot to prove but he was strong in the betting and had no trouble in brushing aside his four rivals (2m1f, good; cheekpieces returned); back up 4lb but he had dropped to a handy mark before that and this good ground could be the key to him.

stable_tour.quote: He's always threatened to win a nice race but just hasn't quite done it yet. He ran very respectably on his comeback at Cheltenham and we might head to Haydock on Betfair Chase day for a 2m3f handicap hurdle next. There's a chance he'll go over fences at some point this season but, while the ground is good, there are races over hurdles for him between two miles and a two and a half. 06-11-24

runners.name: Dr T J Eckleburg
runners.comment: Last season was a good one over fences and he's 5lb lower for this return to hurdling
runners.spotlight: Better known as a chaser these days but last season was a good one in that discipline and he was by no means disgraced in the always-strong Red Rum at Aintree; 5lb lower for this return to hurdling.

stable_tour.quote: A nice staying type who should make up into a lovely middle-distance horse. He went close going up in trip at Ripon despite not handling the track. He could improve throughout the year. 10-05-21

We bought him for a bit of sport during the summer and he's taken to fences well. He was possibly gifted the race by the runner-up at Worcester in September but it was a good performance. He'll be great fun throughout the winter. He's quietly going the right way and we're very happy with him. 02-11-23

We did have him in at the five-day entry stage at Haydock last Saturday but we didn't declare him and we'll wait for Chepstow on Friday. He's just a very consistent, genuine fellow - he's won his nice pot now at Haydock last time out, and we'll just continue to run him in those 2m, and maybe 2m4f, races throughout the season. Hopefully he'll continue to give a good account of himself. 24-12-24

runners.name: Bareback Jack
runners.comment: Formerly smart and appeared to turn a corner when winning nicely at Bangor
runners.spotlight: Won three on the bounce before fourth in a Grade 2 during his novice days; very low key on his first two runs back after an absence but then won comfortably under an enterprising ride at Bangor (2m, good to soft) 16 days ago when tongue tied for the first time, beating Dance And Glance; back up 6lb but may have turned a corner and he looked classy in his younger days.

quotes.race: bet365 Scottish Supreme Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bareback Jack is a horse we've always liked and that ground is sticky enough for him. As Mr Leslie says we have to get the runs into him. He's a lovely horse. He's not a natural front-runner and he wasn't slick over the last but he's got a fair engine. I'll leave future targets to Donald - Brian Hughes, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's been off for a long time after getting hurt before he was due to run in a Grade 1 novice hurdle at Aintree in 2021. He was very good and it has been on and off ever since, but he's back cantering now. 12-11-24

This fellow is very smart and I can't wait to get him back on track. Last season he joined us after winning his point-to-point at Punchestown and quickly notched up a hat-trick of novice hurdle wins. On his final start at Kelso in the Premier Novices' Hurdle he could not handle the ground. I had been aiming him for the Grade 1 at Aintree, where I think he would have gone there as a serious player, but he picked up an injury (a fracture) that has kept him off since. He's back in work and looks grand. We'll give him a racecourse gallop somewhere and if he comes through that we will make plans, but I do rate him highly. 10-11-21

runners.name: Big Boy Bobby
runners.comment: Running well but he might just lack a telling finishing kick on this flat track
runners.spotlight: Flat/hurdle winner; returned from a long absence to bustle up Ooh Betty at Kempton over Christmas and has continued to run well, last time going down by half a length at Cheltenham (2m1f, good); might just lack a telling finishing kick on this flat track.

stable_tour.quote: He showed winning Flat form for Roger Charlton and is a big, scopey gelding who is one for juvenile hurdling later in the year. 03-11-21

runners.name: Black Hawk Eagle
runners.comment: Beaten by Goblet Of Fire at Hereford recently and looks handicapped about right
runners.spotlight: Looks handicapped about right on the balance of his form and he couldn't reel in Goblet Of Fire at Hereford (2m, good) recently; perhaps placed at best if he's lucky.

quotes.race: Boyle Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Black Hawk Eagle did it well enough in the end. I got left in front plenty early enough but he jumped well. I was very happy with him - Simon Torrens, rider.

runners.name: Goblet Of Fire
runners.comment: Did it easily at Hereford but whether he's up to this class is another matter
runners.spotlight: Six-time Flat winner and it was his third success over hurdles when doing it fairly comfortably at Hereford (2m, good) recently after a break; whether he's up to this class is another matter and he's 5lb higher.

stable_tour.quote: He hasn't missed a beat all summer and just got beaten at Wolverhampton this month when going for his fourth win on the Flat since he last ran over hurdles in May. He still looks fantastic and we'll see which way to go as he continues his summer/autumn campaign. 22-10-24

runners.name: Tapley
runners.breeder: Stephen Kemble Bloodstock Ltd & G Peck
runners.comment: On a losing run of eight and he's held by some of today's rivals
runners.spotlight: 3lb lower than for his last win, at Plumpton in October 2024; hasn't been overly threatening in the meantime and he's held by some of today's rivals.

runners.name: Lanesborough
runners.comment: This represents quite a rise in class but he's a progressive 6yo in good hands
runners.spotlight: Progressive 6yo from a strong yard but this is much tougher than the Warwick race he won in February (2m3f, soft) and today's ground will be the driest he's encountered; still commands some respect.

runners.name: Dance And Glance
runners.comment: Runner-up on handicap debut at Bangor (good to soft) when Bareback Jack got away from him
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced and has won a bumper and two hurdle races; runner-up on handicap debut at Bangor (good to soft) when Bareback Jack got away from him; he wouldn't be exposed just yet and Harry Cobden is a positive booking.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well in the Newbury sales bumper before winning at Plumpton. He's schooling nicely and is one to look out for. 14-11-24

runners.name: Lunar Sovereign
runners.comment: Just over 3l behind Big Boy Bobby at Cheltenham latest; runs off the same mark for this
runners.spotlight: Long absences are a feature in this 9yo's profile; kept on for fourth of 16 at Cheltenham (2m1f, good) on latest start, finishing just over 3l behind Big Boy Bobby; looks vulnerable off an untouched mark.

quotes.race: First Race Special On Sky Bet Tomorrow Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm impressed with Lunar Sovereign. He's got the talent and is starting to get the confidence to do it. He's had a busy season and we'll look after him now and pick the right race - Paddy Brennan, rider.

1:00.race_name: Pertemps Network Long Distance Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
1:00.going_detailed: Hurdle course - GOOD; Flat course - GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (Inside track) (GoingStick: Hurdle 7.4, Flat 7.7) (Watered)

runners.name: Harbour Lake

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Trevor Hemmings

runners.comment: On a tough mark but was placed in this last year and ran well at Cheltenham last month
runners.spotlight: Pulled up (bled from the nose) at Cheltenham Festival in March but quickly bounced back with creditable second to Long Draw there (3m, good) last month; on a tough mark now but was placed in this race last year and probably won't be far away.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Pertemps Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We have a lovely clear run with Harbour Lake this autumn. We thought he would run well today and he has. The Pertemps Final at the Cheltenham Festival has to be an option for him. He is in the Betfair race at Haydock but that is only two weeks away so I imagine that would come too quick so we could work back from Cheltenham - it's a nice problem to have. He wouldn't want a lot of racing and I'd say he would have a couple of runs before the final as that's a nice target - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Lengthen #yourodds Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Harbour Lake is a grand horse, a typical big, fine Trevor Hemmings horse. Whether or not he wants the ground that soft I'm not sure but he has to run on it to get experience. This is only the second run of his life, he's two from two and he's not done a lot wrong - Brian Hughes, jockey.

quotes.race: bet365 Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Harbour Lake is a smashing horse, we've always liked him. If he'd finished in the first four or five we'd have been happy. He'll stay further and he'll learn from the experience - Mick Meagher, racing manager to the executors of the late Trevor Hemmings.

stable_tour.quote: He'll stay hurdling for the time being. Despite the fact he schooled very well at home, he didn't enjoy chasing. He ran some good races back over hurdles in the spring and will start back soon either at two and a half or three miles. We could also try to qualify him for the Pertemps Final. 25-10-24

Although he schooled very well over fences at home, he didn't enjoy chasing so he'll stick to hurdles for the time being. He ran some good races back over hurdles in the spring and will head to Aintree this Saturday for a Pertemps qualifier. 07-11-24

runners.name: Topgun Simmy
runners.owner: Anthony N Durkan & B M Durkan

prev_owners.owner: Anthony N Durkan & B M Durkan
Anthony N Durkan & B M Durkan

runners.comment: Won a conditions hurdle at Down Royal on Monday; has more to do under penalty here
runners.spotlight: In-form 6yo who was one of two to pull nicely clear of the others when winning a conditions hurdle at Down Royal (3m, good) on Monday; has 7lb penalty to carry in this competitive handicap but ought to run well again.

quotes.race: John Dowling Memorial Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Topgun Simmy is a lovely horse but I was just a bit worried about the jump up in trip. Paddy gave him a great ride as he didn't panic and gave him a chance. We'll plan something for Galway - Shark Hanlon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: This chap is a very nice horse. He ran a cracker at Galway in a hot bumper and had bumped into Brighterdaysahead before that at Fairyhouse. That form isn't working out too bad. He might run in a bumper at Leopardstown over Christmas. 27-11-23

runners.name: Long Draw
runners.comment: Had three of today's rivals behind when driven-out winner at Cheltenham last month
runners.spotlight: Made very good progress last season and had three of today's rivals behind when coming from off the pace for driven-out success at Cheltenham (3m, good) last month; 6lb higher today but could still have more to offer.

quotes.race: Safran Landing Systems Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We got Long Draw ready for the Pertemps [Final] and I secretly fancied him for it but we missed it [the cut] by one. The same thing happened at Aintree so fair play to the horse as he's come back and won. He's an improving staying handicap hurdler and he'll go to the £50,000 handicap hurdle at Haydock on Swinton Hurdle day [May 10]. He could be a horse for the Pertemps next season - Olly Murphy, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He'll run in the Pertemps if he gets in. His form, having beaten Gowel Road at Cheltenham earlier this season, makes it look like he's on a nice mark of 127, but he's going to need a bit of luck to get there. 18-2-25

runners.name: Tiny Tetley
runners.owner: R J Hodges & Mrs S L Hobbs
runners.comment: Completed hat-trick with ready success in C&D series final last month; good chance
runners.spotlight: Ended last season in excellent form, completing a hat-trick with a ready C&D success (good; Thank You Ma'am second) in a quite valuable series final three weeks ago; last two wins were under today's claiming rider Callum Pritchard; probably still on the upgrade; good chance.

quotes.race: In Memory Of Ian Chambers Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Final Handicap Hurdle (Final) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a step up in grade but Tiny Tetley stepped up well. He keeps going up through the rankings and he keeps answering the questions. Callum said that was as tight a track as you'd want for him - Johnson White, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Zain Nights
runners.comment: Won this race in 2024 but was safely held off this career-high mark last month
runners.spotlight: Just did enough to pip My Bobby Dazzler in this race last year (good ground; wore cheekpieces) and returned to form with front-running success in first-time visor at Newbury (3m, good to soft) in March; safely held, though, in Cheltenham race won by Long Draw in April and remains on career-high mark.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Long Distance Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Zain Nights is unbeaten over three miles now and he's as tough as anything. Now he's got his jumping together, he travels so well and loves this good ground. That's it for him now. He's a five-year-old who keeps improving and I think we'll stay hurdling. Hopefully he'll be good enough to go for something like the Pertemps next year - Lucy Wadham, trainer.

quotes.race: Safran Landing Systems Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Zain Nights has improved for the step up in trip and loved the ground. The last thing we said to Bryony was to produce him late so it was very much plan B. It was the perfect ride though. He's won well and hopefully he'll be good enough to come back here next season - Lucy Wadham, trainer.

quotes.race: Premier League Offers At Rhino.Bet Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Zain Nights ran slightly below par at Doncaster, maybe it was a slightly stronger race with a lot of runners. It maybe just suited him coming here. A smaller field probably helped him along a bit more. He's got the experience on the Flat and stays very well and that came to the fore. He's had a few goes over hurdles now and his jumping was very sharp - Tom Cannon, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Quickmove Handicap
quotes.quote: Zain Nights goes on all ground and will make a nice horse for the future, whether the owners wants to keep him or not; he's earning his keep - Roger Charlton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won the Pertemps Long Distance Handicap Hurdle at Haydock last May and I think he might just be a spring horse. He hasn't quite fired this season but he's been training really well. He ran in the Pertemps last week but didn't go a tap. Like so many he didn't get a very good start at Cheltenham and never got into the race. That can happen there. He's entered at Newbury on Friday and I think he'll run. He might find himself with a visor on. 19-03-25

runners.name: Thank You Maam
runners.owner: The Posh Pundit Racing Club Limited
runners.comment: Did well last season but was no match for Tiny Tetley when second over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: Won twice from the front last season (2m7f/3m) but was no match for Tiny Tetley when second over C&D (good) in series final last month and probably needs to find something extra in new headgear today (usually wears cheekpieces).

quotes.race: Thames Materials Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It seems to have taken a while. Thank You Ma'am has been second six times and deserves to get his head in front and I'm really chuffed. We were going to go straight over fences next but I'm not sure now because that looked like his best performance. He stays well but I'd say he doesn't want bottomless ground through the winter - Georgie Nicholls, trainer.

runners.name: Patriotik
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Montaigu
runners.comment: In career-best form in March; needs even more here and may want slower ground
runners.spotlight: Doubled his hurdling tally with a win at Doncaster (3m, good to soft) in March and probably bettered that performance when close third of 17 in valuable race at Uttoxeter (2m7f, good to soft) a fortnight later; effectively another 5lb higher here (raised 2lb, Isabel Williams no longer claims 3lb) and not sure to be suited by the quicker ground.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Patriotik is a good jumper and he enjoyed the drying ground. We ran him over three miles at Haydock and he unseated, and we've been desperate to try him again at the trip - Isabel Williams, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's entered in the 2m4f handicap hurdle at Aintree on Boxing Day and we're hoping the ground won't be too soft for him. There's a very good handicap over 2m4f at Windsor's Winter Millions meeting we might also go for, or the Lanzarote at Kempton. He hasn't won this season but did nothing wrong last time, or the time before, and I think he has a good handicap in him. 24-12-24

runners.name: Lihyan
runners.comment: Three wins on good in early part of last season; probably needs a new PB after wind op
runners.spotlight: Collected three 2m7f wins on good ground in early part of last season and looked back in good nick when second at Newcastle (2m4f, good) last month; probably needs recent wind op to enable a career-best effort here, though.

quotes.race: Sign Up To Our Newsletter Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Lihyan is not overly big but is well put together and came on leaps and bounds from the last day. He jumped far better today which was one of the goals we got right - Josh Halley, trainer

stable_tour.quote: The change to waiting tactics and a step up in trip have been the key to him. He's won three races over hurdles for us this season. If the ground is decent he could go for the conditional jockeys' race at Aintree, a 0-130 hurdle over 3m on October 27. He should get the strong gallop he needs there and he's certainly capable of winning a better pot than he's been playing for. Now we know he stays, the 3m races at Musselburgh will be ideal for him when the ground goes soft elsewhere. 16-10-24

runners.name: Porter In The Park
runners.comment: Battled well for Ludlow win in March; contests this stronger race from a 5lb higher mark
runners.spotlight: 4-18 over hurdles; probably in career-best form when battling on well for narrow win at Ludlow (2m5f, good; front pair clear) in March, after a break, but contests this stronger race from a 5lb higher mark.

stable_tour.quote: She scoped with mucus after running at Stratford last week, but Adam Wedge said she gave him a nice feel and he couldn't believe she stopped. She was treated for ataxia after the race, but I imagine that's because she was full of mucus and couldn't get any oxygen in. 02-11-22

She's a good-ground mare who's back in cantering after having a holiday. She's as hard as nails but not overly big and is much better running in a better race with less weight. I'm not sure she genuinely stays 3m and her ideal trip is probably a good gallop over 2m6f. She's a good jumper and I wouldn't rule out going back over fences. 29-01-25

runners.name: Ki Woo

prev_owners.owner: Lord Daresbury, Ecurie Mme Jacques Cypres & Nicolas Cypres

runners.comment: Upped in grade after ending last season with two small-field novice wins; interesting
runners.spotlight: Ex-French 5yo; not an instant success in Britain but ended last season with two small-field novice wins at Bangor (2m3f/2m7f, good); has considerably more on his plate in this good-quality handicap but remains unexposed over this sort of trip; interesting.

runners.name: Mostly Sunny

prev_owners.owner: Desk Till Dawn And Wetumpka Racing

runners.comment: Back to form in refitted cheekpieces right at end of last season (2m4f); tries new trip
runners.spotlight: Returned to form in refitted cheekpieces right at the end of last season, collecting a good prize at Plumpton before second under a penalty at Sandown (also 2m4f, good); can feature if suited by the new trip.

quotes.race: Southern Cranes Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I didn't think Mostly Sunny would run badly at all, he just wanted a bit better spring ground. The step up in trip and cheekpieces, it all helped him that little bit. I love to see it, he's entered at Sandown and he'll be going there, that's penned in now - Dan Skelton, trainer.

runners.name: Escapologist
runners.comment: Beaten about 18l when fourth on recent handicap debut; moves up in trip today
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 6yo who won a 2m4f maiden in January; about 18l behind Mostly Sunny when fourth on recent handicap debut at Plumpton (2m4f, good) but may improve over this longer trip (although he's not bred for it).

runners.name: My Bobby Dazzler
runners.comment: Went close off 4lb higher in this race in 2024 but younger rivals appeal more all the same
runners.spotlight: Weakened into fourth behind Long Draw and Harbour Lake at Cheltenham (3m, good) last month; that wasn't a bad run and he's now 4lb lower than when close second to Zain Nights in this race a year ago but younger rivals appeal more all the same.

quotes.race: Unibet "You're On" Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: My Bobby Dazzler has won three here now. We were keen to give him a go over three miles. I wasn't worried about the ground for him - Philip Rowley, trainer's husband.

stable_tour.quote: He's where it all started for us. When I took out my licence he was point-to-pointing, but his owner was desperate for him to go out and do something during lockdown when there was no pointing. He was the first horse to move over into my yard and has been fantastic. He doesn't know how to run a bad race and wears his heart on his sleeve, and he deserves to carry on what he's doing. It's becoming difficult to place him where he's most competitive, but we'll keep trying to do it to the best of our ability to show what he can do in his grade. 16-01-25

2:10.race_name: Pertemps Network 'Junior' Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
2:10.going_detailed: Hurdle course - GOOD; Flat course - GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (Inside track) (GoingStick: Hurdle 7.4, Flat 7.7) (Watered)

runners.name: Freddie Steady Go
runners.owner: Castle View, A Bell, S Oliver & M Severs
runners.comment: Sent off favourite at Newcastle and only needed to be pushed out to collect by 5l
runners.spotlight: Stable doesn't have many bumper winners but this 4yo was sent off favourite at Newcastle (good; 3-1) and he only needed to be pushed out to collect by 5l; can pick holes in the form but that was a promising start.

runners.name: Jules Winfield
runners.comment: Strolled clear to win by more than 6l on good ground at Ballinrobe, posting a useful RPR
runners.spotlight: Has a good French Flat pedigree and he strolled clear to win by more than 6l on good ground at Ballinrobe, posting a useful RPR in the process; Derek O'Connor rides again with the tongue-tie retained; respected.

runners.name: On To The Rouge
runners.breeder: Mrs J A Niven & Mr Michael Niven
runners.owner: Clova Synd,Angus Racing And P D Niven

prev_owners.owner: Angus Racing Club & P D Niven

runners.comment: Strong in the market when winning comfortably under Brian Hughes at Market Rasen
runners.spotlight: Well-related gelding who was prominent in the betting at Market Rasen (2m, good) and he won easily from off the pace after travelling strongly; Brian Hughes maintains the partnership; major player.

runners.name: Barachiel
runners.comment: 20-1 when beaten 25l at Kempton, finishing well behind Kapitein Kool; did race freely
runners.spotlight: 20-1 when beaten 25l at Kempton, finishing well behind Kapitein Kool; did race freely and might be more settled with that experience in the bag, but others are preferred.

runners.name: Kapitein Kool
runners.comment: His Kempton run entitles him to considerable respect and Harry Cobden takes over
runners.spotlight: Showed more second time out when keeping on to be beaten just over 3l at Kempton (good) and the winner has since won a maiden hurdle; that run entitles him to considerable respect and Harry Cobden takes over.

runners.name: So Proud
runners.comment: £15,000 3yo; trainer has always done well in bumpers and Sean Bowen is booked; interesting
runners.spotlight: £15,000 3yo; second foal; half-brother to Polish 6f 2yo winner Cyrano; dam unraced close relative of 12.5f-2m2f Flat and 2m/2m4f hurdle winner Dinard Rose; trainer has always done well in bumpers (had the second in this last year) and Sean Bowen is booked; interesting.

runners.name: Aristelle
runners.comment: Cheekpieces fitted for debut and partnered by a 10lb claimer, so probably best watched
runners.spotlight: Eighth foal; closely related to 2m2f/2m3f chase winner Miladygrace and half-sister to winners Vintage Fizz (2m3f/2m4f hurdle/chase), Getaway Glory (point/2m7f chase) and Fameaftertheglory (bumper); dam point winner; cheekpieces fitted for debut and partnered by a 10lb claimer, so probably best watched.

4:40.race_name: Paxtons Now Stocking Stihl Equipment Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
4:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 6.6) (Watering)

runners.name: Hostile Hotelier
runners.comment: Rallying second over 3m2f at Sedgefield (good) and unlikely to be far away off same mark
runners.spotlight: Three hurdle wins at up to 3m1f; was having only his third run over fences when a rallying second over 3m2f at Sedgefield (good) and he's unlikely to be far away off the same mark.

runners.name: Not Sure
runners.comment: Ran better last time and he's his Herefordshire yard's only runner on the card
runners.spotlight: Three-time chase winner who should be well handicapped and ran his best race for a while when second at Carlisle in February (3m, good to soft); has handled good ground in the past and should go well as his Herefordshire yard's only runner on the card.

runners.name: Court At Slip
runners.comment: Well handicapped and best effort since returning from a break when a 13l fourth at Perth
runners.spotlight: Last win was under William Easterby off 6lb higher and his best effort since returning from a break was when a 13l fourth at Perth (3m, good to soft; has won on good) last month; enters the reckoning.

quotes.race: Living North Magazines Handicap Chase (Go North Red Rum Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I had a walk on the track earlier and I just felt like right down the inside was maybe where it was wettest so I tried to keep out in the middle. Court At Slip does whatever you want him to - if you want him come big for you he will do but if you leave him alone he's clever - William Easterby, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Backbyjet
runners.comment: All three chase wins have been here but over 2m4f; others might see this out better
runners.spotlight: All three chase wins have been on this course but over 2m4f; 1m7f would have been too sharp on last month's return from a break but he could be vulnerable to stronger stayers at this trip.

runners.name: Grand Voyage
runners.breeder: Earl Trinquet, M Trinquet & O Trinquet
runners.comment: Only 2lb higher than when back on the scoresheet at Ayr but would prefer slower ground
runners.spotlight: Ended a long losing sequence at Ayr (2m4f, soft) in March, where he was left in front two out when the leader fell; only 2lb higher but softer ground would be preferred.

runners.name: River Of Joy
runners.comment: Good run after a layoff but this is her chase debut and she's unproven at the trip
runners.spotlight: Won two non-handicap hurdles on good ground during summer of 2023 (2m/2m4f); not beaten far over 2m4f at Ffos Las on her return from a long absence in April but this is her chase debut and she's unproven at the trip.

stable_tour.quote: She won twice over hurdles two summers ago but then was off last year. She'll be a good chaser this year - she's a lovely mare. 26-03-25

runners.name: Torosay
runners.comment: Has a good record here and reportedly lost a shoe when not at her best the last time
runners.spotlight: C&D winner in April last year (heavy) and lost a shoe when disappointing in that same race a month ago (good; first-time cheekpieces); had previously gone down by 8l when third again here in March; considered.

runners.name: Don Brocco
runners.comment: Perhaps vulnerable back at 3m on ground that might be quicker than he cares for
runners.spotlight: Likes to lead; not the easiest to predict and it was over 4m when beaten 2l here in March, a race in which he was runner-up the year before; perhaps vulnerable back at 3m on ground that might be quicker than he cares for.

runners.name: Martalmixjac
runners.breeder: Mrs L & Mr J Grandchamp Des Raux
runners.comment: 3m3f perhaps too far last time and had previously gone close over this sort of trip
runners.spotlight: Lost out only by a short head at Southwell two runs back (3m, good to soft) but he finished a tired and remote third at Stratford since (3m3f, good); this is more his trip and can go well if putting best foot forward.

quotes.race: Re-Gen Waste Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Martalmix'jac hinted he's got ability many times. We've gone to the races on the back of good runs thinking, 'Today is the day', then he's put a stinker in. He seems to like it around here and has put it all together. It wasn't the strongest race, but you've still got to win them. He was going away at the line and this was probably his perfect trip. He's not one to be slogging around in the mud. He wants summer jumping, but he might be able to nick one before his season is out. He should go in again - Alex Edwards, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He's turned into a really consistent campaigner, having been a little nondescript to start with. He was quite a closed book in knowing what ground he preferred and even his ideal distance, but he's turned into a very consistent sort. We can place him where he can be most competitive and he keeps pulling it out of the bag in those handicap chases around 2m4f. 16-01-25

runners.name: Azof Des Mottes
runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie Des Mottes
runners.comment: Sole win came off a higher mark but that was two years ago and over 2m5f
runners.spotlight: Sole win came off a higher mark but that was two years ago and over 2m5f; failed to convince stamina-wise over 3m on his penultimate run and this is a stiffer track; absent since November.

4:05.race_name: oddsnow.com Your Home Of Betting Insight Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
4:05.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 6.6) (Watering)

runners.name: From The Clouds
runners.breeder: P Henry, J Gandy & A Chevalier Du Fau
runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner on heavy in 2024; interesting on chase debut; first run on good ground
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden and a novice hurdle at Newcastle in February/March 2024 (2m1f, heavy) and was running a sound race until unseating rider at the last on handicap debut there the following month (2m1f, heavy); a possible on chase debut after 392 days off although first run on good ground.

runners.name: Carcaci Castle

prev_owners.owner: M McPherson And Mrs Q Thomson
Mr And Mrs M McPherson And Mrs Q Thomson

runners.comment: Fair third at Kelso in December; failed to complete since; on a fair mark; a bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Fair third at Kelso in December (2m1f, good to soft) but has failed to complete on both outings since, latest over 2m4f at Perth (fell four out); on a fair mark at present but a bit to prove.

stable_tour.quote: We got him all wrong last season. His best runs have been over a very stiff 2m, at Hexham and Carlisle, but it's been a nightmare because there are no races for him. He went to Kelso just after Christmas and the ground was just too quick for him, but he stayed on really nicely to be third. Hopefully, with the soft ground coming, some of these 2m handicap chases will come right for him. There are definitely races to be won with him. 22-01-25

runners.name: Willie Shake Hands
runners.comment: Pulled up in Irish point; placed over hurdles at up to 2m4f; could go well on chase debut
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on only start pointing in Ireland; placed on four of his last five starts over hurdles at up to 2m4f, including in handicaps; could go well on chase debut.

runners.name: Beny Nahar Road
runners.comment: Off the mark over fences last month (2m3f); ground suits and effective at 2m; chance
runners.spotlight: Ex-Paul Nicholls; won a Sedgefield handicap for current yard on his fourth start over fences last month (2m3f, good); seemed equally effective at 2m over hurdles; a possible.

stable_tour.quote: We did not get him out until December but the benefit of a run for a youngster is huge and he ran a good race when a neck second at Chelmsford. He has run twice this year going down close each time and he will not be long in getting his head front. We will run him on the all-weather as he is not going to get the soft ground h e needs. I would think 1m6f will be his trip. 15-08-22

runners.name: Dream Jet
runners.comment: In decent form late last year, winning C&D chase in November; conditions suit; chance
runners.spotlight: Was in decent form when last seen out, winning over C&D in November (good) and fair efforts either side of that; these conditions suit and a chance on return from a break.

quotes.race: Unibet Zero% Mission Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: That was tough. I could feel after the last fence in the back straight that the saddle was slipping. It was a test of my balance, but Dream Jet is a genuine horse and once he jumped the last I just needed him to be well balanced himself. He did it well in the end - Craig Nichol, jockey.

runners.name: Famous Liss
runners.comment: Irish point winner; fair hurdler; unseated rider when favourite on chase debut; a possible
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner in March 2024 (3m, heavy); mixed form over hurdles and unseated rider at the fourth when favourite for a handicap on chase debut last month (good); interesting.

runners.name: Scots Poet
runners.comment: 4-27 over hurdles; creditable third over C&D on chase debut last month; this stronger
runners.spotlight: Won four of his 27 races over hurdles, the latest at Perth in April 2024 (2m, soft); creditable third on chase debut over C&D last month (good); this stronger.

6:20.race_name: Paxtons Official Case IH Cumbrian Dealer Handicap Hurdle
6:20.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 6.6) (Watering)

runners.name: Coniston George
runners.comment: Not particularly consistent (poor run last time) but has a chance on his best form
runners.spotlight: Not particularly consistent but has a chance on his best form; successful at Carlisle in March (2m3f, good to soft) when wearing a visor for the first time, but well beaten off this 7lb higher mark with same headgear when favourite at Newcastle last time (2m4f, good).

quotes.race: Southwaite Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Coniston George jumped and travelled well, which is all you can ask for. We put on a visor and it's probably just made him concentrate a little bit more and as he gets a little older maybe the extra half mile is much more to his liking now - Nicky Richards, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a grand horse. He ran a nice race at Haydock on his debut when just getting chinned on the line and then he cantered round to win at Ayr. I made the mistake of running him in the valuable bumper at Kelso as it came too soon for him. The only thing he's done wrong was my fault and I've got a good bit of faith in him. His jumping has gone well and we're about ready to rumble. He's interesting. 25-10-23

runners.name: Pinot Rouge
runners.comment: Listed winner in 2024 but mainly disappointing last term; new headgear; revival needed
runners.spotlight: Won a Listed mares' hurdle at Doncaster in March 2024 (3m, soft) and fine effort when fourth in a Grade 1 at Aintree the following month (3m, soft); a bit disappointing since and has been pulled up in two of her last three starts; blinkers replace cheekpieces; stable going well; revival needed.

runners.name: Imperial Data
runners.comment: Winner last May; decent efforts last two starts, latest in headgear (on again); a possible
runners.spotlight: Cartmel winner off 8lb lower last May (2m6f, soft); in fair form recently, last time finishing 3l fourth of six at Kelso (2m5f, good) when cheekpieces were back on; same headgear here and he's a possible.

quotes.race: Best Odds Guaranteed Daily With Vickers.Bet Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Qualifier)
quotes.quote: It (the win) was too late for my liking! It was a learning curve and Imperial Data was getting into the bottom of them a bit when jumping. The track rode beautifully - Ross Chapman, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: We've given him a winter holiday as he needs decent ground and he's just coming back now, with a view to probably going novice chasing through the spring and summer. He was progressive after his wind op, which has made a big difference. He was quite an anxious horse before his races, but all that has stopped as I'd imagine he was thinking about his wind before. He's related to Dorans Pride and is a lovely staying chase prospect for John Wade. 24-01-24

runners.name: Balboa
runners.comment: 1-15; creditable third at Wetherby in March; disappointing in headgear (retained) latest
runners.spotlight: His only hurdles win was over 2m in heavy ground at Chepstow in October 2023 when with Milton Harris; showed he stays this sort of trip when a creditable third at Wetherby in March (2m3f, soft) but was disappointing with cheekpieces (retained today) at Ayr last time.

quotes.race: Champion Hats Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's taken a while for the penny to drop. Balboa has had two runs but he still had a look at the first (hurdle). We got a bit of good fortune with the non-runners but that's racing and you've got to kick the ball when it's in front of you. He's ok and he's solid, he seems to handle the soft ground. We might turn up at the Cheltenham meeting in November, although we do have some higher rated who could go there. Milton Harris, trainer

runners.name: Broughshane
runners.comment: Went up 19lb for two wins last year; fair 3rd over fences in March; not well handicapped
runners.spotlight: Went up 19lb for wins at Fontwell (2m3f, good to soft) and Southwell (2m4f, good) last year; beaten at odds-on next time but subsequently fair third on chase debut; back over hurdles after pulling up last time; others look better handicapped.

stable_tour.quote: He showed some good form over hurdles last season, finishing third on Welsh National day and looking like he was going to go close when falling three out back at Chepstow in January. He got off the mark first time out this season at Fontwell and could be going over fences now. He handles soft ground well and will stay three miles. 06-11-24

runners.name: Quick Sharpener
runners.comment: Dual hurdles winner; off the mark over fences at last time; a possible back hurdling
runners.spotlight: Won two 2m novice hurdles at Wetherby in 2023; mixed form chasing since, getting off the mark in a five-runner race at Bangor last time (2m4f, good); a possible back hurdling but this a stronger race.

quotes.race: William Hill Lengthen ~Yourodds Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We thought Quick Sharpener may have had a wind issue but we couldn't find anything wrong with him so the next thing to do was drop him back in trip as we wondered if he didn't stay - he looks like a three-miler and maybe he'd fooled us. He'll be a chaser, jumping is his best asset and that helped him out today - Dan Abraham, Foxtrot Racing.

runners.name: Mellificent
runners.comment: Won novice in 2023; mixed form since (pulled up latest); back after wind op; interesting
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m4f novice hurdle at Carlisle (soft) in October 2023 when with Jonjo O'Neill; 3l behind Pinot Rouge in a Listed mares' novice the following month (3m, good) but now 9lb better off; pulled up at Ayr last time; had a wind op since; interesting.

stable_tour.quote: She won her first start for us last season at Uttoxeter but the lack of pace was against her when she ran sixth in a Listed bumper at Market Rasen. It was good to see her make a winning start over hurdles at Carlisle last month in what was probably only an average race but she was always on top. We might look at the French Furze novice hurdle on Fighting Fifth day at Newcastle over 2m6f, which is a trip that should suit her. 14-11-23

runners.name: Miss Maverick
runners.comment: Hat-trick of hurdle wins in 2024; disappointing since, including over fences
runners.spotlight: Completed a hat-trick of hurdle wins last April/May (2m/2m4f, soft/good to soft); disappointing since, including pulled up in two chases; bit to prove.

quotes.race: TCS Recruitment Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think Miss Maverick just handled the ground better than the majority in this race. She's a keen-running sort and, to be honest, I didn't have a lot left in the tank but she had the race won from a long way out and hopefully she can progress from this - James Davies, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Singapore Trip
runners.comment: Won 2m4f h'cap hurdle last May; below par since; well treated; headgear back on; possible
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m4f handicap off 6lb higher at Perth last May (good to soft); hasn't run to the same level of form since but well handicapped now and cheekpieces (tried twice in France in 2023) are back on; not out of it.

runners.name: Blakey Boy
runners.comment: Off the mark in first-time headgear at 33-1 over C&D last month; up 5lb but in the mix
runners.spotlight: Stable in fine form; off the mark over C&D when scoring at 33-1 in first-time cheekpieces last time (good); headgear retained and he's in the mix despite 5lb higher mark.

runners.name: Ambassador
runners.comment: Two 2m wins last term; disappointing this time; chance back up in trip off good mark
runners.spotlight: Two wins over 2m at Uttoxeter last season, the second off 6lb higher than this in July (good); rather disappointing since and beaten 18l when sixth over that same C&D last week, but he has won over 2m2f and is worth a second look back over 2m4f off very good mark.

quotes.race: Brit Direct Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Ambassador came to us in good form and all we've had to do is tick him over. He was given a good ride by Brian Hughes and it just sort of fell right for us really - Micky Hammond, trainer.

5:50.race_name: Harrison Family Remembering Loved Ones Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
5:50.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 6.6) (Watering)

runners.name: Bobby J
runners.comment: Well beaten on his two completed starts over hurdles; would be a surprise winner
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on his two completed starts over hurdles; would be a surprise winner.

runners.name: Cloghan Castle
runners.comment: Ex-Irish pointer; 2nd on last two starts (March/April); interesting on stable/hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish pointer who was runner-up on his last two starts in March/April, the second over 3m on good ground (made much of the running); hood is now tried; quite interesting on stable/hurdles debut.

runners.name: Do Ye Wanna
runners.comment: Modest efforts at around 2m/2m1f; needs to improve markedly for the step up to 2m7f
runners.spotlight: Modest efforts in bumpers and three runs over hurdles (all at around 2m/2m1f); needs to improve markedly for this significant step up in trip.

runners.name: Dreamings Free
runners.comment: Exposed 13-race maiden; second in C&D handicap last week; this is harder; each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Exposed 13-race maiden over hurdles; fair second off a low mark in a C&D handicap last week (good to soft); this is a harder race but each-way chance.

runners.name: Eastern Storm
runners.comment: Pulled up in this race last season; has since won a two-runner UK point; plenty to prove
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in this race last season; won a two-runner UK point in January (2m4f, good to soft) but hasn't fared as well since; bit to prove.

runners.name: Foxwood
runners.comment: 0-9; fair third in a 2m handicap here last June; first run at beyond 2m4f; more needed
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden over hurdles; fair run when third in a 2m handicap here last June (2m, good); having first run at further than 2m4f and needs improvement.

runners.name: Man Of Action
runners.comment: Ex-Irish; ordinary Flat performer; fair third on latest hurdle run (2m1f); more needed
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish; ordinary Flat performer; over 17l fourth of six in a Carlisle novice in March on latest run over hurdles (2m1f, good); needs to improve for this step up to 2m7f.

runners.name: Pike Road
runners.comment: 0-6; sound run when third in a 3m2f h'cap at Newton Abbot last time; one with a chance
runners.spotlight: Yet to win in six starts over hurdles but decent third in a Haydock novice (2m5f, good; 6-5 favourite) and a handicap at Newton Abbot (3m2f, good; cheekpieces first time) on last two starts; headgear retained; chance.

runners.name: Saint Malinas
runners.comment: Irish point winner; two fair runs over hurdles; left-handed track should suit; big player
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner in February 2024 (3m, heavy); fair efforts both starts over hurdles but didn't look entirely straightforward when third to subsequent winner at Carlisle last time (2m3f, good to soft; hung left); this left-handed track should suit, however, and he's a major player.

5:15.race_name: Paxtons Heart Of All England Maiden Hunters' Chase (For The Heart Of All England Trophy)
5:15.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 6.6) (Watering)

runners.name: Amma Lord
runners.comment: Back under rules with very respectable fourth in Buccleuch Cup at Kelso last month
runners.spotlight: Ran poorly in this race a year ago but led close home to win soft-ground point at Friars Haugh in February and returned to racing under rules with very respectable fourth in Buccleuch Cup at Kelso (2m7f, good) last month.

runners.name: Dr Lockdown
runners.comment: Achieved very little when winning a two-runner maiden point last month
runners.spotlight: Placed off lowly hurdle mark in 2023 but the rest of his rules form is very uninspiring and he achieved very little when winning a two-runner maiden point last month.

runners.name: Great Notions
runners.comment: Dual point winner at Alnwick this year; considered each-way on rules debut
runners.spotlight: Dual point winner (maiden/restricted) on good to soft ground at Alnwick this year and placed elsewhere on last two appearances; has a bit more on his plate on this rules debut but still considered each-way.

runners.name: Pete The Brief
runners.comment: Returned from long absence with respectable second on point debut in March; a possible
runners.spotlight: Won low-grade Flat handicap in 2023 and placed in juvenile hurdle later that year; back from long absence with respectable second of six on point debut at Dalton Park (2m6f, good) in March and has possibilities here if that run brought him on.

runners.name: Something Golden

prev_owners.owner: Mrs C Brown & I J Jardine

runners.comment: Third in five restricted points since February but most of those were small-field affairs
runners.spotlight: 0-14 over hurdles and just 1-12 in points; third in five consecutive restricted points since February but most of those were small-field affairs and others in this line-up have more pressing claims.

runners.name: Torngat
runners.comment: Out of form this year and a long way behind Amma Lord at Kelso last month
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in two small-field Kelso hunter chases since his two point wins in 2023 but out of form this year and a long way behind Amma Lord at Kelso last month.

runners.name: Up With The Play
runners.comment: No match for winner when second in small-field point last month; now 0-25 overall
runners.spotlight: 0-25 under all codes; returned from long absence with three poor point runs, then was no match for easy winner when second of four at Overton last month; cheekpieces are the headgear of choice today.

runners.name: Wallace Olinger
runners.comment: 4-10 in points after last month's wide-margin success at Dingley; looks the one to beat
runners.spotlight: Southern raider with 4-10 strike-rate in points; reportedly not suited by heavy ground when beaten odds-on favourite on rules debut in February but still ran pretty well; confirmed his wellbeing when making all for wide-margin success in good-ground Dingley point last month and looks the one to beat.

runners.name: Tanora
runners.comment: Makes quick reappearance after point win on Monday; can make her presence felt
runners.spotlight: 0-16 under rules but ran a big race when close second in good-ground open point at Overton in March and makes quick reappearance after holding on well to win a conditions point at Witton Castle on Monday; has also won on the point-to-point course here; can make presence felt.

6:50.race_name: Kerri's Race To Her 30's Mares' Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
6:50.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick 6.6) (Watering)

runners.name: Celestron Star
runners.comment: Found Aintree Grade 2 too hot last month; strong claims if judged on earlier Hereford win
runners.spotlight: Well beaten after racing too freely in Grade 2 at last month's Aintree festival but back in much calmer waters here and has strong claims if judged on her good-ground Hereford win two starts ago.

runners.name: Delta Blues Belle
runners.owner: Noel Fehily Racing Syndicate - Delta B
runners.comment: Bought for £70,000 after her Irish point win; with top stable for rules career
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to high-class bumper/jumps winner Ballycasey; changed hands for £70,000 after winning slow-ground Irish point in November and has joined a top stable for her rules career.

runners.name: Georgies Malt
runners.comment: Out of sister to useful jumps winner Cockney Trucker; has fairly good standard to reach
runners.spotlight: Tenth foal; half-sister to winners Master Malt (useful 2m-2m7f hurdle), On Blueberry Hill (bumper) and Echo Springs (bumper); dam unraced sister to bumper/useful jumps winner Cockney Trucker; has fairly good standard to reach on debut.

runners.name: Just Jane
runners.comment: Beaten about 28l on both outings last season and needs to take a big step forward
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 28l on both outings last season and needs to take a big step forward here.

runners.name: Lipstick Traces
runners.comment: Not threat to winner when second over C&D last month but that was still a promising debut
runners.spotlight: Out of a well-connected mare; no threat to clear winner when second over C&D (good) last month but that was still an encouraging debut and she has obvious scope for improvement.

runners.name: Loveatfirstglance
runners.comment: Fourth in quite valuable series final in March and has possibilities here
runners.spotlight: Made the frame on both outings last season, more recently when fourth of ten in quite valuable series final at Kelso (good to soft) in March; won't be far away if handling the quicker conditions here but was withdrawn with good ground deemed unsuitable last month.

7:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick 7.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Dark Tornado
runners.comment: Hard to beat if reproducing his best; 2nd over C&D on stable debut last month; contender
runners.spotlight: He has recorded an RPR in the 90s in two of his five starts and a repeat of that form would make him hard to beat; second of eight, beaten over 2l, in a C&D novice on his stable debut five weeks ago and that form has taken some knocks since; sets the standard but not bombproof.

runners.name: Gladiadora
runners.owner: R Coleman, G Glendining, L Glendining
runners.comment: Just modest form in her two starts to date; minor handicaps beckon
runners.spotlight: Down the field in one run in Ireland last summer and she was again well held on last month's stable debut at Bath (1m, good to firm); minor handicaps beckon.

runners.name: Indian Spirit
runners.comment: Two promising efforts (7f and 1m) so far this year; can do better; more appeal than most
runners.spotlight: Promise in both starts this year, third at Southwell on debut (7f) before a close fourth at Newbury (1m, good) four weeks ago; should continue to progress and he is more appealing than most.

runners.name: Licence To Conquer
runners.owner: D Mooney, J Belcher & J Gerber
runners.comment: Stiff task in a Newmaket maiden last month (7f, good); bred to leave that well behind
runners.spotlight: 200-1 for his Newmarket debut last month (7f, good), never in the hunt after a slow start; this is less demanding and he is bred to do much better in time.

runners.name: Looks Fantastic
runners.comment: Kept on for 2nd in a 1m maiden at Southwell in March; each-way claims again
runners.spotlight: Backed on his Doncaster debut last October (7f, soft) but failed to threaten; second of 12 on his reappearance at Southwell six weeks ago (1m) but that form isn't anything to be going overboard with; can do better and holds place claims at least in this field.

runners.name: Pantani
runners.comment: No solid form claims but he's bred to do much better at some point
runners.spotlight: Unseated his rider early on sole 2yo start; 6-1 for his reappearance at Kempton 19 days ago (6f), a race in which he weakened in the straight; bred to do much better at some point.

runners.name: What A Recovery
runners.comment: Sold unraced for 1,000gns last September; just minor appeal on paper; best watched
runners.spotlight: 45,000gns yearling but sold unraced for 1,000gns last September; second foal of an unraced half-sister to Group 3 winner Reach For The Moon; likely best watched on debut.

6:30.race_name: Dark Horse Ladies' Day 5th July Handicap
6:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick 7.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Beauld As Brass
runners.comment: Has completed a 1m2f hat-trick this term; leading player provided he stays this new trip
runners.spotlight: Three from three this term, all in 1m2f amateur events, latest comfortably at Bath (firm) on Monday; better than ever; leading player under 5lb penalty, provided he stays this longer distance.

quotes.race: Silvershine Turf Services Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
quotes.quote: I felt quite cunning as the three amateur races jumped out at me in the programme book with Simon [Walker, jockey] on. I thought if we could win one that'd be good so to complete the hat-trick is the perfect plan. Beauld As Brass is a quirky horse and exhausting to watch, I have to look away when the stalls open, but I'm delighted. These three races were the plan and we could look at going again at Leicester on Saturday. The Amateur Derby with Simon would be an obvious target for the summer - George Baker, trainer.

runners.name: Haliphon

prev_owners.owner: Hermitage Racing, Ecurie De Montlahuc & Laurent Benoit

runners.comment: Returns to turf off an attractive mark but has a poor strike-rate since 2022
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent since returned to AW but is quite interesting off an attractive mark returned to turf, having done all his winning in this sphere; that said, has a poor strike-rate since 2022.
