quotes.race: 100% Racing TV Profits Back To Racing Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
quotes.quote: Haliphon has probably got an opportunity to turn around at Epsom on Thursday in the Jump Jockeys Derby at a track he has really enjoyed in the past. Charlie Todd will probably ride not too dissimilar to how Bella has today - Ian Williams, trainer.

runners.name: Guendolen
runners.comment: Strong at the finish here (1m2f) on seasonal debut and likely to build on that win
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage filly who justified favouritism in clearcut fashion here (1m2f, good) on seasonal debut, proving strong at the finish and leaving the impression she'll stay this longer trip; likely to build on that win and show further progress; highly respected.

runners.name: Whatacracker

prev_owners.owner: Mrs P A Johnson & C H Stephenson

runners.comment: Record is only 1-16 but he's favourably treated and running into form; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Exposed 5yo whose record is only 1-16; however, looks favourably treated (gained the win off 2lb higher) and he's running into form, staying-on third over 1m2f most recently; not ruled out.

quotes.race: Lake District Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Middle Distance Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Ryan (jockey) did a great job and it's just a horse that's taken us a little while to figure him out. We started Whatacracker over seven because he shows lots of speed at home and we've gradually stepped him up. We thought he'd win at Newmarket last time and he disappointed us a bit but what we see at home is what we've seen on the track today - Mark Walford, trainer.

runners.name: Glimmer Of Light
runners.comment: Clear second on AW when last seen; appears capable of winning an ordinary handicap
runners.spotlight: The only maiden in this field but has low mileage and appears capable of winning an ordinary handicap, having finished a clear second upped to 1m4f at Lingfield (AW) when last seen; possibilities off same mark.

stable_tour.quote: I think she's well handicapped and will stay further than 1m. She has a great temperament and could have a good year. 25-04-24

8:00.race_name: Kube @leicesterraces - Leicester's Premier Event Venue Handicap
8:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick 7.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Candonomore
runners.comment: Clearcut winner on recent seasonal debut, form that has already been boosted by the second
runners.spotlight: Looked in very good nick when clearcut winner on seasonal debut at Wetherby (1m, good to firm) two weeks ago, form that has already been boosted by the runner-up; still on a good mark after recent 4lb rise; major player.

stable_tour.quote: He's very decent and I'm happy with him. He showed promise in all his three runs last year, even though he didn't win, and he'll get a mile and probably a mile and a quarter. There will be some good races for him. 23-04-24

runners.name: Kit Gabriel
runners.comment: Made all on AW in December but both AW runs this year have been disappointing
runners.spotlight: Made all at Wolverhampton (8.6f, AW) in December, his third start for Seb Spencer, but both AW runs this year have been underwhelming and he often harms his chance by racing too freely.

runners.name: Cliffcake
runners.comment: Made all over 6f on AW in February but has become hard to predict
runners.spotlight: Gained his last three wins over 6f on Tapeta but 1m on fast turf also suits him; made all in first-time cheekpieces at Southwell in February but was safely held after racing too freely on next AW two starts (7f/6f) and the headgear is now removed; not an easy one to predict here.

runners.name: Kracking
runners.comment: Keen-going front-runner; went up 7lb for recent Brighton win; well held since
runners.spotlight: Keen-going front-runner who looked as good as ever when winning by over 3l at Brighton (1m, good to firm) last month; went up 7lb for that, though, and was comfortably reeled in after blasting off at Epsom last time.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld, Dubai Apprentice Handicap (Whips To Be Carried, But Not Used) (RE Series)
quotes.quote: Kracking jumped well and travelled along really well. He was always doing enough and I never really felt any pressure from another horse. Mr [Stuart] Williams was confident so I just let him bowl along. I'm happy to be back with Mr Hannon doing what I love. I could do with an agent to keep the ball rolling into the winter and get a few more rides - Tyrese Cameron, jockey.

runners.name: Calanthe
runners.comment: Just held on to make all on Polytrack 12 days ago; should be okay back on turf
runners.spotlight: Consistent 4yo who held on well to make all at Lingfield (1m, AW) 12 days ago; should be okay back on turf and recent 3lb rise is offset by Laura Coughlan's claim today but he's very unlikely to enjoy an uncontested lead.

runners.name: Double Time
runners.comment: Has a bit to prove but is on a very good mark and will be suited by today's trip/ground
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with two substandard runs for Sir Mark Todd and was soundly beaten when reappearing for new stable on AW last month; arrives here with quite a bit to prove but is on a very good mark now and will be suited by today's trip/ground.

runners.name: Aljezur
runners.comment: Safely held on all three AW starts for current stable and now 0-17 overall
runners.spotlight: 17-race maiden who was safely held on all three AW starts for new stable in March/April (6f-8.6f); may yet turn things around for Jennie Candlish but it's probably wise to wait for some encouraging signals from the betting.

7:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick 7.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Hows The Guvnor
runners.comment: Well held on the AW for this yard but the return to turf looks a positive; interesting
runners.spotlight: 1-10 for Clive Cox; well held in two starts on the AW since reappearing for this yard in March, but the return to turf looks a positive and he is well treated on a couple of pieces of form from last summer; interesting.

runners.name: Delicacy
runners.comment: 1lb above last winning mark; worth a market check on debut for new yard
runners.spotlight: Well held in four starts on the AW for Roger Fell, but just 1lb higher than when winning on her final start for Richard Hannon at Chepstow (1m, good) last September; worth a market check on debut for new yard (same owners).

quotes.race: AK Bets Best Price Premier League Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Sean gave Delicacy a really sympathetic ride and said she was always in his hands and going well. She's in the sales and I suppose she'll still go as there isn't a race for her before then - Rolf Johnson, owners' representative.

runners.name: Outrun The Storm
runners.comment: 6lb below last winning mark; behind Leap Day last time but capable of going close
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who has dropped 6lb lower than when successful at Chester (7f, good) last summer; not the most consistent since (behind Leap Day last time) but capable of going close on his best form.

quotes.race: EBF Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: They obviously went too fast early on as Outrun The Storm was out the back of the telly at halfway. He's always shown ability at home and the penny hadn't dropped until today - Mike Prince of owners Middleham Park Racing.

runners.name: My Mate Mike
runners.comment: All four wins on the AW; has run well on turf but others look more solid
runners.spotlight: All four wins on the AW, the latest when suddenly back to form at Chelmsford (7f; 22-1) last month on his third start for the yard; has run well on turf but others look more solid.

runners.name: Leap Day
runners.comment: Runner-up at Catterick last month on his return from 294 days off; player from same mark
runners.spotlight: 1-18 but placed seven times, as when second of nine at Catterick (7f, good to firm) last month on his return from 294 days off (Outrun The Storm fourth, third has won since); a player from the same mark.

runners.name: Believe You Me
runners.comment: All three wins at Chepstow; record suggests this first start in seven months may be needed
runners.spotlight: All three wins at Chepstow (7f) including two last summer (good to firm/good to soft); still 5lb higher than for the latest of those and her record suggests this first start in seven months may be needed.

runners.name: Touchwood
runners.comment: 4lb lower then when winning last summer but in and out since; others are more persuasive
runners.spotlight: 4lb lower then when winning at Chester (7.7f, good) last summer but in and out since, not building on an encouraging reappearance at Southwell (7f, AW) in March; others are more persuasive.

stable_tour.quote: With his ability to act on the all-weather andass, he is an asset to the yard, his best distance being 7f. He will now go to Thirsk on Saturday for a 7f, 0-85 handicap. 09-04-25

runners.name: Thoughtful Gift
runners.comment: Back off last winning mark; well held in last three starts, including on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Seen more often on the AW but acts on turf (1-4); back today off her last winning mark but well held in her last three starts, including on stable debut at Lingfield (1m, AW; 66-1) last month after 193 days off; best to look elsewhere.

runners.name: Naval Academy
runners.comment: 8lb below last winning mark and made a fair return last month; claims if stepping forward
runners.spotlight: 8lb lower than when winning at Haydock (7f, good) last summer and was returning from six months off when a creditable fifth of ten at Thirsk (6f, good) four weeks ago; claims if stepping forward from that.

runners.name: Exquisement
runners.comment: 0-6; well beaten on stable debut nine days ago; drop in trip may help, but enough to prove
runners.spotlight: Twice placed in five starts in France last year but finished a well-beaten last of six on stable debut at Yarmouth (1m2f, good to firm) nine days ago; this big drop in trip may help but she still has enough to prove.

5:25.race_name: Join Racing TV Now EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Band D) (EBF Qualifier) (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
5:25.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick 7.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Archibald Ives
runners.comment: Made respectable debut in Brocklesby; second run was underwhelming
runners.spotlight: Made respectable debut in the Brocklesby (wore blinkers) but failed to build on that performance when a fading fifth at Pontefract (5f, good; visored) last month; ever-present tongue-tie his only headgear today.

runners.name: Blue Jammin
runners.comment: Half-brother to six winners but not an obvious type for an early-season 2yo race
runners.spotlight: 12th foal; half-brother to six winners including Siouxperhero (1m-9.4f; RPR 79), Miss M (1m2f-11.6f; 67), York Minster (1m AW 2yo; 67) and All Win (German 7f-1m1f); dam unraced half-sister to a US 1m2f stakes winner; not an obvious type for an early-season 2yo race.

runners.name: Calafiori
runners.comment: Last of six over C&D on recent debut; needs to take a good step forward today
runners.spotlight: Out of a 6f 2yo winner; last of six over C&D (good to firm) on recent debut, albeit after some interference at the start, and needs to take a good step forward today.

runners.name: Dandys Rocket
runners.comment: Showed his inexperience and was towards rear throughout at Pontefract ten days ago
runners.spotlight: First foal from a fair 1m winner; showed his inexperience and was towards rear throughout at Pontefract ten days ago; needs to have learnt a lot from that outing.

runners.name: Diamond Ali
runners.comment: Out of a 1m 2yo Group 3 winner; makes some appeal on paper
runners.spotlight: 5,000gns yearling; tenth foal; half-brother to five winners including Gift List (7f-8.5f including 2yo/US Grade 2; RPR 105), Charm Bracelet (1m; 97) and Classic Win (6f; 95); dam 1m 2yo winner (including Group 3; 104), half-sister to 1m6f Listed winner Songcraft; makes some appeal on paper.

runners.name: Oh West Virginia
runners.comment: 25-1, slowly into stride and too green to make an impact on recent Goodwood debut
runners.spotlight: Out of a Listed-placed 1m 2yo winner; 25-1, slowly into stride and too green to make an impact on recent Goodwood debut; should fare better in this easier race and with that run behind him, though.

runners.name: Renovatio Angel
runners.comment: Out of a 1m6f winner; may find 5f too sharp on debut
runners.spotlight: £10,000 yearling; fourth foal; half-brother to winners Lazieelunch (1m/9.5f 2yo AW; RPR 79) and Kool Kid (bumper); dam 1m6f AW winner (79); may find 5f too sharp on debut.

runners.name: Send The Navy
runners.comment: No short-term promise when last of seven at Pontefract ten days ago
runners.spotlight: Out of a fair 1m4f/1m5f winner; showed no short-term promise when last of seven at Pontefract ten days ago.

runners.name: Shaman Champion
runners.comment: Closely related to a Listed winner; dam 7f 2yo winner; interesting newcomer
runners.spotlight: 13,000gns yearling; seventh foal; closely related to 6f-8.6f winner Castle Hill Cassie (including Listed; RPR 105), half-brother to 7f AW winner Summerseat Mist (77); dam 7f 2yo winner (81), half-sister to 5f/6f Listed winner Mister Manannan; interesting newcomer.

runners.name: Whos On First
runners.comment: Ran on for never-dangerous third at Brighton last month; can improve here
runners.spotlight: Out of a close relative of Derby runner-up At First Sight; green in early stages but ran on well for third (no threat to front pair) at Brighton (5.2f) tens days ago; ought to be more streetwise here; a possible.

runners.name: Blossom In The Air
runners.comment: Bred to be a speedy 2yo but showed only minor promise when 40-1 for recent Brighton debut
runners.spotlight: Bred to be a speedy 2yo but showed only minor promise when 40-1 for recent debut at Brighton (5.2f).

runners.name: Lexington Express
runners.comment: Out of a fairly useful 6f/7.4f winner; stable does pretty well in 2yo races
runners.spotlight: 5,500euros yearling; ninth foal; half-sister to winners Blues Emperor (1m; RPR 104), Geological (prolific 6f-1m including 2yo; 102), Chipping (6f 2yo; 75) and Grimeford Lane (7f/1m including 2yo); dam 6f/7.4f winner (85), out of 5f Group 3 winner; stable does pretty well in 2yo races.

runners.name: Moghitha
runners.comment: Kept on well for third on recent debut at Thirsk; likely contender
runners.spotlight: Out of a half-sister to multiple 1m Group 1 winner Ribchester; shaped as though this stiffer track will suit her better when running on well for third of ten at Thirsk (5f, good) a week ago; likely contender.

runners.name: Ocean Pie
runners.comment: Dam Group-placed 5f/6f 2yo winner; has the right type of pedigree; market may guide
runners.spotlight: 35,000euros foal; sixth foal; half-sister to winners Nala Star (5f 2yo; RPR 78), Beleaguerment (6f/7f including 2yo; 78), Seven Emirates (Swedish 6f) and Rabbit Rock (Czech 1m/1m2f); dam Group-placed 5f/6f 2yo winner (99); has the right type of pedigree; market may guide.

8:30.race_name: King Power Raceday 26th May Book Now Handicap
8:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick 7.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Life On The Rocks
runners.comment: Placed on his last five starts, latest when second of four at Chelmsford nine days ago.
runners.spotlight: Won four times over 1m2f last year on turf and after a lousy winter has returned to form; placed on his last five starts, latest when second of four at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) nine days ago with cheekpieces on (replaced here with usual visor); knocking on the door and looks sure to run his race.

runners.name: Stintino Sunset
runners.breeder: S Clarke, G Parsons & A Wideson
runners.comment: Respectable fifth of 11 at Chelmsford last month on return and should be ready to roll.
runners.spotlight: C&D winner in 2023 and scored at Windsor (11.5f, good to firm) last September off this mark; had a nice pipe-opener when fifth of 11 at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) last month and should be ready to roll; holds claims.

runners.name: Monks Mead
runners.comment: Falling down the weights after a series of moderate runs and best watched for now.
runners.spotlight: Falling down the weights after a series of moderate runs; steps up in trip but best watched for now.

quotes.race: At The Races App Market Movers Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Monks Mead was very green at Windsor and Chelmsford, and then just ran in what looks like a good race at Newbury. I thought Ollie (Searle) gave him an excellent ride. I must say I was surprised the odds were so big because it's not a massive surprise he has shown some ability today - Mark Usher, trainer.

runners.name: Offiahs Boy
runners.comment: Eight-race maiden; difficult to recommend.
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden; cheekpieces worn over hurdles once are back on but difficult to recommend.

runners.name: Back From Dubai
runners.comment: Won at Wolverhampton in January and has been placed on four of his last five starts.
runners.spotlight: Won a classified at Wolverhampton (9.5f, AW) in January and has been placed on four of his last five starts, latest when second of 11 at Southwell (1m, AW) ten days ago; looks sure to be thereabouts.

quotes.race: Spreadex Sports Injury Time Loser Insurance Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Back From Dubai broke well and I just let him use his stride and he's toughed it out to the line - Jordan Williams, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Odd Socks Havana
runners.comment: Second of 11 at Pontefract ten days ago but yet to win beyond 8.5f.
runners.spotlight: Six of his seven wins have been on AW and yet to win beyond 8.5f; second of 11 at Pontefract (1m, good) ten days ago where he stayed on to suggest this longer trip should suit.

runners.name: The Ormer Gatherer
runners.comment: Won classified at Lingfield in March but well held at Southwell last month.
runners.spotlight: 0-18 (including five starts on Jersey) before he scored by a neck in last-gasp fashion at 80-1 in a classified at Lingfield (1m2f, AW) in March on first Flat start for David Bridgwater; beaten 22l when seventh of ten back in handicap company at Southwell (1m3f, AW) last month.

runners.name: First Encounter
runners.comment: Fourth of 11 at Pontefract ten days ago, suggesting a return to today's trip should suit.
runners.spotlight: Won here (1m, good to firm) last July off 1lb lower mark and went on to land a seller at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) in October; decent effort when fourth of 11 at Pontefract (1m, good) ten days ago, suggesting a return to today's trip should suit; should go well.

runners.name: Mr Trick
runners.comment: Returns to turf following a series of fair efforts on AW but losing run is mounting up.
runners.spotlight: Returns to turf following a series of fair efforts on AW but losing run is mounting up.

quotes.race: Pertemps Handicap
quotes.quote: Mr Trick has taken his time and appreciated the cut in the ground. He's run up to his best - Ian Williams, trainer.

6:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick 7.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Travis
runners.comment: Yet to be placed since switching to current yard and is on a career-low mark.
runners.spotlight: Sole success came at Pontefract (6f, good) last June when trained by George Boughey; yet to be placed since switching to current yard and is on a career-low mark; hard to recommend.

runners.name: Classy Clarets
runners.comment: Got off the mark at Wolverhampton in December but unplaced in four starts since.
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark at Wolverhampton (5f, AW) in December but unplaced in four starts since; left Richard Fahey for 4,400gns in April and makes stable debut; best watched.

runners.name: Ideal Guest
runners.comment: Showed first form for current yard when second of 11 at Leicester two weeks ago.
runners.spotlight: Won five times for George Margarson; showed first form for current yard when second of 11 at Leicester (6f, good to firm) two weeks ago in first-time hood (retained) replacing cheekpieces; should build on that and go close.

runners.name: Beauzon
runners.comment: Below his best on last five starts and best watched for now.
runners.spotlight: Has had a turf win but most of his success has been on AW; below his best on last five starts and best watched for now.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (For Horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Beauzon is a nice horse - we've always liked him. He had a bad draw at Beverley last time and he ran quite a good race from there. It's an advantage to be on the fence here - David Nolan, jockey.

runners.name: Silky Robin
runners.comment: Got off the mark, on his 18th attempt, at Brighton 11 days ago in first-time blinkers.
runners.spotlight: The first-time blinkers (retained) did the trick when he got off the mark, on his 18th attempt, at Brighton (6f, good to firm) 11 days ago; up 4lb and not an obvious candidate to follow up.

runners.name: Arc Shadowfax
runners.comment: Running with credit recently; on a career-low mark and not out of this.
runners.spotlight: Redcar maiden winner (6f, good) as a 2yo and has been running with credit lately, as when third of nine at Newcastle (6f, AW) on his return to this stable in March and when sixth of 13 at Southwell (7f, AW) last month; on a career-low mark and not out of this.

runners.name: Antiphon
runners.comment: Fifth of 11 at Windsor 12 days ago; well handicapped on his best form.
runners.spotlight: Has plunged in the weights but failed to take advantage of favourable terms when fifth of 11 at Windsor (5f, good to firm; 9-4) 12 days ago; first-time visor is now on and well handicapped on his best form.

quotes.race: Star Property Group Handicap
quotes.quote: Antiphon is a legend of a horse, just so easy to train and he's run seven times for us since we bought him in February and he hasn't been out of the winner's circle. From where we were stood on the stands it looked like we'd been touched off, but he's so tough - Michael Keady, joint-trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He is a lovely colt who made a pleasing debut when third at Newmarket's Craven meeting over 5f. Unfortunately, he had a niggly issue subsequently and will not be out for a while. He looks a proper hardy two-year-old. He will be back later this summer. 19-05-21

runners.name: Raft Up
runners.comment: Beaten a neck in search of first turf success over C&D last month but lesser effort since.
runners.spotlight: Revived by the application of a hood to land back-to-back wins at AW Newcastle in February/March; beaten a neck in search of first turf success over C&D last month but lesser effort over C&D two weeks ago; may bounce back.

runners.name: Heroism
runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.comment: Has dropped down the weights and is 0-17 since his debut win in August 2022.
runners.spotlight: Has dropped down the weights and is 0-17 since his debut win in August 2022; last of 13 at Thirsk (7f, good to firm) 18 days ago; hard to recommend.

stable_tour.quote: He's another one who physically has done very well over the winter and, while he wasn't quite up to the task in Group company last year, I'm hopeful he can grow in confidence in handicaps to start with this season. He definitely needs a firmer surface. 02-05-23

runners.name: Mrs Trump
runners.owner: R Chapman, G J Daly & R J Parks
runners.comment: Third of nine at Redcar last month, suggesting she is coming to hand.
runners.spotlight: Three wins last year, one of them at this venue; third of nine at Redcar (6f, good to firm) last month, suggesting she is coming to hand; holds good claims.

stable_tour.quote: She's a low-grade filly but is a little angel and could easily have won three of her last four starts. Last winter we didn't know whether to keep her in training for this season. There was probably no-one more surprised than me when she won at Redcar in May. I thought she won at Leicester at the start of the month with a little bit more up her sleeve, and to be fair to her if she'd been drawn in the middle of them at Nottingham last time she'd have won there too. She ended up on the stands' rail and didn't quite get there. I'd like to think she'll progress a little bit more, although at a low level. 28-06-24

runners.name: Edvard Grieg

prev_owners.owner: G Brooks & James Sweeney & Jack Thomas

runners.comment: 0-13 but last two efforts were respectable; takes a marked drop in trip.
runners.spotlight: 0-13 but last two efforts were respectable; wears first-time blinkers and takes a marked drop in trip.

runners.name: Lady In Havana
runners.owner: D Morgan And K J Parris
runners.comment: Best form for current yard when fourth to Silky Robin at Brighton 11 days ago.
runners.spotlight: Both wins came at Southwell AW for David Loughnane; best form for current yard when fourth to Silky Robin (7lb better off for less than 3l) at Brighton (6f, good to firm) 11 days ago; may have more to give.

quotes.race: Best Racing Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Lady In Havana has learned quite a lot but the penny is still dropping and hopefully we can have a nice, fun winter with her. Every stride she took the penny was dropping more and she'll be an exciting prospect for the team - Laura Pearson, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Pembrokeshire

prev_owners.owner: P C J Dalby & R D Schuster

runners.comment: Three wins on turf but yet to fire for current yard but not yet one to give up on.
runners.spotlight: Three wins on turf but yet to fire for current yard; on a career-low mark and first-time blinkers are now equipped alongside the hood; not yet one to give up on for respected stable.

quotes.race: Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: Pembrokeshire completely boiled over in the paddock last time and ran his race before he even got down to start. Dom [Hislop] has done a good job leading him up, he's kept a lid on him and got him down to the start in one piece. He had a good gallop to aim at, he was able to get into a rhythm and I thought he stayed the seven [furlongs] quite well - Iain Jardine, trainer.

runners.name: Ishe Worth Agamble
runners.comment: Has shown bits of form but remains a maiden; last of 12 at Newcastle when last seen.
runners.spotlight: Has shown bits of form but remains a maiden; last of 12 at Newcastle (7f, AW) in December when last seen; best watched.

runners.name: Great Generation
runners.comment: Won this race last year but has to overcome a 3lb penalty on this occasion
runners.spotlight: Successful in this race last year, building on her reappearance run; lacks recent match practice on this occasion, having been absent for seven months, and has to overcome a 3lb penalty for her Sceptre win.

quotes.race: Japan Racing Association Sceptre Fillies' Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: It went very smoothly for Great Generation today. It was great to see her back winning. She didn't run a very good race in France last time. Everything went well today. She tries really hard. She's a horse you need to know really well. Last time I rode her at York, when I pressed the button she went straight away and I had nothing left in the last 20 yards. Today I kept hold of her as long as I could - Marco Ghiani, jockey.

quotes.race: William Hill Chartwell Fillies' Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I rode Great Generation out for her canter yesterday and I said to Marco she'd win this, so it worked out well. We were worried about the ground, it dried up quite a bit, but she handled it fine. The sharp seven suited her, I don't think she wants to go any further. She was sharp early on and passing the two-furlong pole I thought I was in trouble, but she showed a lot of turn of foot - Marco Ghiani, rider.

runners.name: Fair Angellica
runners.comment: Peak performance on French soil; something to find on her British form
runners.spotlight: Peak performance on French soil, namely Listed success last July; has something to find on her British form and the forecast ground isn't ideal (seems suited by softer than good in the turf sphere).

quotes.race: Prix Amandine (Listed Race) (3yo Fillies) (Straight Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We came here for a bit of black type and if Fair Angellica won it was only going to be a bonus. The way she shot clear on her last run at Kempton made me very concerned about the mile at Ascot, and she didn't stay. Ryan [Moore, jockey] said she could come back to six, certainly on softer ground. I've an eye on the Oak Tree [at Goodwood] but we'll see - Richard Hughes, trainer.

quotes.race: Godolphin Flying Start Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: David Egan said Fair Angellica was a bit gangly in the early stages but when she hit the rising ground she took off. That's it for this season I think and hopefully she can get some black type next year - Wendy Miller, owner.

stable_tour.quote: We're delighted with her. The ground was too quick at Glorious Goodwood and we couldn't take the chance. She was declared because there was rain forecast and it never appeared, but she seems in great form and Ryan Moore liked her when he won on her. She ran another good race when fourth in the Group 3 Sceptre Fillies' Stakes at Doncaster on Sunday. 18-09-24

runners.name: Jabaara
runners.comment: Productive last summer; not disgraced in US Grade 1 most recently; leading player
runners.spotlight: Productive spell last summer featured two Listed wins (7f) and a good effort, beating all bar the favourite, in the Falmouth; not disgraced in US Grade 1 event most recently; leading player back down in class.

quotes.race: Visit Qatar Oak Tree Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: The stewards have had the luxury of watching it many more times than me from lots of different angles and they have come to that decision, so we have to congratulate the winner. I think Jabaara was on top for much of the race but maybe she just threw it away. Although we definitely took Jim's lane, I didn't think that he had to take back and I didn't think his momentum was checked. I've seen worse incidents not reversed, so I thought we'd be okay. She was dominant and maybe she got a bit lonely in front. She ran off her true line and has paid the penalty. I'm disappointed, but I'm very pleased with her performance - Roger Varian, trainer.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Falmouth Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: Jabaara has run a massive race to be second to a good filly. We rolled the dice a bit and it's come off, and to be Group 1-placed after winning two Listed races is very pleasing. If she comes out of this in good shape we'd like to run her in the Group 3 Oak Tree Stakes at Glorious Goodwood - Roger Varian, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Eternal Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: It was nice and straightforward, and a pleasing performance. I was stuck out wide and couldn't push on early, but I was keen to let Jabaara on once she got balanced. She had a fair bit of weight and I didn't want anything to get the jump on her. The Falmouth might be a bit tough for her but Roger [Varian] has placed her nicely and she's knocked off a couple of Listed races. We'll have a bit of fun with her, but life won't be easy - James Doyle,  jockey.

quotes.race: Edinburgh Gin Queen Of Scots Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Jabaara did that nicely. She travelled strongly, quickened up well and obviously has been suited by the return to seven furlongs. I'm delighted for the team, especially when you send one all the way to Scotland. She could suit a race like the Group 3 Oak Tree Stakes at Goodwood - Roger Varian, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jabaara has always looked smart. I thought she did well there as she was a touch green and he (David Egan) had to take her off heels, switch, and start his run again. We have been fortunate to win the Albany twice before and I think this filly should go straight there as I think she is quite good and she looked it there today. Time will tell us what the form is worth. A strong pace at Ascot over a stiff six on decent ground would suit her I would have thought - Roger Varian, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She runs on Saturday in the Grade 1 Jenny Wiley Stakes at Keeneland, which has been a long-term plan. She had a blowout at Wolverhampton last month and that did its job because her work before she went to America was excellent. Her runs in last season's Falmouth and the Oak Tree justify her being in the race and we'll see how we go. She's very talented and might be campaigned with some imagination this year. There's a nice race at Saratoga in July if she looked suited to that kind of test on Saturday. 11-04-25

She won first time out at Newmarket in the spring before finishing mid-division in the Albany at Royal Ascot. She was unfortunate not to be a place higher when fourth in the Sweet Solera this month at Newmarket. I think the extra furlong of that Group 3 just stretched her too much, but she'll drop back to 6f next time, possibly in the Group 3 Dick Poole Fillies' Stakes at Salisbury on September 7, and I'd expect her to go well. 25-08-23

runners.name: Spiritual
runners.comment: Front-runner who gives the impression this drop back to 7f will suit; interesting
runners.spotlight: Front-runner; campaigned mostly over 1m last term and managed to score in Listed grade at Sandown but generally gave the impression she'll be suited by a drop back in trip; hence, could do well at 7f this year and looks interesting on reappearance.

quotes.race: Coral Distaff (Listed Race) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Spiritual got in a nice rhythm on the front end and has form on slow ground. It all worked out well for us on the day. She kept responding. It's windy up the straight, which might have stopped them making too much ground on us. She's learning and is still lightly raced. She's going the right way so there's no reason to think she can't come on after today - Richard Kingscote, jockey.

runners.name: Ziggys Dream
runners.comment: Peak effort may flatter her; gained biggest win in Italy; not solid
runners.spotlight: Seems to tie in closely with Jabaara on one piece of form last summer but has failed to back up that effort, which may flatter her; gained her biggest win on Italian soil and isn't a solid option.

quotes.race: CAA Stellar Lily Agnes Conditions Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: In my opinion, Ziggy's Dream is actually the better of the two. She wins next time out, and that might be at Royal Ascot - Simon Wood, part-owner.

stable_tour.quote: This filly is the third Inns Of Court of the stable tour and she got off to a superb start when winning a hot-looking maiden at Doncaster late last month. I like her and knew she was pretty sharp, so the win was not a surprise. That said I would expect her to come on a lot for that and she looks like she is capable of doing much better as the season progresses. 10-05-23

runners.name: Cathedral
runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Sir Robert Ogden
runners.comment: Showed major promise last year, clear second in Newmarket Group 3 last time; respected
runners.spotlight: Sole 3yo in this field; cost 800,000euros at breeze-up sale a year ago; showed major promise in September/October, winning in great style on the AW track here (6f) then clear second in Group 3 event at Newmarket (7f); respected with further progress on the cards.

quotes.race: Get Raceday Ready EBF "Newcomers" Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Horses Which Have Never Run) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Cathedral has a Moyglare entry but she won't go there as it'll come too soon. We'll make sure she comes out of the race okay but there's a few options. There's the Cheveley Park and the Oh So Sharp, but they're only being considered at the moment, nothing is certain. She's exciting for next season and it's important she gets that experience as a two-year-old - Amy Drummond, racing manager to Amo Racing.

stable_tour.quote: I took her out of the 1,000 Guineas last week as she needs a bit more time. She's a talented filly and we need to look after her. There are plenty of options further down the line over seven furlongs and a mile. She's a breeze-up graduate but she's easy to deal with. 28-04-25

3:00.race_name: William Hill Lingfield Derby Trial Stakes (Listed Race) (Colts & Geldings)

runners.name: Nightime Dancer
runners.comment: Won at Southwell (AW) on reappearance; open to further improvement; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Attractively bred colt, by Ghaiyyath out of a Sea The Stars mare; has shown solid promise, having been placed at Newmarket in sole 2yo start then successful at Southwell (1m4f, AW) on reappearance; goes up in grade looking open to further progress; possibilities.

stable_tour.quote: He's well bred and ran a lovely debut last year before winning well at Southwell on his reappearance. I think I'll send him to the Lingfield Derby Trial next, he could be up to that grade. 22-04-25

runners.name: Our Enery
runners.breeder: Allevamento Le Gi Srl Societa' Agricola
runners.comment: Unable to defy a penalty in the race won by Nightime Dancer; headgear fitted
runners.spotlight: Justified favouritism at Wolverhampton (1m4f, AW) on seasonal debut but was unable to defy a penalty in the Southwell race won by Nightime Dancer; fitting of headgear needs to prompt improvement.

runners.name: Prince Of The Seas
runners.comment: Reappearance effort (1m2f) suggests this extra yardage will suit; remains of interest
runners.spotlight: Sandown maiden winner at two; perhaps didn't entirely handle Epsom in the Blue Riband Trial (1m2f, good) on reappearance but still ran well on bare figures and shaped as if this extra yardage will suit; remains of interest.

runners.name: Puppet Master
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: The only runner who brings Group form; latest effort has been boosted; duly top on ratings
runners.spotlight: The only runner who brings Group form, having finished fourth in the Royal Lodge and the Ballysax since winning a maiden at the Galway Festival; latest effort received a second boost when the runner-up (from same yard) landed the Chester Vase on Wednesday; duly top on ratings.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Money Back If 2nd To SP Fav Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Puppet Master is a lovely colt. He had a lovely run at Killarney, running green but finishing out well. Today he was very professional. He jumped, travelled, and I thought he quickened up well. He had a look when he got there but he went to the line well and he has a bit of class - Wayne Lordan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He won well at Galway last season and we were disappointed when he was fourth in the Royal Lodge - we don't think he was 100 per cent after that. We were happy with his return when fourth in the Ballysax and he looks like he'll get a mile and a half. 07-04-25

runners.name: Rahiebb
runners.comment: Frankel colt who has a solid novice record; this is harder but he may do better still
runners.spotlight: Frankel colt whose solid novice record comprises a debut win at Newcastle (1m, AW) and two second-place finishes, beaten only a neck at Haydock (11.5f, good) switched to turf latest; something to find on ratings but may do better still.

stable_tour.quote: He's a bit of a thug at home but his two runs have put some manners on him and he ran well both times. I think the handicapper reacted a bit heavily after his last run and we'll probably go for a novice off that rating. He could develop into a nice middle-distance/staying horse if he channels his energy in the right way. 11-04-25

runners.name: Rogue Impact
runners.comment: Nicely bred; justified favouritism in AW maiden here last time; should build on that win
runners.spotlight: Nicely bred colt, by Study Of Man out of a well-related Galileo mare; likely found 7f too sharp in sole run for Peter Chapple-Hyam; well suited by the step up to 1m4f in Polytrack maiden here since, justifying favouritism with something left up his sleeve; should build on that win and looks an interesting prospect.

runners.name: Stay True
runners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith
runners.comment: Galileo colt; successful debut in Leopardstown maiden one month ago; promising sort
runners.spotlight: Galileo colt who cost 400,000gns as a foal; made a successful debut in Leopardstown maiden (1m2f, good) one month ago, leaving the impression this longer distance will suit; promising sort who is one of two strong contenders for Aidan O'Brien.

1:15.race_name: William Hill Oaks Trial Fillies' Stakes (Listed Race)

runners.name: Giselle

prev_owners.owner: P M Brant & Mrs J Magnier & M Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.comment: Third in 1m Group 3 last October; from top Irish yard and she's a leading candidate
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden at the Curragh last October on second start (7f, good; unraced on faster) and close third in Group 3 there (1m, soft) later that month; she could do with settling better now up in trip but the first-time hood could help in that regard; from top Irish yard and she's a leading candidate.

quotes.race: Staffordstown Stud Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: Giselle was a bit babyish and still a bit green. He tried to teach her, which was the right thing to do. He was delighted with her. He felt that she isn't there yet. She got there and got a little bit tired. She had a big hold up in the middle of the season and I ran her because I wanted to get Ryan over to sit on her again and he was very happy with her. The experience will do her a world of good when it comes to next year. She's a very good filly - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: Giselle is a smashing filly with a lot of class. She is a smashing big filly and hopefully she will be rocking up in all the big fillies' races next season - Chris Armstrong, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She had a few little hold-ups but we're looking at her as an Oaks filly with a trial before. She's headstrong and always trying to do a little more than you want her to, but she's a big filly, powerful and strong. 07-04-25

runners.name: Harpsichord
runners.comment: Probably needs the other two to underperform but this bright prospect is not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Won 1m4f AW novice here last month on her second run and came well clear with the winner in Southwell novice (1m4f, AW) ten days ago; makes turf debut and probably needs the other two to underperform but this half-sister to Grade 2 winner Siskany is a bright prospect who is not ruled out.

runners.name: Love Talk
runners.comment: Best 2yo efforts came on slow ground but form of Goodwood win last September reads well
runners.spotlight: Her best 2yo form came on slow ground and that campaign ended with two below-par runs; however, the form of her valuable Series Final win at Goodwood (7f, heavy) last September reads well and she's shown hints of staying potential; not discounted on reappearance.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Bands C And D) (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were concerned about the ground because Love Talk might want it better, but I was keen to get her out on the track. It was nice to see her do the same on the track as what she is showing at home. She'll want further in time as she's not a sprinter by any means, but she's one to look forward to. We have a nice batch of two-year-olds this year. There are plenty of options for her. She holds an entry for a Group 3 in France, but whether we take that up this early in her career is debatable - Grant Tuer, trainer.

2:25.race_name: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Kings Code
runners.comment: Unproven at the trip but there's stamina in his pedigree and he's not written off
runners.spotlight: Has an impressive 10-40 strike-rate and bolted up at Pontefract (1m2f, good) last month; failed to back that up at Epsom (1m2f, good) eight days later and he's unproven at this trip, but there's stamina in his pedigree and he didn't run badly on that latest outing; shouldn't be written off.

quotes.race: Mitchell & Co. Building Services Handicap
quotes.quote: King's Code is a big lad and, with the ground as quick as it was, I thought he might struggle a bit, which he did early doors. The cheekpieces helped him concentrate, the penny dropped late and he closed really well - Sean Levey, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Power Of Destiny
runners.comment: Inconsistent and always behind last time, but lightly raced and remains of interest
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who is in and out and was always behind at Newcastle last month after a three-month break; however, she won at Kempton (1m3f, AW) last November and went very close here (1m2f, AW) in January, and she's effective on fast turf; in the mix if leaving last time behind.

runners.name: Vice President

prev_owners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier

runners.comment: Ex-Aidan O'Brien; lightly raced and could improve for last month's stable debut at Newbury
runners.spotlight: Won 1m2f maiden at Leopardstown (good) last July on third and final run for Aidan O'Brien; sold for 30,000gns last October and beaten about 5l when sixth of seven on last month's handicap and stable debut at Newbury (2m, good); could improve for that run and not ruled out under Ryan Moore.

runners.name: Candyman Stan
runners.comment: Won by 5l on return at Brighton and this unexposed 4yo could still be well treated up 7lb
runners.spotlight: Made it two wins from his five starts when scoring by 5l in a handicap at Brighton (1m4f, good to firm) on last month's reappearance; a 7lb rise could have been worse for this unexposed 4yo and he has strong claims.

runners.name: Charlies Choice
runners.comment: Won off this mark on AW in February but not at his very best on his last three starts
runners.spotlight: Three AW wins in the winter (9.4f-1m4f) and runs off latest winning mark; showed promise on turf last summer (albeit 0-5 on grass); however, not at his very best on his last three runs and has to raise his game.

quotes.race: Weekly £5 Free Bet With BetUK Handicap (Gbbplus Race)
quotes.quote: Charlie's Choice is ultra consistent and seems to like it here too. There wasn't much pace and we were able just to roll forward and get a position. He's a very willing partner and battled back well - Kieran Shoemark, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

1:50.race_name: William Hill Top Price Guarantee Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Hamlets Night
runners.comment: Went close at Haydock a fortnight ago on second British start and he's on the shortlist
runners.spotlight: Well backed when back down in trip in a first-time tongue-tie (retained) at Haydock (1m2f, good) a fortnight ago on his second British start, and he was beaten just a head; just 1lb higher today and on the shortlist.

runners.name: Croeso Cymraeg
runners.comment: Two wins last October but this 11yo has gone back up the weights and lacks a recent run
runners.spotlight: Won two in a row last October (1m2f, heavy/soft) and he's versatile ground-wise; he went close on his reappearance runs in 2021 and 2023 but this 11yo has gone back up the weights will have to be at the top of his game if he's to make a winning comeback today.

quotes.race: Rod Gaskin Handicap
quotes.quote: When I pressed the button I was a little bit surprised, Croeso Cymraeg showed a good turn of foot, a big engine. He's a horse who is still a little bit green when he hits the front, but I believed if another horse came he would probably find something else - Raul Da Silva, jockey.

quotes.race: Play 4 To Score At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: Croeso Cymraeg has grown up a little and is getting the hang of it. There aren't too many miles on the clock and hopefully he can continue to progress -   James Evans, trainer.

runners.name: Mostawaa
runners.comment: Won over 8.5f at Epsom last September; concern about his stamina now back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Won at Epsom (8.5f, soft) last September and he's fine on fast ground; could improve for last month's fair reappearance fourth at Epsom (8.5f, good) but there's a concern about his stamina now back up in trip.

quotes.race: Stablemate By Agma Carlisle Bell Handicap
quotes.quote: Mostawaa has turned a corner in his old age. He won at Brighton two starts ago and then he went to York and toughed it out. I got a very easy lead that day and things fell right whereas today there was plenty of pace on paper, so you just never know. He stuck to it well on soft ground and I think we can investigate going up to ten furlongs now. Between the three and the two I didn't get much of a breather into him and we were going a good gallop. Myself and Pierre were kind of taking each other on but to be fair they both fought on well - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: Ice Co Supporting Macmillan Handicap
quotes.quote: I was a bit worried because Mostawaa didn't have his headgear on today but he jumped well, settled, and got into a nice rhythm. The further he went the better, and he loved the ground - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

runners.name: Morcar
runners.comment: C&D winner who was a good third off this mark at Windsor recently; solid claims
runners.spotlight: Two fast-ground wins last year, including over C&D, and built upon his reappearance run to post a good third at Windsor (1m2f, good to firm) recently; solid claims off the same mark this afternoon.

runners.name: Mister Daydream
runners.comment: Has won his last two; things have clearly clicked and he's respected under a 5lb penalty
runners.spotlight: Made all at Beverley (1m2f, good) last month on second start back from an absence and followed up at Hamilton (1m3f, good to firm) last Sunday; things have clearly clicked and he's respected under a 5lb penalty.

runners.name: Fox Avatar
runners.comment: Encouraging fourth on handicap/seasonal debut; in top hands and open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Promise during last season's light, first campaign (including on fast ground) and close fourth on recent handicap/seasonal debut at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW); could do with settling better (the hood that was adopted last time is left off) but he's in top hands and open to improvement; possible player.

runners.name: Gincident
runners.comment: There's mileage in his mark on his old form and this step up in trip is worth a go
runners.spotlight: Stamina to prove on first run beyond 8.6f but he's been in good form since joining this yard (with and without the tongue-tie; absent today) and rallied late at Yarmouth (1m, good to firm) last time, suggesting this step up in trip is worth a go; hood returns (has run well in it); there's mileage in his mark based on his old form and it will be no surprise to see a big run.

runners.name: Dashinwhitesargent
runners.comment: Excuses on reappearance and capable of being in the mix now back down in trip
runners.spotlight: Below-par fifth at Epsom last month but a combination of the 1m4f trip and the lack of a recent run may have counted against him; he's just 1lb higher than when winning at Epsom last August (1m2f, good; unraced on faster) and is capable of being in the mix now back down in trip.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well first time out in a handicap at Epsom, where he finished second but came back with a dirty scope, so it was probably better than it looked. It's taken a while to get him spot on but he's a fun three-year-old. 06-06-24

runners.name: Party Island
runners.comment: On a handy mark on last year's best turf form; encouraging run last time; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Has a better strike-rate on AW but handicapped accordingly on turf and he's just 1lb higher than when winning at Sandown (1m2f, good) last July; had a wide trip when close sixth of 16 here (1m4f, AW) three weeks ago, so that run can be upgraded, and he's not ruled out.

runners.name: Zabeel Road
runners.breeder: Mrs O Murtagh & Iirsh National Stud
runners.comment: Market may prove best guide, upped 2f in distance for new stable
runners.spotlight: Campaigned at 5f last spring/summer for Charlie Johnston, winning on debut; sold for 42,000gns and gelded since last run; market may prove best guide, upped in trip for new yard.

runners.name: Leadenhall Street
runners.comment: 6f AW scorer; something to prove back at 7f and on turf
runners.spotlight: 6f winner on AW this year; difficult task at Newcastle on Good Friday most recently; returns to a more suitable grade but has something to prove back at 7f and on turf.

runners.name: Prince Of India
runners.comment: Good results (won/second) on AW this term; open to further progress
runners.spotlight: Campaigned only over 7f; good results on AW this term, opening his account in novice event then going close in handicap; showed promise in sole turf start; open to further progress.

runners.name: Sergio Parisse
runners.comment: Raced only at shorter and isn't guaranteed to stay this new trip
runners.spotlight: Speedily bred colt who has raced only at sprint distances, creditable third in AW contest most recently; gained his 2yo win on turf but isn't guaranteed to stay this new trip.

stable_tour.quote: He's shown a good deal of promise, although he's also had a couple of hold-ups. He won at Windsor last summer but then needed a wind operation after getting beaten at odds-on at Salisbury. We gave him a couple of runs on the all-weather early this year, but he'll be going back on turf when he returns in a few weeks. 17-04-25

runners.name: Cradle Of Love

prev_owners.owner: Mrs M V Magnier/Mrs P Shanahan/K MacLennan/J P Magnier

runners.comment: Hopes of first win are pinned on the belated switch to a handicap
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish filly who failed to show improvement in AW maiden on stable/seasonal debut, taking record to 0-11; hopes of first win are pinned on the belated switch to handicap level.

stable_tour.quote: She has plenty of ability but threw the race away at Listowel last time. She'd have an outside chance. 12-06-24

runners.name: The Hare Rail
runners.owner: Mrs Muriel Forward & Dr G C Forward
runners.comment: Good second in final 2yo start; gelded since; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in four of his six starts last term, good second over 7f on AW the final time; could go one better, provided he shows the benefit of a subsequent gelding operation.

runners.name: Tattie Bogle
runners.comment: Two duck eggs this year; best watched
runners.spotlight: Ended his 2yo campaign with a 6f AW win; still needs to show he has trained on, having posted two duck eggs this year; best watched unless the market speaks positively.

runners.name: Toy Soldier
runners.comment: Holds weak claims on his handicap form
runners.spotlight: Good spell at maiden/novice level last summer; holds weak claims on his subsequent handicap form and isn't straightforward (too headstrong in penultimate run).

runners.name: Brave Byreflection
runners.comment: Twice-raced filly who brings potential to handicap debut; interesting
runners.spotlight: Promise over 6f last season comprised a second-place finish at Ripon and success at Kempton (AW); likely to stay 7f this year and brings potential to handicap debut; interesting.

runners.name: Elizabeth Bay
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs B V Sangster & J Chapple-Hyam
runners.comment: May be capable of progress now handicapping
runners.spotlight: Four-race maiden who has rather stagnated in terms of form but may be capable of progress now handicapping; beaten only about 2l in each of her first two outings.

runners.name: Equalised
runners.comment: Best efforts on AW but shapes as if this new trip will suit
runners.spotlight: Clear best 6f efforts on AW, latest when favourite for a handicap on seasonal debut; shapes as if this new trip will suit; possibilities, provided he's as effective back on turf.

stable_tour.quote: The form of his first two races is strong but he wants better ground than he's had the last twice. He broke slowly from a terrible draw at Chester last time and you can put a line through that. He's rated 71 and should be competitive off that. He could go to Goodwood on Friday. 02-08-24

4:45.race_name: William Hill More Top Prices Handicap

runners.name: Bang On The Bell
runners.comment: Second in this last year and won at Windsor 12 days ago; solid claims
runners.spotlight: Runner-up at Wolverhampton (5f, AW) in March then went one better at Windsor (5f, good to firm); second in this last year; solid claims.

runners.name: Twilight Madness
runners.owner: P R Hedger & P C F Racing Ltd
runners.comment: Not at the top of his game the last twice; has much better strike-rate on AW than turf
runners.spotlight: The return to 5f may be a plus but he hasn't been at the top of his game over 6f on AW the last twice and he's just 1-13 on turf as opposed to 6-26 on AW; others have more pressing claims.

quotes.race: BetUK Over 40,000 Live Streamed Races Handicap
quotes.quote: Twilight Madness gave me a really good feel up to halfway but the horse who was making it couldn't really take me far enough and he was dossing a bit once in front - Jason Hart, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Protest Rally
runners.owner: Mrs C M Clarke, Foulrice Park Racing Ltd
runners.comment: Won at Musselburgh recently; likes it there but he's also effective elsewhere
runners.spotlight: Won at Musselburgh last Friday when dropped back to 5f (good); his last three wins have come at the Edinburgh venue but he's capable of running big races elsewhere and is entitled to respect; first turf run here.

runners.name: Kalik
runners.comment: Promising debut in April 2023 but just two runs since and well beaten each time
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on debut at Newbury (5f, soft) in April 2023; just two runs since, in May 2023 and September 2024, and well beaten each time; market check advised on handicap debut but he has something to prove.

stable_tour.quote: He disappointed a little bit on his second run having run very well the first time out at Newbury. He proved to be a little bit gassy. He's a huge, big two-year-old so we gave him a bit of a break and had him gelded. He's back in full training now and we're very happy with him and would expect to have him out before the end of the season. We don't have any lofty ambitions and want to pitch him in at the right level and win a race with him. He stands 16.2hh and can't have been at his full strength early on so he'll improve as he matures. 21-09-23

runners.name: Catch Cunningham
runners.comment: Had to wait for a clear run when sixth of 14 at Musselburgh and might not be far away
runners.spotlight: Twice went close on AW in February/March and he travelled well when waiting for a clear run at Musselburgh (5f, good) four weeks ago, when he finished sixth of 14; might not be far away.

quotes.race: William Hill Play Responsibly/EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That wasn't ideal. We wanted to take a lead but Catch Cunningham jumped well and no-one wanted to go on. We reverted to plan B and that's hard to do here. But he's very game and genuine. He'll be better in a better race -  Kevin Ryan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's fast and extremely genuine. He ran well first time out and will go for the five-furlong handicap at York, though he'll get six. 10-05-22

runners.name: My Awele
runners.comment: Not at the top of her game over 6f/7f this year but won last October on latest 5f attempt
runners.spotlight: Unproven on turf and she hasn't been at the top of her game this year over 6f/7f on AW, but she won at Southwell last October when she last tackled 5f and is now just 2lb higher; not ruled out now back down in trip.

quotes.race: AK Bets Home Of Free Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: We're very happy, particularly as My Awele had a bad pelvic fracture last year and it has taken a long time to nurse her back to full health - Conrad Allen, trainer.

runners.name: Maharajas Express
runners.comment: Running well on AW; return to turf asks a question but this in-form 5yo isn't discounted
runners.spotlight: Won two in a row at Wolverhampton (5f, AW) in February and has continued in good form on AW; he's possibly not as effective on turf (1-14 on grass as opposed to 4-22 on AW) but this in-form 5yo isn't discounted.

quotes.race: BetUK It's Where The UK Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: I knew they were going to go pretty hard but I was able to sit a little bit further forward than I did last time. Maharajas Express is quite a keen horse but he relaxed nice enough halfway and it took a while to really hit top gear today. I got a bit of luck up the straight but he's very tough and there's more improvement in him - David Probert, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Merrimack
runners.comment: Two-time turf winner who has been placed on AW the last twice; could make another bold bid
runners.spotlight: Made all twice in a row last summer (6f/5f, soft/good) and he's been placed at Chelmsford (5f, AW) the last twice; could make another bold bid.

runners.name: Angle Land

prev_owners.owner: K Dasmal, A Rix, R Penney

runners.comment: Won off 7lb higher last June; some fair runs this year but losing sequence is up to 15
runners.spotlight: She's dropped to a mark 7lb lower than when winning at Yarmouth (5f, good to firm) last June; some fair efforts on AW this year, including at Wolverhampton 11 days ago, but her losing sequence is up to 15 races.

quotes.race: QuinBet Daily Free Bet Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Angle Land is a tough filly and that was a good performance with 10st 2lb on her back - Neil Callan, jockey.

runners.name: So Smart
runners.comment: Two wins last summer and below last winning mark, but yet to hit top gear this year
runners.spotlight: Two wins last summer (5f, good to firm/good to soft) and he's below his last winning mark; however, he needs to produce more than he's managed on his two outings at Bath this year.

quotes.race: Betting.Bet Live Racing Results Handicap
quotes.quote: He pinged the gates but did find the ground on the quick side, So Smart changed leads a couple of times but got away with it in the end. He likes to front-run because when he's in behind he doesn't do a whole lot, if something comes to him he goes again. He's an older horse so it's good to change things (headgear) and it's worked tonight - Kieran O'Neill, jockey, speaking to Sky Racing.

runners.name: Level Up
runners.comment: Runner-up in January but hasn't performed to the same level on his four outings since
runners.spotlight: Five-time turf winner, the latest at Salisbury (5f, good to firm) last August off 7lb higher; runner-up at Southwell (5f, AW) in January but hasn't performed to the same level on his four outings since.

runners.name: Outer Edge
runners.owner: Int Plywood (Lmporters) Ltd And C Mason
runners.comment: Inconsistent but back on scoresheet 12 days ago; possible player if on another going day
runners.spotlight: His form has been up and down but he won at Chepstow (6f, good to firm) last August and was back on the scoresheet at Wolverhampton (5f, AW) 12 days ago; possible player up 5lb if he's on another going day.

runners.name: Kento
runners.comment: Beat just three rivals when getting off the mark at Wolverhampton, but not ruled out
runners.spotlight: It took him 14 races to get off the mark and had just three rivals to beat on that occasion, at Wolverhampton (5f, AW) in March in reapplied cheekpieces; however, he's unexposed in the cheekpieces and is just 2lb higher today; ran well on turf here last August and is not ruled out.

runners.name: Colors Of Freedom
runners.comment: Encouraging fourth on AW on recent reappearance; something to prove now back on turf
runners.spotlight: Two wins at Wolverhampton (5f, AW) last autumn and encouraging fourth on recent reappearance there; could build on that and she hasn't had many goes on turf, but well beaten on each occasion she's tackled grass.

quotes.race: talkSPORT Download The App Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Colours of Freedom has taken a little while to come to hand and I think that stiffer 6f has really played to her strengths. She's off a basement mark, so hopefully she can have a productive winter - Luke Morris, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

2:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 7.0) (Watered) (Outer track)

runners.name: Elegant Erin

prev_owners.owner: Pall Mall Partners And Sue Hopgood

runners.comment: Three wins last year; good 2nd at Beverley last month; big player back against females
runners.spotlight: Did well after a wind operation last year, winning handicaps at Newcastle (twice) and Beverley; ran well off this mark at Beverley last month and she's one to take seriously back down in class against female opposition.

stable_tour.quote: I love her to bits. If she were a human being she'd definitely be marriage material; she's an absolute sweetheart. She's been absolutely fantastic since we got her. She's honest and genuine and gives you absolutely everything. But for some reason, she hasn't quite been seeing out her races, so we gave her a minor wind op the other week. She loves good ground and is ready to go again. She's on 77 and has become potentially well handicapped again. At Carlisle on her most recent start, she was second when she bumped into a progressive filly of Steph Hollinshead's. I'd be expecting her to pay her way again shortly. 28-06-24

runners.name: Sugar Hill Babe
runners.comment: Penultimate 2nd over C&D was a personal best; failed to build on it on AW latest
runners.spotlight: Ran well for second over C&D last month but she took a backward step at Southwell 13 days ago; hopes pinned on the return to turf sparking a revival.

runners.name: Naanas Diamond
runners.comment: Well beaten in three runs this year; drops in class with cheekpieces tried; others safer
runners.spotlight: Two heavy defeats in Dubai in January and she was also beaten a long way at Southwell on last month's return to Britain; down in class and tried in cheekpieces (wore tongue-tie latest, absent today) but others may prove better treated.

runners.name: Nad Alshiba Green
runners.comment: Two 5f wins as a 2yo and shaped well on her return last month (hampered); good chance
runners.spotlight: Won two 5f nurseries as a 2yo; attracted support ahead of her Thirsk reappearance 18 days ago (5f, good to firm) and would surely have gone close but for being cut up against the stands' rail when starting to make her challenge; interesting contender.

quotes.race: DragonBet Proud Sponsors Of Bath Racing Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Nad Alshiba Green found six furlongs on slow ground a little bit tiring but she was in the right race there - Oisin Murphy, rider.

runners.name: Miss Funky Monk
runners.comment: Won well at Wolverhampton in January (5f); brings untapped potential on her handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Improved with each of her three starts this winter, running out a cosy winner of a 5f maiden at Wolverhampton when last seen 126 days ago; brings potential to this handicap debut and she's not ruled out.

runners.name: Havana Gila
runners.comment: York novice win as a 2yo; low-key return in March (AW) but better than that & yard in form
runners.spotlight: Didn't kick on from her York success last June (5f, good to soft) but often ran well in defeat; tame effort on her return to action at Southwell in March; dropped 2lb and yard amongst the winners.

runners.name: Military Girl
runners.comment: Both wins have come over 5f at Catterick; 4lb rise for last month's win could find her out
runners.spotlight: 5f Catterick win as a 2yo; returned from a 264-day absence to win a Catterick handicap 17 days ago, edging left under pressure but finding plenty; 4lb rise against better opposition might find her out.

3:05.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 7.0) (Watered) (Outer track)

runners.name: First View
runners.comment: Dubai regular; retains ability; below best latest; first turf run in Britain since 2023
runners.spotlight: Dubai regular who retained ability there (about 1m1f, good) in January but less good next time; now has first turf run in Britain since down the field in two Class 2 races in 2023 and he's only 3lb lower than the latest of them; goes without regular cheekpieces and has a bit to prove.

runners.name: Signcastle City
runners.comment: Has won on firm; three handicap wins at 1m/7f in 2024; close 2nd on AW return; solid
runners.spotlight: Has won on firm and soft; generally reliable, adding three handicaps (1m and 7f) in 2024, and he ran as well as he ever has on return to action on Chelmsford AW (7f) 12 days ago; has less to prove than some.

runners.name: Padishakh
runners.comment: Very useful 3yo in France; well treated on 1m run in September; new yard
runners.spotlight: Very useful 3yo in France when placed in Group 3 and Listed races; had ups and downs for David O'Meara in 2024 but he's well treated on a close second over 1m at Ayr (good to firm) in September; played no part in Dubai since but remains of interest for new yard.

stable_tour.quote: Had his first start for us in the Doncaster Mile when he didn't appreciate the heavy ground. He's got some good form in France and had a run in Britain at the end of last year for Roger Varian when he probably didn't handle Newmarket. From what we saw in France last year he possesses a good deal of ability and hopefully we can get him back on track. There's a lovely horse in there. 19-04-24

runners.name: Indalo
runners.comment: Two novice wins on Newcastle AW; capable of better than 3rd on handicap debut there
runners.spotlight: Has managed just one run in three seasons of racing, looking promising for 7f and 1m novice wins on Newcastle AW before his handicap debut didn't unfold in his favour there in February; likely capable of better on turf debut.

stable_tour.quote: He took a while to come to hand last year before winning his novice at Newcastle in November and he's still a few weeks away from running. He's very laid-back and should be capable of developing through the summer as he gains further experience. There's a valuable race at Gowran [Gowran Classic] at the start of June which he qualifies for. 25-04-24

runners.name: Shamrock Bay
runners.comment: Won first 2 starts, including C&D; off since August but has handicap potential
runners.spotlight: Finished strongly when making a winning debut at Yarmouth (7f, good) before following up under more positive ride over C&D (good to firm) in August; gelded since; has handicap potential for yard that won this in 2022.

stable_tour.quote: Bought to be a sharp, early two-year-old, he has just grown and grown, and is a big unit. He's produced some encouraging work but isn't quite the finished article. We'll be patient, but in the middle of the summer, when the heat comes out of the maidens, he should be able to win one and go from there. 02-05-24

runners.name: Thyer
runners.comment: Two novice wins in Britain; fair 4th in 1m Ascot handicap in October; now in cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Failed to advance his reputation in Dubai this year but he previously won two novices (good) in Britain and wasn't far away in a 1m Ascot handicap (soft) in October; still has a shade to prove in first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Kitaro Kich
runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.owner: J Machale, S Tucker & S Jewell

runners.name: King Of Charm
runners.comment: Below best on AW when last seen but goes well fresh and conditions suit; thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 campaign with a downbeat AW run but he has a good record fresh, having made a winning debut as 2yo and finding only one (who was way ahead of her mark) too good on reappearance last year; suited by good and quicker ground; thereabouts.

runners.name: Crimson Road
runners.comment: Won two 1m2f handicaps in 2024; nothing doing for new yard so far; trip query kept to 1m
runners.spotlight: Won two of his five turf handicaps at 1m2f (good to firm) for the Crisfords in 2024; nothing doing for new yard so far and has plenty to prove kept to 1m; of more interest later when back at 1m2f.

4:15.race_name: 'Mrs Bloggsys Ladies Day Double Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Sprint Series Qualifier)
4:15.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 7.0) (Watered) (Outer track)

runners.name: Haymaker
runners.comment: Won this last year off 3lb lower; wind op since last seen; good chance with a clean start
runners.spotlight: Won the corresponding race 12 months ago off a 3lb lower mark; had the benefit of a run on that occasion, and when winning the previous May, but he can run well fresh and has had another wind surgery since last in action; doesn't always get it right at the start but he's a big player if he negotiates the stalls without alarm.

quotes.race: Betfair Racing Only Bettor Podcast 'Confined' Handicap
quotes.quote: I think seven is far enough for Haymaker as he just got home. Every time he ran last year, he seemed to choke. He had good form but if you don't get home, you don't get home. Today he did get home on ground that was quick enough for him. Seven on that ground he just got away with it, so I wouldn't be surprised if he came back to six furlongs. He's a fun horse - Hughie Morrison, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was unlucky first time out when he just seemed to get in a muddle in the stalls, but he won last time at Nottingham under a great ride by David Allan. He‘s won over 7f, 6f and 5f on good or good to firm ground and for horses like him you could find three or four races every week. He was put up 3lb, so he's now on 85, but he did win off that mark at Windsor last year and should hopefully still be competitive. He has entries this weekend at Haydock and Goodwood. 06-06-24

runners.name: Rocking Ends
runners.comment: Had a good summer for this yard in 2024; capable off this mark but absent 233 days
runners.spotlight: Has always been blessed with plenty of ability and he did well when switched to Tom Clover last summer, winning 5f handicaps at Windsor and Newmarket; solid effort over 6f when last seen in September; not on a bad mark if ready to roll on his return.

runners.name: Nazron
runners.comment: On a good mark and latest 6f run strongly suggested he was ready to capitalise
runners.spotlight: Ran out an impressive winner of a 5f handicap at Windsor last August (good to firm) when 2lb lower; two promising runs after wind surgery in January, notably last time at Wolverhampton where he tanked through a strongly run 6f handicap, leading in the final furlong but picked off late on by two rivals who came from off the pace; dropped 2lb for that hugely promising effort and he's a major player back at 5f.

quotes.race: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Job done I think for Nazron. He's ran consistent all year. He's a nice horse and it was nice to get his head in front, so hopefully that will give him a bit of confidence going forward - David Egan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Fidelius
runners.comment: Impressive in a small field on AW in March but well held on turf latest; others stronger
runners.spotlight: Returned from a break with an easy front-running win at Chelmsford in March; came up short off this 8lb higher mark at Epsom 18 days ago; needs a career best if he is to record a first turf win.

runners.name: Burning Cash
runners.owner: C Priestley, M Hammond & D Flynn
runners.comment: On a dangerous mark and can leave his reappearance effort behind him; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Won a Thirsk handicap (5f, good to firm) off a 1lb higher mark last May; looked in need of the run when tenth at Beverley on his return to action 16 days ago; can do much better here.

stable_tour.quote: He was a really good two-year-old, but because that the handicapper got hold of him. He had nearly a year off and then last season, like some of the others, he wasn't quite 100 per cent. But he's come back and run some solid races this time - his second at Newcastle in February behind a horse of Godolphin's was an excellent run. He's been a little bit in and out but I thought he did well to win at Thirsk last month. In the good sprint there last time he missed the start a little bit but ran on and hit the line strongly to finish fifth, so you can mark that run up. He can win off his current rating and hopefully he'll pay his way again. He might go to Newcastle on Friday, but I'm not sure he'll get in. If he doesn't go there, he'll go to Beverley or somewhere like that in the near future. 28-06-24

runners.name: Sanat
runners.comment: AW win in February gives him claims but needs to bounce back from a poor effort on Monday
runners.spotlight: Responded well to a tongue-tie when scoring at Southwell (5f) in February; hung left and quickly eased when favourite for a Beverley handicap on Monday; risky on the back of that.

stable_tour.quote: He's new to us having had only five starts. He won on his most recent outing at Nottingham for Roger Varian. Back in May, he was the last horse off the bridle in a Doncaster novice won by Kind Of Blue and that run really grabbed our attention. Since then he's had two starts in handicaps and done nothing wrong. Although he won by only a neck at Nottingham, we thought he had a lot in hand, particularly with the way he went through the race. He's going to be gelded and he'll be ready to run early in the new year. He's a well-bred horse with a lot of sprinters in his pedigree. Giving him a little bit of time should see him progress further. 26-09-24

runners.name: South Parade
runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.comment: Upwardly mobile 4yo; promising 2nd on Beverley return (front two clear); up 3lb; contender
runners.spotlight: Progressive in the second half of 2024 and she took another step forward when second of 13 at Beverley 16 days ago (5f, good), racing enthusiastically and only picked off in the final 100 yards (front two clear); up 3lb but she hasn't finished progressing just yet.

runners.name: Spirit Of Applause
runners.breeder: S Von Schilcher & Catridge Farm Stud
runners.comment: Should be at concert pitch after two runs this year but others have more
runners.spotlight: Two runs this season should have him spot on and he's on the same mark as when going close at Southwell in November; others may have a bit more handicapping scope though.

quotes.race: Constant Security Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Spirit Of Applause is a very strong-travelling horse and when he hits the front he just does enough. When he puts his best foot forward he's very effective - Sean Kirrane, jockey.

1:20.race_name: 'Sipson Construction Services 15yr Anniversary Apprentice Handicap (Apprentice Training - RE Series)
1:20.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 7.0) (Watered) (Outer track)

runners.name: Its Tim
runners.comment: Laughed at a double penalty when completing a four-timer four days ago
runners.spotlight: Not at all pressed in winning his last four under Jack Callan, the last two by margins of 9l and 11l; laughed at a double penalty at Wolverhampton four days ago (1m6f) and he's handicapped to go in again.

runners.name: Oslo
runners.comment: Doesn't appear to be operating at the peak of his powers at the minute
