runners.spotlight: Didn't run badly without threatening in 1m4f/9.4f AW handicaps before finishing well held in a useful handicap hurdle three weeks ago; doesn't appear to be operating at the peak of his powers at the minute.

stable_tour.quote: He has been a little unlucky not to win this year with three seconds, all at Lingfield. Last week he was a little disappointing but they crawled round and he needs a good pace, so when they quickened he was caught out. He will have a break now before coming back on the turf. I think he can win on the grass in fact he could be a better horse than on the all-weather. He seems versatile regarding trip, but I feel 1m4f in a true run race would be ideal for him, as when it is run slowly he gets a bit keen and is hard to settle. 29-03-21

runners.name: The Crafty Mole
runners.comment: Hard to be confident but he's on a workable mark on last year's exploits at this trip
runners.spotlight: Excelled last April-August over 1m6f, winning five times (the latest in a first-time visor); beat only one home on his return when without headgear and now goes in cheekpieces; hard to be confident but he's on a workable mark.

runners.name: Bulldog Spirit
runners.comment: Beaten just over 2l from a wicked draw in a big field at Lingfield 22 days ago
runners.spotlight: 1m3f Tapeta winner in March and ran really well be beaten just over 2l from a wicked draw in a big field at Lingfield 22 days ago (1m4f AW); has won twice on turf and not without hope.

runners.name: Legacy Power
runners.comment: Capable on his day last season but it's been a laboured start to current campaign
runners.spotlight: Mixed bag last season after being gelded, though did win a 2m AW handicap off 3lb higher and was twice runner-up; his two turf defeats were in maidens so those are forgiven, but harder to turn a blind eye to this year's two modest shows on the AW.

runners.name: Alright Sunshine
runners.comment: An exposed 10yo who doesn't arrive here in the best of form
runners.spotlight: An exposed 10yo who doesn't arrive here in the best of form; not expected to secure a tenth career win.

quotes.race: Visit The All New racinguk.com "Junior" Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: Alright Sunshine is a nice type who has done it well and should improve plenty for it. He's well-related and they quite like him at home - Brian Hughes, jockey.

runners.name: Corsican Caper
runners.comment: Well handicapped and penultimate run was good, but would prefer slower ground
runners.spotlight: Now 9lb lower than for last September's 2m win at Chester (heavy) and his final turf run at Doncaster in March was respectable, finishing fourth of 18; would prefer slower ground in an ideal world.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Corsican Caper loves this type of ground, so he'll probably keep going through the autumn. He's not hard on himself and hopefully there's a bit of improvement in him. He'll cope with a bigger track as well and anything from a mile-six to two miles will suit him - Kevin Frost, trainer.

3:40.race_name: PricedUp Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Mile Series Qualifier)
3:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 7.0) (Watered) (Outer track)

runners.name: Triple Double A
runners.comment: Well-bred gelding seeking a four-timer and seemed to just do enough at Windsor
runners.spotlight: Didn't exactly blow them away when defying a penalty to complete his hat-trick (all 1m handicaps) at Windsor but did enough to get the job done and effectively only 5lb higher now if taking Brandon Wilkie's claim into account; well bred and entitled to improve some more.

quotes.race: Cameron Smart Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: Triple Double A is a son of Mohaather and was a bit immature last season. It was good placing by Hugo. He'll get a mile and a quarter, and a mile on a sharp, turning track like this was always going to expose his babyish antics, but he's getting it together - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

runners.name: Ventura Dream
runners.comment: Making turf debut but would be dangerous if granted some freedom up front
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who made a successful handicap debut at Southwell (1m) after being gelded and hung about for placed honours back there last time (first-time cheekpieces); making turf debut here but would be dangerous if granted some freedom up front.

runners.name: Harswell Ruby
runners.comment: Showed a good attitude at Doncaster, still improving and only 3lb higher
runners.spotlight: Involved in tight finishes this season, getting the better of the deal when edging out Seed Investor at Doncaster (1m, good to firm); showed a good attitude, still improving and only 3lb higher.

runners.name: Seed Investor
runners.comment: Closely matched with Harswell Ruby should he repeat his Doncaster form in cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Surprising to see the cheekpieces back on as they didn't do much for him two runs back and he then nearly beat Harswell Ruby when wearing no headgear at Doncaster; there's nothing between them on these terms should he give his running.

runners.name: Thiscouldbefun
runners.owner: Mrs Wendy Jarrett & J S Moore
runners.comment: Placed in plenty of handicaps before narrowly getting off the mark in a Class 6 at Bath
runners.spotlight: Placed in plenty of handicaps before narrowly getting off the mark in a Class 6 at Bath (1m, good to firm); no reason why she won't run well again off just 2lb higher.

stable_tour.quote: Coulsty has been doing well and has produced a couple of nice two-year-olds. She's got plenty of size and scope like most of mine. She's only a couple of weeks off a run. The jockeys who have ridden her absolutely love her but she'll be your seven-furlong type of horse. 04-07-24

runners.name: Havana Whisper
runners.comment: Modest 7f runs and he's not certain to improve for 1m on pedigree; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Hasn't offered a great deal in his qualifying runs at 7f and he's not certain to improve for 1m on pedigree; respected connections and with that in mind the market needs checking.

runners.name: Genbu
runners.comment: Ran no race on handicap debut in April but has been gelded since then
runners.spotlight: Ran no race on handicap debut in April but has been gelded since then and last year's initial efforts were encouraging (on soft); these conditions are a grey area but could be open to improvement.

runners.name: Mini Mac
runners.comment: Has a big pull in the weights with latest Yarmouth conqueror Triple Double A
runners.spotlight: Went 1-6 for George Boughey; 0-4 for current yard but not always had much luck and has a big pull in the weights with latest Yarmouth conqueror Triple Double A, who was 6l his superior; might not be far away.

quotes.race: Download The Raceday Ready App EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C & D, No More Than 3 Runs) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Mini Mac loves the soft ground but hated the track. Had it been a more conventional course he'd have won it more cosily - Billy Loughnane, jockey.

runners.name: Epicurian Lad
runners.comment: Maiden but has produced his best work late in both runs this season, over 7f and 1m
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden but has produced his best work late in both runs this season, over 7f and 1m; the likelihood of a good pace here should suit him.

runners.name: Bebside
runners.comment: Nine-race maiden who had no excuses from the front last time at Ripon
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden who had no excuses from the front last time at Ripon (1m, good; first-time cheekpieces); Epicurian Lad was ahead of him that day.

1:55.race_name: Dancing At The Pink Pony Club Handicap
1:55.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 7.0) (Watered) (Outer track)

runners.name: One For Harvey
runners.comment: Eight-race maiden but the return to 5f looks a good move; not discounted
runners.spotlight: 0-8 but she's finished in the first three in four of those starts; has the early speed to cope with this return to 5f; not discounted.

runners.name: Fallen Soldier
runners.comment: Exposed maiden; this winter's AW best gives him claims but quiet the last twice
runners.spotlight: 15-race maiden; solid chance on this winter's AW best but his form has dipped the last twice; down in grade but could prove vulnerable again.

runners.name: Fear And Fast
runners.comment: Inconsistent but a couple of runs bring him into it; now tried in a visor
runners.spotlight: Scores low marks for consistency but he has a couple of runs, including C&D, which bring him right into the reckoning; dropping in the weights and a new visor offers hope of an improved showing.

runners.name: Solar Biricz
runners.comment: Monday's Beverley third was encouraging; unexposed in headgear; could yet rate higher
runners.spotlight: 5f win at Musselburgh as a 2yo; stepped up on his Catterick reappearance when keeping on nicely for third at Beverley on Monday (5f, good to firm; cheekpieces first time); could yet rate higher.

runners.name: Monticristo Boy
runners.comment: Three solid runs in defeat since his AW win last November; each-way shout again
runners.spotlight: 5f win at Newcastle in November and he has finished third in his three starts since, the latest over 6f here 11 days ago; should give it another good go.

runners.name: Hidden Verse
runners.comment: Easy win at Bath on Monday; 6lb penalty against better opposition but unexposed at 5f
runners.spotlight: He has improved for a drop in trip the last twice, finishing a close fourth at Wolverhampton (5f) before an easy win at Bath (5.5f, firm) on Monday; 6lb penalty against stronger oppositon today but unexposed at 5f.

runners.name: Dreambird Dolly
runners.owner: T Beeches, C Stone, J Gallagher
runners.comment: Lightly raced filly who was a good and improved 2nd at Brighton last time; chance up 2lb
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced filly who ran her best race to date when a close second at Brighton ten days ago (5.5f, good to firm); up 2lb but she could have more to offer back at a bare 5f.

runners.name: Sunny Time
runners.comment: 5f AW winner in January; no progress since and returns to turf with new headgear added
runners.spotlight: Made most when winning a 5f AW handicap at Lingfield in January; unable to build on that since and returns to turf with new headgear added.

4:50.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 7.0) (Watered) (Outer track)

runners.name: Daytona Lady
runners.owner: Eric Broadwith And Mrs Ruth Carr
runners.comment: Not seen to best effect at Catterick so far this year; dangerous granted a pace to aim at
runners.spotlight: Hold-up mare who gained her first turf success at Wetherby (5.5f, good) last summer; not seen to best effect in either Catterick run this season and likely still in top form; down in grade today and dangerous granted a good pace to run at.

quotes.race: It's Time To Turn To talkSPORT Handicap
quotes.quote: I don't think Daytona Lady liked Kempton the last day. She's been working very well at home - Darragh Keenan, rider, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: She was busy last year, racing 18 times and winning four on the all-weather so she's had break since November. She's in good shape and goes to Catterick on Wednesday over 6f. A turning six furlongs is what suits her best. She'll need to improve some if she's to achieve what she achieved last year. 09-04-25

runners.name: Lord Abama
runners.owner: Mrs K S Pratt, P R Blackett, M Dods
runners.comment: AW win in March and ran well for 2nd off this mark at Thirsk latest; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 with a 6f win at Newcastle and kicked off this campaign with another; solid effort off this mark at Thirsk 18 days ago; no obvious reason why he wouldn't go well again.

runners.name: Emperor Caradoc
runners.breeder: Ecurie Des Monceaux & Skymarc Farm Inc

prev_owners.owner: Dan Maltby Bloodstock Ltd & B Smart

runners.comment: Promise on April's return (5f, good) and fully effective at this trip; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Last summer's win came over 5f at Pontefract but he is fully effective over today's extra furlong; solid return to action at Pontefract four weeks ago and he's one to consider; stable also run Yazaman.

runners.name: Yazaman

prev_owners.owner: A Rhodes, M Short & E Twibell
A Rhodes, M Short & R Swift
J C G Chua And Partner

runners.comment: Four wins last summer; failed to build on his promising reappearance latest; yard run two
runners.spotlight: Four wins last summer, including here (5f, good); promise on his return to action last month but failed to build on it at Wetherby a fortnight ago; visor replaces blinkers today; stable also run Emperor Caradoc.

quotes.race: Tattersalls July Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Yazaman ran differently to Ascot in that he jumped and travelled really well over the extra furlong, while he was a bit outpaced at Ascot. I think the winner is pretty good and we were beaten by a better horse. To give our horse some credit I don't think he saw the winner coming as he was a long way from him. He's grown up a lot since his debut and he's a grand horse, but he's an out and out two-year-old so we need to get on with him and make use of him. He didn't mind the ground today - Maureen Haggas, wife of William Haggas, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He'd be a lovely person, absolute class, but he's a character, shall we say. He was a really good two-year-old when he was runner-up in the Richmond Stakes for William Haggas, but maybe he overachieved at two as quite a few of them do. He was one of those where we probably bought him at the right time as his rating was down into the 60s. He was running well without doing an awful lot, but when he got down to a mark of 50 he started winning. We put a visor on and it helped a bit, but it wasn't until he got the blinkers on that things started to happen. Even the first day he won at Nottingham, I still maintain that if he hadn't got a bump near the finish, he'd have finished second; he got a bump and seemed to take off and won really well. He then went to Beverley and had a bit of a troubled passage but got to the front and was well on top at the finish. When he went to Wetherby for his third success, the ground was plenty quick enough for him and the race didn't go as smoothly as we'd have liked, but he still won, whiwas fair play to him. He's got his confidence back and remembered how to win. If he wants to win again, he's still a long way ahead of the handicapper. He's entered at Leicester on Thursday but I'd be amazed if he runs as it looks like it's going to be a dry week. 28-06-24

runners.name: Rock N Roll Rocket
runners.comment: 6f AW win off this mark in December; bolted to post latest; now tried in a hood
runners.spotlight: Back to the same mark as when winning a 6f handicap at Southwell in December; ran away with his jockey on the way to the post at Catterick last month and that run not the one to judge him on; hood now added.

runners.name: Kode Secret
runners.breeder: Ghs Bloodstock Ltd & Tally Ho Stud
runners.comment: Front-runner; two 7f wins last summer; drops in trip but others bring more pressing claims
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer who won twice over 7f last summer; forced a strong pace at Ayr on his reappearance and weakened late on; worth another crack at 6f but others make more appeal.

runners.name: Dutch Finale
runners.comment: Unexposed handicap debutant; gelded since latest start; the betting should guide
runners.spotlight: Didn't live up to market billing on his first two starts as a 2yo and then faced a stiff task against Shadow Of Light at Newmarket; gelded prior to this handicap debut and the betting should be revealing after 281 days off.

runners.name: Rokuni
runners.comment: Best run for this yard when 3rd at Leicester a fortnight ago (7f); other pace to deal with
runners.spotlight: Ran his best race for this yard when third of 12 at Leicester (7f, good) a fortnight ago; other pace to deal with today and others appeal more.

runners.name: Prince Imperial
runners.comment: Has won four of his five starts for Olly Murphy, the last three under Beau Morgan
runners.spotlight: Has won four of his five starts for Olly Murphy, the last three under Beau Morgan; he was nicely on top despite the narrow margin last time (2m3f handicap here; good) and a 5lb rise might not stop him.

quotes.race: Hazelton Mountford Insurance Brokers Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Prince Imperial won well and he's just improved and improved. He stays very well and he's got that bit of confidence back again. He'll improve again for a step up in trip and might win a nice staying race during the summer on a sound surface - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Bet At racingtv.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Prince Imperial has had a light campaign, he's tough and wins on the all-weather so we'll keep him going through the winter. There'll be six runners in those two-mile races after Christmas so it makes sense to target them - Richard Hughes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him out of Sir Michael Stoute's yard last summer and he has done great since, winning at Bath in October, and last month he bolted up by six lengths at Chelmsford. We have learned that he is more effective going left-handed and we will give him one or two more runs and then save him for an all-weather campaign in the winter. There is a decent programme for him in 0-100 handicaps on artificial surfaces, and for a bargain buy - he only cost 50,000gns - I think we are going to have a lot of fun with him. 14-07-21

runners.name: Deep Purple
runners.comment: Won his maiden comfortably in the end and might not be on a bad mark for first handicap
runners.spotlight: Point/bumper winner; showed a tendency to jump left at Chepstow (2m7f, good) but he won that maiden comfortably in the end and might not be on a bad mark for this switch to handicaps.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper in the autumn and ran well enough on his first hurdles start at Ludlow, softening himself up by chasing the odds-on winner. I think he wants slightly slower ground. 12-11-24

runners.name: Tarahumara
runners.comment: Won only narrowly over 2m3f here but there could be more to come over this far
runners.spotlight: His second run back from a lengthy break when emerging from off the pace to win narrowly over 2m3f here (good; 5lb lower) and there could be more to come over this far, as he's very lightly raced for a 9yo.

stable_tour.quote: He only had two runs last season and bled on his chase debut at Uttoxeter where he clearly wasn't right. I was delighted with his win at Warwick on his comeback and I liked the way he lengthened away in the straight. The handicapper didn't miss him and put him up 8lb but he's a big horse who could go back over fences at some stage. At the moment we'll stick to hurdles and two miles. We've always rated him highly and, now that he's healthy, it's time to see just how nice a horse he might be. 22-11-23

runners.name: Mammies Boy
runners.comment: Close up behind Tarahumara here last time and that was after quite a layoff
runners.spotlight: Won readily by 4l at Huntingdon (2m3f, good) last May and his first run since when close up behind Tarahumara here a month ago; could strip fitter this time and Benjamin Macey takes off 7lb.

runners.name: Calagogo
runners.comment: Not disgraced in Class 5 handicap chase here in April but needs Doyen Quest to disappoint
runners.spotlight: Useful hurdler for Gordon Elliott a few years ago but generally very disappointing since returning from long absence for new stable last spring; not disgraced in Class 5 handicap chase here (3m, good; first-time blinkers) last month but needs Doyen Quest to fluff his lines.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Calagogo loved the ground and the cheekpieces really helped him - Jordan Gainford, rider.

stable_tour.quote: A good servant. He's won three for us this year and was a good fourth at Cheltenham recently. We might try to qualify him for the Pertemps, he was pulled up in a qualifier at Punchestown on Sunday, but he'll be a lovely horse to go chasing with next year. 15-11-21

runners.name: Doyen Quest
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late N W Lake

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late N W Lake

runners.comment: Useful hurdler who is in good form and has been found a simple task on chasing debut
runners.spotlight: Useful hurdler who looked as good as ever when scoring by over 5l here (3m1f, good) last month; will be fine over today's shorter trip and appears to have been found a simple task on his chasing debut.

quotes.race: From The Horses Mouth Podcast Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was far enough back but we hadn't gone that quick and he jumped on the bridle straight away and put the race to bed quickly. You wouldn't know how good Doyen Quest is as he keeps a bit back for himself - Harry Skelton, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Kingston Stud Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was lovely. Doyen Quest was probably going to improve for a step up in trip and he likes a bit of better ground. A fast-ish run race round here suits him and he doesn't do a lot when he gets to the front so a lovely ride from Harry [Skelton] - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won decent handicaps at Newbury and Cheltenham in the spring and put up a very good performance when second in the Silver Trophy at Chepstow on his reappearance, beaten by a fitter horse on the day. I'd say he'll be progressive this year, especially over a little bit further - the step up to three miles should bring about improvement. I'd love to go to the November meeting at Cheltenham with him but the ground will dictate plans. 12-11-24

runners.name: Fromposttopillar
runners.comment: Lowly rated maiden who finished last of three in a minor point last month
runners.spotlight: Lowly rated maiden who was beaten about 25l in handicap chases (2m4f/2m5f) on his last two starts under rules and was safely held when last of three in a minor point last month.

runners.name: Serious Chat
runners.comment: Good winner at Bangor last month and now 2-5 over hurdles; good chance here
runners.spotlight: Seemed to have a bit left in the tank when winning Bangor handicap (2m7f, good) last month and is now 2-5 over hurdles; won't mind if he has to make the running here and has very good chance to add to his tally.

quotes.race: Scan Your tote Bet With Raceday-Ready Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Serious Chat still has a bit to learn about his jumping but he's a nice horse with a nice pedigree. He's going to get three miles and this was a good opportunity - Donald McCain, trainer.

runners.name: Striking A Pose
runners.owner: S Clare G Kennington C Knowles & J Reed

prev_owners.owner: I & C Gosden, M Sharp & G Kennington

runners.comment: Ran well when fourth at Newton Abbot last month but is nothing like the force of old
runners.spotlight: Ran well for a long way when fourth at Newton Abbot (3m2f, heavy) three weeks ago and ought to handle today's much faster ground fairly well but he's nothing like the force of old.

quotes.race: Kenn Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Striking A Pose is rated 130 so he was supposed to win like that. He's a nice chap and a gorgeous-looking horse and it was nice to watch all the way round - his ears were pricked and he didn't put a foot wrong. I think 2m4f is perfect, he's got a bit of class about him so he's not short of speed. I'm sure he'll end up over 3m but this trip is fine on genuine soft ground. I don't think we'll step him up to three this season. We've got some options now, he's qualified for the EBF Final at Sandown in a couple of weeks. He's probably not an Albert Bartlett horse but he might be competitive at Sandown, or he could go to Aintree. I expect we'll lean to Sandown. He'll be a lovely chaser for next season - Joe Tizzard, assistant to trainer Colin Tizzard.

quotes.race: Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing "National Hunt" Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Striking A Pose has learnt his job over two miles and the form from Ascot looked quite nice. He's a point-to-point winner so stepping him up in trip worked a treat. He's a gorgeous-looking four-year-old and is a nice horse who's at the right end of the handicap who we hope will continue progressing through the ranks. He'll go over fences next season and he won't run again until the new year. - Joe Tizzard, assistant trainer

stable_tour.quote: He just seems to love it at Exeter. We could back over fences soon but he was third the other day and that was a good run, so we'll probably pick and choose with him. The handicapper has had his say with him though. 07-11-24

runners.name: Royal Rhythm
runners.comment: Runner-up in February but ended last season with two lesser efforts
runners.spotlight: Seemingly perked up by change of headgear when second at Wetherby (2m3f, soft) in February but ended last season with two lesser efforts, latterly when about 26l behind Serious Chat at Bangor (2m7f, good); needs to bounce back again and proved he's effective on good ground.

quotes.race: COLM QUINN BMW Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Royal Rhythm got a fantastic ride from James because in my mind the others went way too quick and they were racing too early. He kept taking him back and he probably won too well, he was the only one that finished - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

6:40.race_name: The Valley Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Chase

runners.name: Anytrixwilldo
runners.comment: Won at Taunton in April; Benjamin Macey claims very useful 8lb against other conditionals
runners.spotlight: Pulled up twice on soft ground last season but came good over fences when back on a sound surface and fitted with first-time cheekpieces at Taunton (3m4f, good to firm) last month; only 3lb higher here and Benjamin Macey looks excellent value for his 8lb claim against other conditional jockeys.

runners.name: Grillon De Monty
runners.comment: Proved some ability remains when fourth over 2m4f here last month; a possible
runners.spotlight: 3m1f hurdle winner for Dan Skelton in 2023; generally disappointing for Stephen Allen since returning from long absence in December but last month's fourth here (2m4f, good) proved some ability remains; drops in grade today and the move back up in trip ought to suit; could have a say.

runners.name: Cave Article
runners.comment: Pounced from off the pace at Hereford last month and is now 2-5 over fences; respected
runners.spotlight: Pounced from off the pace to win in first-time cheekpieces at Hereford (3m1f, good) last month and is now 2-5 over fences; should be fine on this left-handed track and could still have more to offer; respected.

quotes.race: Cleveland Systems Engineering Christmas Jumpers Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Cave Article is raw and found the ground a bit tiring, a bit sticky - Brian Hughes, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Moonlight Artist
runners.owner: The Cheltenham & South West Racing Club
runners.comment: Battled on gamely for narrow C&D win last month; still well treated on older form
runners.spotlight: Back in good nick when fitted with a tongue-tie for his two outings last month, more recently when battling on gamely for narrow C&D (good) win; recent 5lb rise demands more from him today but he's still well handicapped on older form.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Moonlight Artist has gone off favourite or a short price a few times and I've always wondered why but he got it together today. This should do his confidence the world of good and hopefully there should be another race in him. Brendan Powell, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He was in training all of last season and ready to run but we didn't want to risk him on the ground. He'll go novice hurdling in the middle of November but works nicely. He seems like a nice horse. 31-10-22

runners.name: Grand Sabre
runners.comment: Pulled up on final two hurdling starts and also struggled on recent chasing debut
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden who was pulled up on final two hurdling starts (maiden/handicap) and also struggled when switched to fences last month; can't be recommended.

runners.name: Chateau Du Lys
runners.comment: Safely held in first two handicap chases (2m1f/3m); significant improvement needed
runners.spotlight: Still unexposed after only five rules starts but was safely held in two good-ground chases (2m1f/3m) towards end of last season and needs significant improvement here.

7:15.race_name: The Valley 'National Hunt' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Ballymena Boy
runners.comment: Beaten when falling on his hurdling debut and tailed off in his second attempt
runners.spotlight: Some promise in a point and then a bumper but was beaten when falling on his hurdling debut and tailed off in his second attempt.

runners.name: Big Boy Barney
runners.comment: Second in an Irish point and ran well to be fourth in two good-ground bumpers
runners.spotlight: Second to the smart Ballybow in an Irish point and has run well to be fourth in two good-ground bumpers, the first won by Destination Dubai who went on to be placed at Aintree; hurdling debutant and bred to improve with his racing.

runners.name: Cobblers Boy
runners.comment: Second to a good horse at Southwell and easily sets the standard on that form
runners.spotlight: From the front, he had the long odds-on favourite in some bother at Southwell (2m, good to soft) only to ultimately go down by 3l (distance clear of the remainder); had wind surgery and now tongue tied; sets the standard by some way.

runners.name: New Man
runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Des Jap & Oliver Triboir
runners.comment: Tailed off in good-ground novice hurdles at Hereford and Ludlow; now tongue tied
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in good-ground novice hurdles at Hereford and Ludlow; the new tongue-tie will need to make a huge difference.

runners.name: Foxys Friend
runners.breeder: D McCain Racing & Mrs Sarah Leslie
runners.comment: Showed some ability when fourth of 11 runners in a 2m4f British point two months ago
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability when fourth of 11 runners in a 2m4f British point two months ago; joined a good yard for rules action.

8:15.race_name: Kigass Centenary Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Diamond Ambition
runners.comment: Point third reads well; new trainer isn't holding back on the headgear
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 3l in an Irish point 13 months ago and the winner is now a stablemate who has performed to a useful level in bumpers; makes rules debut after a wind operation and Dan Skelton isn't holding back on the headgear; with that in mind the market could be instructive.

runners.name: Emerald Time
runners.comment: Beaten just under 8l on good to soft at Catterick in January after racing freely
runners.spotlight: Beaten just under 8l on good to soft at Catterick in January, not quite getting home after racing freely; entitled to build on that initial effort.

runners.name: Whatyouwaitingfor
runners.comment: weakened into sixth at Huntingdon, trailing the winner by about 14l; more needed.
runners.spotlight: 3,000euros yearling and the first foal from an unraced sister to a low-grade chaser; weakened into sixth at Huntingdon, trailing the winner by about 14l (good to soft; 6-1); more needed.

runners.name: Caterpillar Girl
runners.comment: First foal out of a useful 2m1f-2m6f hurdle/chase winner and stable gets bumper winners
runners.spotlight: First foal out of a useful 2m1f-2m6f hurdle/chase winner and half-sister to winners Sestilio Jet (French 5f Group 3) and Got Glory (1m4f Flat/2m hurdle); stable gets bumper winners.

runners.name: Ladies Day
runners.comment: Impressed in a point bumper and withdrawn from a Class 2 at Cheltenham last month
runners.spotlight: Smooth winner of a point bumper on good ground at Maisemore Park in March; clearly has ability and was a late withdrawal from a Class 2 bumper at Cheltenham last month.

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Magalen O Bryant

quotes.race: Naas Racecourse Business Club Limestone Lad Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Zarak The Brave had been doing things nicely at home. He is getting much more settled so I think a longer trip might suit him now. He's in the Champion Hurdle, I don't know if we will go there - Willie Muillins, trainer.

quotes.race: Guinness Galway Hurdle (Grade 3 Handicap)
quotes.quote: That's a class performance. You've got to look at Zarak The Brave now as a Champion Hurdle contender. It's something for a four-year-old to win the race, that says something of how tough the horse is. I thought he was beaten, and it's tough on Noel. I thought Jesse Evans had come to beat him and Paul said to me that he thought he was beaten, too, but when he gave him a smack and changed his whip, the horse got down and galloped again, so that shows how brave he is. Would you look at the Morgiana straight away or maybe a Fishery Lane at Naas first? He's a lightly raced four-year-old so maybe something like that - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Prix Alain du Breil - Course de Haies de Printemps (Hurdle) (Grade 1) (4yo) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Zarak The Brave didn't jump well enough in the first mile. He doesn't have the experience and I would imagine the next time Paul [Townend] will try to stay a bit closer. When he settled him he didn't jump as well - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Starting Point 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Zarak The Brave did things right. I was surprised with the turn of foot he showed. He is going to come on for that and he is a nice prospect - Paul Townend, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He was very disappointing at Tipperary, so we decided to give him a bit of a break. He seems fine now and we'll look towards Christmas or the spring for him. 13-11-23

runners.name: Jimmy P
runners.breeder: Head Of Plains Partners & Madaket Stables
runners.owner: Madaket Stables Llc, Molly Willis & Paul Willis

prev_owners.owner: Madaket Stables LLC & Head Of Plains Partners LLC

quotes.race: Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Final Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Zabeel Champion is tough and he keeps galloping. He battled away well and we're very happy with him. He missed one but he's getting the hang of his jumping. Hopefully, he's going the right way - Jonjo O'Neill, trainer.

quotes.race: Back And Lay On Betfair Exchange Handicap
quotes.quote: We keep thinking about giving Zabeel Champion a break but if they keep putting these small field races we'll be turning up. He was only entered in the race one minute before 12 on Monday and he's an absolute legend. Hopefully he could be an ideal type for the Duke Of Edinburgh Handicap or the Hardwicke Stakes -  Charlie Johnston, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: M.C.H. Hutchinson Memorial Trophy Handicap
quotes.quote: Zabeel Champion has always been a horse we've thought a lot of. We still haven't got any explanation for the flop at York but that's one blemish on his career and there haven't been many. The Duke of Edinburgh is a race that springs to mind as a good early-summer target - assistant trainer Charlie Johnston.  I got it easy in front and I was able to dictate. I knew after winning here last time that he had plenty of speed to get me out of trouble so I wasn't worried about it turning into a bit of a sprint - Ben Curtis, jockey.

quotes.race: Betway Heed Your Hunch Handicap
quotes.quote: I spoke with Charlie Johnston this morning and he said Zabeel Champion had a chance and that was a really battling performance. That was only my second ride for the stable and I rode out there during lockdown. - Dougie Costello, rider

stable_tour.quote: He won a decent 1m2f handicap at Ripon on Thursday on an undulating track that doesn't always suit such a big horse as him. He's still lightly raced, has a lot of potential, and he could go up to 1m4f in time. 18-04-21

The plan last season was the Challenger Series Final at Haydock and it worked out nicely. I thought he was a little bit disappointing on his comeback run over hurdles at Chepstow, but hopefully he can improve this season and he might step up in trip. 25-10-22

runners.name: Abaan
runners.owner: Eclipse Thoroughbred Partners & Daigneault Thoroughbreds Llc

prev_owners.owner: Philippe Ponsot, Ecurie Michael Riziere Et Al

quotes.race: Savills Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Howyabud had good bumper form coming here and ran well in a very good point-to-point in Monksgrange. We think a lot of him - Mary Ellen Doyle, trainer.

runners.name: Accolade Start
runners.comment: Disappointing for new stable this year; eased in grade but needs to raise game
runners.spotlight: Regressive 5yo who has been disappointing for his new stable this year and is now 0-17 in Hong Kong; will appreciate today's ease in grade but still needs to up his game.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C/D) (EBF Restricted Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: Wahaaj has always shown us that ability and the thing about him is that he is a well-built horse and he is athletic. He does things nicely and he does things very well at home. He has really stepped up mentally and as a two-year-old you don't know how they're going to take to their second run. If he had run today and was getting stressed, then it would be a concern. However, he coped really well and it makes our planning for the future a lot easier - Patrick Owens, trainer.

runners.name: Beautiful Win
runners.owner: Sandia Yit Lau Ying Lam & Yit Kwok Leung
runners.comment: Made the frame in 7f Class 4 races on two of last three starts; major player
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden after nine starts but has made the frame in two 7f Class 4 races this year and looks well worth another crack at 1m; major player on this first Class 5 start.

runners.name: Jolly Jumper
runners.owner: 23/24 Benno Yung Tin Pang Trainer Syndicate (2)

prev_owners.owner: 23/24 Benno Yung Tin Pang Trainer Syndicate

runners.comment: Competitive in Class 4 this season; upped in trip for first Class 5 run
runners.spotlight: Competitive in Class 4 races this season (albeit without winning) and seemed to respond pretty well to first-time visor when keeping-on fifth over 7f here last month; upped in trip for first run in this lower grade; one to consider.

runners.name: Smashing Express
runners.comment: Didn't fire last time but has been placed three times this season; a possible
runners.spotlight: Placed three times this season, most recently over C&D two starts ago; below that form at Happy Valley last month and now 0-13 but still makes more appeal than most of these.

runners.name: Supreme Winner
runners.comment: Well beaten when upped to 7f in December; now 0-9; up in trip again today
runners.spotlight: Well beaten when upped to 7f for latest run in December and has now been unplaced all nine starts; tries another new trip on this reappearance outing.

runners.name: Smart Beauty
runners.comment: Out of form this season and needs to turn a corner
runners.spotlight: Won four times here (1m-1m1f) last season but has been out of form this term and needs to turn a corner.

runners.name: Family Fortune
runners.owner: Tony Stradmoor, Billy Li Sze Kuen Et Al
runners.comment: Improved form when placed twice last month (turf/dirt); commands respect
runners.spotlight: Placed for first time in career when 60-1 third here (7f) last month, his tenth start, and was denied a clear run before keeping on well to go close on dirt here (1m) a fortnight later; back on turf today and commands respect in current form.

runners.name: Strongest Boy
runners.owner: Ricky Wong Kin Chat & Helen Leung Yee Wan
runners.comment: Made the frame two starts ago but this regressive 5yo is not one to rely upon
runners.spotlight: Kept on for fourth at Happy Valley (1m) two starts ago and remains very well handicapped on older form but his latest run was disappointing and he's not one to rely upon.

runners.name: Chateau Le Peche
runners.breeder: B J Lindsay Mnzm & Mrs J E A Lindsay
runners.comment: Led close home for 1m2f win last month; today's drop back in trip is not ideal
runners.spotlight: Led close home to open account over 1m2f here last month, his 17th start; can probably cope with today's 5lb higher mark but the drop back to 1m is not ideal.

runners.name: Casa Legend
runners.breeder: B J Lindsay Mnzm & Mrs J E A Lindsay
runners.comment: Below form last time but made the frame over C&D twice beforehand
runners.spotlight: Disappointed at Happy Valley last month but made the frame over C&D on consecutive outings beforehand and is now 1lb lower than when winning over C&D in September; contender if back on song.

runners.name: Gangnam Star
runners.owner: Francis Chan, Louise Chan & Aaron Chan
runners.comment: Largely disappointing over 6f/7f this term; tries a new trip today
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with a 7f course win but has largely been disappointing this term and has quite a bit to prove on first attempt at 1m.

runners.name: Lapras
runners.comment: Fourth over C&D in December but both runs this year were underwhelming
runners.spotlight: Outran 64-1 odds when keeping-on fourth over C&D in December but both 7f runs this year have been underwhelming; others have more pressing claims.

runners.name: Winning Turn
runners.owner: Wong Che Kin, Johnny Wong Ka Keung & Andrew Lee Ying Biu
runners.comment: 12-race maiden who finished well down the field on his last three outings
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden who finished well down the field on his last three outings (6f-7f); tries a new trip today.

runners.name: Winning Seven
runners.comment: Placed off lowly mark last month (1m1f) but overall profile not compelling
runners.spotlight: 18-race maiden; stayed on to be placed off his lowly mark at Happy Valley (1m1f) last month but his overall profile is not appealing.

runners.name: Windicator Family
runners.owner: Thomas Poon Ho Wing & Poon Chi Keung
runners.comment: Placed off this mark since Happy Valley win in March; player if he gets a run
runners.spotlight: Came good with narrow win in first-time visor at Happy Valley (1m) in March, his 19th start, and was placed off today's mark there last month; will warrant consideration if he gets the chance to run today.

runners.name: Double Bingo
runners.owner: Charmaine Wong Kam Mei & Chan Fu Ho
runners.comment: Well beaten three times on turf since making the frame on dirt in February
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in a dirt sprint in February but well beaten three times on turf since (6f-7f) and makes very limited appeal over this new trip.

10:45.race_name: Pok Fu Lam Reservoir Road Handicap (Class 2) (3yo+) (Course C) (Turf)

runners.name: Fast Network
runners.comment: Very impressive C&D winner in March; will soon be contesting Group races
runners.spotlight: Won twice over C&D when dropped back in trip from 1m in March and was particulaly impressive on the second occasion; latest 11lb hike up the weights asks a question of him but he's drawn on the inside today and will probably be contesting Group races soon.

runners.name: Bottomuptogether
runners.comment: Progressive 4yo; back on turf after very comfortable win on recent dirt debut
runners.spotlight: Progressive 4yo who switches back to turf after making all to win very comfortably on dirt debut three weeks ago; must be considered.

runners.name: Wunderbar
runners.owner: The Hon & Mrs Andrew Li Kwok Nang
runners.comment: Four C&D wins in 2024; only fifth on last two outings; back from four-month break today
runners.spotlight: Four-time C&D winner in 2024; not yet fully exposed but had to settle for fifth on his last two appearances and has been absent for four months.

runners.name: Gorgeous Win
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner this season; needs to kick on again to win this competitive race
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner this season; very respectable sixth from stall 10 here four weeks ago and has much better draw today, but needs to kick on again to win this competitive race.

runners.name: Invincible Shield

prev_owners.owner: Ultra Horse Syndicate & Ms S J Leury

runners.comment: Useful sprinter in Australia and has won three in a row in Hong Kong this year
runners.spotlight: Useful sprinter in Australia and, following one sighter, has won three in a row in Hong Kong this year (6f-7f); raised another 7lb for last month's short-head success but may still have more to offer.

runners.name: Chiu Chow Spirit
runners.owner: Charlie Lam Leung Seng & Michael Lam Yau Keng

prev_owners.owner: Pipeliner Bloodstock Pty Ltd, Sands Racing Et Al

runners.comment: Consistent over 7f in recent months but takes on some progressive rivals
runners.spotlight: Consistent over 7f in recent months and continues to slip down the weights but takes on some in-form/progressive rivals today and has never run in a sprint before.

runners.name: Gustosisimo
runners.comment: Career-best form when winning over C&D last month; may be vulnerable from stall 10
runners.spotlight: Career-best form form when driven-out winner over C&D four weeks ago; combination of 7lb rise and double-digit draw might be enough to leave him vulnerable today, though.

runners.name: Tomodachi Kokoroe
runners.comment: On good mark but hs not been firing on all cylinders this year; others preferred
runners.spotlight: On good mark now but has not been firing on all cylinders this year and was particularly disappointing on his latest outing; others preferred.

runners.name: Ladys Choice
runners.owner: Hk Association Of Lady Horse Lovers Syndicate
runners.comment: In very good form but will probably find younger rivals better handicapped
runners.spotlight: Made all over C&D in March and lost out only narrowly to Gustosisimo here last month; ought to give another good account but will probably find younger rivals better handicapped.

runners.name: Dancing Code

prev_owners.owner: L A Miller, Mrs M L Morrison Et Al

runners.comment: Has remained in good form since C&D win on New Year's Day but has an awkward draw
runners.spotlight: Began this year with a clearcut C&D win and is still in good form, but holds no secrets from the handicapper and has a tough draw.

runners.name: Atullibigeal
runners.comment: Regressive 6yo who has been unplaced in all six starts this season
runners.spotlight: Regressive 6yo who has been unplaced all six starts this season; very difficult to enthuse over.

runners.name: Whizz Kid
runners.comment: Placed twice last month (6f/5f) but faces tough task from stall 12
runners.spotlight: Smart in his prime and has arrested his decline in recent weeks, finishing third over C&D and at Happy Valley (5f); faces tough assignment from stall 12, though.

runners.name: Self Improvement
runners.owner: Wong Chung Yin & Wong Lai Ngor
runners.comment: Dual dirt winner this season; not at best lately; on tough mark for rare turf run
runners.spotlight: Dual dirt winner this season but seems to have gone off the boil lately and is still on a tough mark for this rare turf run.

runners.name: Copartner Prance
runners.comment: Good second in C&D Class 1 in March and has excuses for recent defeats
runners.spotlight: Didn't take to dirt two starts ago and can also be excused his subsequent Group 1 defeat; now 1lb lower than when creditable second in Class 1 C&D handicap in March; could have a say if he gets a run today.

runners.name: Alsonso

prev_owners.owner: Flemington Bloodstock, Yu Long Investments Et Al

runners.comment: Went close over C&D when dropped to this grade last month; major player
runners.spotlight: 0-7 in Hong Kong but lost out only by a short head over C&D when dropped to this grade last month; well drawn again today and Zac Purton takes the ride; leading contender.

runners.name: Call To Command
runners.comment: A well-beaten outsider on all three Hong Kong starts; drops in grade today
runners.spotlight: A well-beaten outsider on all three Hong Kong starts (5f-6f); drops in grade today but remains difficult to enthuse over.

runners.name: Alluring Laos
runners.comment: C&D winner on debut but has not kicked on; has a point to prove
runners.spotlight: Began career with C&D win in November but has not kicked on since, and his last two runs were disappointing; goes without cheekpieces today; has a point to prove.

runners.name: Cheval Valiant
runners.comment: Three-time C&D winner; ran okay here in March; considered each-way
runners.spotlight: Three-time C&D winner, most recently off 1lb lower in September; gave it a pretty good shot from the front when fifth here in March; considered each-way.

runners.name: Turf Phoenix
runners.owner: Dr John Shum Ding Ping & Dr Lawrence Chan Pui Wing
runners.comment: Useful in Britain but has dismal record in Hong Kong this season
runners.spotlight: Useful when trained in Britain but has pretty dismal record in Hong Kong this season.

runners.name: Lahore
runners.comment: Kept on well for very close fifth over C&D on last month's debut; must be considered
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 3yo who belied 46-1 odds when keeping on well for very close fifth over C&D on last month's debut; needs to be taken very seriously.

runners.name: Moon Rocket
runners.owner: Victor Fong Yuen Tak & Leonard Fong Lik Man
runners.comment: Made very promising debut when close fourth over C&D last month; high on list
runners.spotlight: Made very promising debut over C&D last month, keeping on well for a very close fourth; high on the list.

runners.name: Smart Engineer
runners.comment: Well down the field when 46-1 for last month's debut here (6f)
runners.spotlight: Well down the field when 46-1 for last month's debut here (6f); drops in trip today.

runners.name: Straight To Glory
runners.owner: Chan Tim Shing & Pang Wai Hak
runners.comment: Won 5f dirt trial in good style last month; makes official debut today
runners.spotlight: Out of a dual sprint winner; won 5f dirt trial in pretty good style here last month and it will be very interesting to see how he fares on this official debut.

runners.name: Summit Cheers
runners.owner: Herman Woo Hon Man & Woo Shuet Ming
runners.comment: Suited by this C&D but has regressed and become very inconsistent
runners.spotlight: Suited by this C&D but has regressed and become very inconsistent this season; last of 14 here on latest outing in March; chance depends on him being in a much better mood today.

runners.name: Winning Diamond
runners.comment: Makes official debut after winning a recent 5f trial; could have a say
runners.spotlight: Out of a mare who won over 1m and 1m2f but makes his official debut after winning a recent 5f trial and evidently has some speed.

runners.name: Island Breezes
runners.comment: Finished well for very close third over C&D when dropped in trip last month
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden after seven runs but finished well for a very close third over C&D when dropped to 5f last month and was nudged up only 1lb for that.

runners.name: Riding High

prev_owners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.comment: 0-9 in HK; placed over 6f in January but some lesser efforts have followed
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo with 0-9 strike-rate in Hong Kong; ran well from the front when placed over 6f here in January but some lesser efforts have followed; others preferred.

runners.name: Precious Hill
runners.comment: Soundly beaten on his first three outings (5f-6f)
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten on his first three outings (5f-6f) and seemingly in need of a drop in grade.

runners.name: Bingo Babe
runners.owner: Charmaine Wong Kam Mei & Chan Fu Ho
runners.comment: Second at big odds over C&D in March but safely held here last month
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden; belied triple-digit odds when second over C&D in March but was safely held here last month; others have much more convincing profiles.

runners.name: Dancing Classics
runners.comment: Showed some promise in trials but best watched on official debut
runners.spotlight: Out of a once-raced (unplaced) mare; showed some promise in recent trials but is probably best watched on this official debut.

7:00.race_name: Tuen Mun Public Riding School Handicap (Class 4) (3yo+) (Course C) (Turf)

runners.name: Flash Current
runners.comment: Low-mileage 4yo; 6f course winner; open to improvement over 7f
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who has been placed off today's mark since his 6f course win in February; below form when last in action but still looks very interesting on this first attempt at 7f.

runners.name: Riding Together
runners.comment: Sound effort when fourth over C&D last month; another 2lb lower today
runners.spotlight: Yet to be placed after six Hong Kong starts but posted a sound effort when fourth over C&D last month and is another 2lb lower today; could have a say.

stable_tour.quote: He is another by Profitable who was a nice purchase from the breeze-ups and looks a horse with a future. He made his debut at Salisbury last month when second to a warm favourite of Tom Dascombe's who finished fifth in the Chesham at Royal Ascot. Cool Dividend is a horse I like and I'm sure he can progress from that run. He seems to have come out of his first run very well. 02-08-23

runners.name: Excel Wongchoy
runners.comment: Placed over C&D in February but quickly back in the doldrums on next outing
runners.spotlight: Seemingly back in good form when third over C&D in February but his run here in March was disappointing and he now has it all to prove again.

runners.name: I P O Bros
runners.comment: Unplaced all six Hong Kong starts; can't be recommended
runners.spotlight: Always towards rear when a 59-1 outsider over C&D last month and has now been unplaced all six Hong Kong starts.

runners.name: Yiu Cheung Victory
runners.comment: Six-time winner in Macau but struggling to make an impact in Hong Kong
runners.spotlight: Six-time winner when based in Macau but has struggled to make a significant impact in Hong Kong this year (six runs).

runners.name: Ace
runners.breeder: T E Luke & Waikato Stud Ltd
runners.comment: Unable to land any sort of blow when 11th of 14 over C&D on debut
runners.spotlight: Unable to land any sort of blow when 11th of 14 over C&D on last month's debut.

runners.name: Legend Star
runners.comment: Always towards rear when a big-priced outsider for recent debut (6f)
runners.spotlight: Always towards rear when a big-priced outsider for recent debut (6f).

runners.name: Lucky Statement
runners.owner: Cheng Yu Wai, Cheng Mei Mei Et Al
runners.comment: Well down the field over C&D on his first two appearances
runners.spotlight: Well down the field over C&D on his first two appearances.

runners.name: Sugar Queen Prawn
runners.comment: Made just a mildly encouraging debut on dirt here (6f) last month
runners.spotlight: Made just a mildly encouraging debut when eight of 12 over 6f on dirt here last month; needs this different trip-and-surface combination to enable significant improvement.

runners.name: Time To Fire
runners.owner: Thomas Poon Ho Wing, Li Kui Ching & Poon Chi Keung
runners.comment: Second run was much better than his debut; needs to kick on again today
runners.spotlight: Bettered inauspicious debut when respectable sixth here (6f) last month but needs to kick on again over today's longer trip.

runners.name: The Auspicious
runners.comment: Shock C&D winner in March but safely held twice since
runners.spotlight: Stayed on strongly for shock C&D win in March but was safely held on his next two outings and has the outside draw to contend with today.

runners.name: Zetta Force
runners.comment: 0-5 but has good claims if judged on C&D second two starts ago
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden; slightly disappointing when only sixth here last month but was creditable second over C&D two starts ago and has good claims if judged on that performance.

runners.name: Everyones Classic
runners.owner: Yeung Chi Ming & Yeung Ching Ching
runners.comment: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after three runs (6f-7f)
runners.spotlight: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after three runs (6f-7f) and probably needs to drop further down the weights.

runners.name: Magic Beans
runners.breeder: K J, M J & Mrs N L Honiss
runners.comment: Struggled to get competitive on first four starts (all 6f)
runners.spotlight: Struggled to get competitive on first four starts (all 6f); moves up in trip today.

runners.name: Sugar Ball
runners.owner: Lau Po Keung, Yee Shun Hung Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Carringbush Park, Miss K A Brideoake & Ms L S Dillon

runners.comment: Has held his own in higher-grade company this season and enters calculations
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f course winner in early part of season and has held his own in higher-grade company since (including over 7f); not quite at best lately but still considered.

runners.name: Big Stride
runners.comment: Unable to land a significant blow when 60-1 for recent debut (6f)
runners.spotlight: Unable to land a significant blow when 60-1 for recent debut (6f).

7:30.race_name: Pok Fu Lam Public Riding School Handicap (Class 4) (3yo+) (Dirt)

runners.name: G Liner
runners.comment: Twice a C&D hero; has twice run modestly over 6f since coming back from a long absence.
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner but still 7lb above highest winning mark and has run moderately in two 6f since returning from an eight-month absence; this trip more suitable.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice maiden and I think he can get off the mark sooner rather than later. 19-04-21

runners.name: Conspirator
runners.owner: Ng Sun Wah, Au Yau Lin & Alan Leung Wai Zen
runners.comment: Showed talent in Australia but three poor local outings thus far; up from 6f; trying dirt.
runners.spotlight: Twice first past the post at up to 6.5f in Australia; has only beaten a total of one rival in three local 6f starts; needs to show much more and is an uncertain stayer at this trip.

runners.name: Wonderstar
runners.comment: Five-time Macau scorer; needs this jump from 7f to transform him after 12 unplaced runs.
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who won five times prior to export from Macau; has failed to make the top four (and tumbled 25lb in the ratings) in 12 local 6f/7f tries; up in trip.

runners.name: Floof
runners.comment: Just 1lb above the mark of his C&D September triumph; has done little in five runs since.
runners.spotlight: Only Hong Kong win was a 18-1 C&D surprise on his seasonal bow in September; unplaced in all five runs since, though is now down to within 1lb of his winning mark.

runners.name: Charming Steed
runners.comment: Goes particularly well over C&D; just 1lb higher than when second on last try over it.
runners.spotlight: Two wins and three places from his last five C&D attempts and goes well for this rider; only 1lb higher than when 1.5l second to Fashin Legend in March and is 8lb better off with that rival.

runners.name: Matters Most
runners.comment: Disappointing since arriving from Britain; up from 6f; headgear removed; first dirt run.
runners.spotlight: Useful 6f performer in Britain; his form has regressed during nine-race local career; going beyond 6f and trying dirt for the first time with cheekpieces removed.

quotes.race: Byerley Stud British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We hadn't got Matters Most on the grass before his first run and he was green and got squeezed, but today he was very professional. He wants a sixth furlong and I don't know where we'll go, but there might be a race at Pontefract coming up, which could suit him. He's very straightforward and we like him. He's out of a Pastoral Pursuits mare so he's bred to handle this ground, but he moves like he'd handle quicker ground and I've have no qualms about trying him on a faster surface - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

runners.name: Precision Goal
runners.comment: Fine run of form was broken when behind five of these last time; wide draw is a worry.
runners.spotlight: Was in superb form from November onwards (three C&D wins and three places) until weakening late in first-time blinkers behind five of these last time; poor draw here.

runners.name: Fashion Legend
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Boniface Ho Ka Kui
runners.comment: Just behind three of these over C&D last time; has poor 1-19 Hong Kong win strike rate.
runners.spotlight: Scored over C&D in late March before running perfectly well when fifth (behind three of today's opponents) off this revised mark three weeks ago.

runners.name: Forever Folks
runners.comment: Come-from-behind performer who needs the gaps to come but was a good C&D third last time.
runners.spotlight: Dual winner over this C&D who stayed on well after a slow start to finish a neck behind Spangle Fortune when third three weeks ago; should again be doing his best work late.

runners.name: Spangle Fortune
runners.comment: In front of six of these when 0.5l 2nd over C&D last time; chance again off 1lb higher.
runners.spotlight: Successful over C&D in November; back to form with a 38-1 bang when in front of six of these rivals over C&D three weeks ago; should go well again off a 1lb higher mark.

runners.name: Meepmeep
runners.comment: Has improved for upping to 1m and switch to dirt; neck C&D winner last time; raised 5lb.
runners.spotlight: Has progressed well since upped in trip and switched to dirt three starts ago, breaking his duck at the 13th attempt over C&D last time; upped 5lb for that neck success.

runners.name: Viva Chaleur

prev_owners.owner: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & Westerberg

runners.comment: Still searching for first local win after 27 attempts; behind four of these last time out.
runners.spotlight: Just four places and no wins from 27 Hong Kong outings; only around 2l behind Spangle Fortune and Forevere Folks over C&D last time so could sneak a place of 2lb lower mark.

runners.name: Lucky Impact
runners.comment: Improved efffort when 1l fourth at odds of 33-1 over C&D last time; needs to back that up.
runners.spotlight: Had struggled in all six starts this term before much-improved 1l fourth (just behind two of today's rivals) as a 33-1 chance over this C&D three weeks ago; needs to prove that was not a fluke.

runners.name: Phantom Cyclone
runners.breeder: Mrs J M & T M Henderson

prev_owners.owner: A Best, K Best Et Al

runners.comment: Only one good effort (4.5l C&D third in March) in 12 Hong Kong attempts to date.
runners.spotlight: Has failed to sparkle in 11 of his 12 starts since arriving from New Zealand but did manage a fair third (albeit beaten by 4.5l) over this C&D in late March.

runners.name: Leslie
runners.comment: Best form is over 7f on turf (two wins); unplaced in two dirt outings; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Not out of it if reproducing the level of two recent fourth places but they were both over 7f on turf and has not set the world on fire in two dirt runs; reserve.

runners.name: Yodas Choice
runners.owner: Alan Lee Yu Sing & Estate Of The Late Lee Kwok Kay
runners.comment: Only win from 21 runs came over 1m1f on this surface in March; 5lb higher here; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Finally off the mark at the 19th attempt over 1m1f (dirt) here in March; raised 5lb and has posted two modest turf efforts since then; reserve.

8:00.race_name: Lei Yue Mun Public Riding School Handicap (Class 4) (3yo+) (Course C) (Turf)

runners.name: Patch Of Stars
runners.comment: Needs to overcome 7lb rise for recent C&D win; big positive that Purton keeps the ride.
runners.spotlight: Hooked up with Zac Purton for the first time when getting up on the line to break his duck at the sixth time of asking over C&D a fortnight ago; now 7lb higher.

runners.name: Never Too Soon
runners.comment: First placing in 11 months when second ten days ago (6f); stays; has won of higher marks.
runners.spotlight: Not the force of old but has won off a 12lb higher mark and responded to tumbling rating when 0.5l second last time (6f, Happy Valley); stays this far; one for the short list.

runners.name: Lucky Fionn
runners.breeder: B J Lindsay Mnzm & Mrs J E A Lindsay
runners.comment: Probably found 1m too far last time; in fine form previously (won over C&D off 6lb lower).
runners.spotlight: Had fine record (a won, three seconds and a fourth) since joining this trainer before 4.5l seventh last time (1m); this trip more suitable but is 6lb higher than for March C&D victory.

runners.name: Second To None
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Raymund Chao Pak Ki
runners.comment: Won off 3lb higher mark over C&D 13 months ago; has been out of form this term; poor draw.
runners.spotlight: Has won over this C&D and is back to a reasonable handicap mark but has shown little in six runs this season and has a wide draw to overcome.

runners.name: Fun Together
runners.breeder: M W Gething, I N & Mrs S K Gillatt
runners.comment: Well handicapped on best form; apart from one second place, has been off colour of late.
runners.spotlight: Notched three C&D triumphs during last season but has been placed just once in 15 attempts since his latest win and may not be able to get to the front from stall eight.

runners.name: California Sun
runners.comment: Newcomer; has run nine times in trials and been placed just once (over 5f); hard to fancy.
runners.spotlight: Cost 60,000gns at the Tattersalls Breeze-Up Sales two years ago and is out of a four-time winner but has been placed only once (over 5f) in nine local trial races; looks up against it.

runners.name: Star Brose
runners.owner: Peter Young Wai Po & David Young Yuk Chuen
runners.comment: Steps up from 6f having been beaten by only 2.25l on last month's debut; should progress.
runners.spotlight: Showed a little promise when keeping on well late to finish 2.25l sixth of 12 as a 33-1 chance on his 6f Happy Valley career debut five weeks ago; extra furlong may help.

runners.name: Fortune Star
runners.owner: Kelvin Chan Kam Kei & Eddie Chan Kam Kong
runners.comment: Has a future as a racehorse judged by two moderately promising starts; may need more time.
runners.spotlight: Never dangerous but has shown some ability on each of his first two outings (beaten by 3.5l over 6f, then 4.25l over 7f); may need a little more time before he is ready to contend.

runners.name: Beauty Live
runners.comment: Would be a handicap snip if suddenly returning to his best but is badly out of form.
runners.spotlight: Four-time C&D scorer but not for almost three years; very lightly weighted on his best form but has ten modest runs to his name since a fair fourth 11 months ago.

runners.name: Magic Combo
runners.breeder: D T Champion, Llanhennock Trust & M
runners.owner: Tong Kin Hing, Dr Francis Siu Pui Sing & Siu Miu Man
runners.comment: Nothing in the first three races of his career suggests that he will be a contender here.
runners.spotlight: Impossible to recommend after beginning his career with three straight poor runs, all at massive odds and two over this C&D.

runners.name: Arden
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs James Tien Pei Chun
runners.comment: Will be a massive outside again after starting his career with four poor efforts.
runners.spotlight: Has been sent off at odds of 50-1 or bigger in all four starts to date and has run accordingly each time (over this C&D on his latest run).

runners.name: Inno Century
runners.owner: Tsui Wo Pong, Dennis Lo Yuk Ming Et Al
runners.comment: Stepping up in trip after solid 6f efforts in each of his first four starts; unexposed.
runners.spotlight: Has not made the top three yet has been beaten by 3.25l or less in each of his first four starts (all over 6f); this extra furlong and 2lb drop in the rating could have a positive effect.

runners.name: E Universe
runners.comment: Well treated on his best form (all at Happy Valley) but unlikely to be suited by 7f.
runners.spotlight: Dual front-running Happy Valley 6f scorer off much higher marks who has just one Sha Tin outing (on dirt) to his name in 27 career starts; last two runs have been moderate.

runners.name: Smiling Collector
runners.breeder: Mapperley Stud Ltd & Windsor Park S
runners.comment: Patchy recent form but merits consideration as drop back to 7f could be in his favour.
runners.spotlight: Successful off a 3lb higher mark over this C&D ten months ago; has form has been patchy in recent months but should appreciate this drop back to 7f.

runners.name: Telecom Power
runners.owner: Cheung King Shek, Billy Cheung King Shan Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Pulse Dream Genie, P M O'Shea Et Al

runners.comment: Finally broke his duck over 6f at Happy Valley on Wednesday; longer trip here; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Squeaked home by a short head to post his first career victory (at the 18th attempt) three days ago at Happy Valley; quick turnaround and longer trip may be beyond him; reserve.

runners.name: Aeroinvincible
runners.comment: Would have claims if repeating form of October C&D wins; has lost his form since; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Landed his second C&D victory off this exact handicap mark in October but has failed to finish in the top six in five subsequent starts; reserve.

8:30.race_name: Hong Kong Riding For The Disabled Association 50th Anniversary Cup (Handicap) (Class 4) (3yo+)

runners.name: Enjoy Golf
runners.comment: Apprentice being used for the first time here in bid to end run of five second places.
runners.spotlight: Beginning to look something of a professional loser after racking up five straight second places this term (three times as favourite, finished in front of three of these over C&D last time); top apprentice aboard now.

runners.name: Little Paradise
runners.comment: Off the mark at the first attempt by a head over C&D last time; now 6lb higher.
runners.spotlight: Well fancied after good trial performances and made all to win official debut over C&D six weeks ago, holding on by a head having gone clear; now 6lb higher but that experience will have done him the world of good.

runners.name: Mount Everest
runners.comment: Two C&D runs to date; won by a nose then staying-on third after slow start; major player.
runners.spotlight: Surprise 19-1 winner on his debut, then did well considering a slow start to finish 1.25l third off this revised mark (both over C&D); should go well again.

runners.name: Happy Park
runners.comment: Has not progressed after C&D win off 3lb lower in December; bled last time out.
runners.spotlight: Won off 3lb lower over C&D in December; unplaced in all five subsequent starts; worrying that he was found to have bled following his most recent run five weeks ago.

runners.name: Sal
runners.comment: Has justified long odds each time with five moderate efforts to date; tongue-tie applied.
runners.spotlight: Has run poorly at very longs odds in each of his five Hong Kong starts; sixth similar outcome is likely here, even with a tongue-tie applied.

runners.name: Lean Master
runners.owner: Cheng Wan Wai & Cheng Tsz Yan
runners.comment: Front-runner; has not won for a year but has been running well for apprentice riders.
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who has often run well (six top-four finishes) without winning this season, largely when apprentice-ridden but has a more experience jockey booked today; 3l third over C&D last time.

runners.name: Pejibaye
runners.comment: 2.25l sixth as an 11-2 chance on his C&D debut; looks to have more on his plate here.
runners.spotlight: Attracted some market support before finishing 2.25l sixth on his C&D career debut five weeks ago; should come on for that run but this looks a stronger race.

runners.name: Glaciated
runners.owner: Alan Chiu Chun Ming, Sandy Cheng Chuk Wah & W Law Chi Yin
runners.comment: Has displayed some potential with midfield finishes on both starts; blinkers now applied.
runners.spotlight: Has run near-identical races on his two career outings, keeping on to be beaten by around 4.5l each time (5f then 6f); needs to find a bit more but blinkers could help.

runners.name: Run Ran Run
runners.comment: Irish import; has been a disappointment apart from a close second over C&D in January.
runners.spotlight: Dual sprint winner in Ireland; his Hong Kong record now stands at 0-10 but a repetition of his 0.5l C&D third off a 1lb higher mark in January would give him a shout.

runners.name: Flying Double
runners.owner: Raymond Tsang Heung Tak & Kenneth Tsang Heung Kan
runners.comment: Back from four months off; began career with three solid efforts; merits consideration.
runners.spotlight: Beaten by 2l or less in each of his first three attempts before a lesser display when last seen four months ago (all this C&D); could be revitalised by his holiday.

runners.name: Sea Sapphire
runners.comment: All-or-nothing performer who has two C&D wins to his name; 6lb higher than for recent win.
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent (two C&D wins but unplaced in all 13 other runs); sprang 13-1 surprise on return from a break five weeks ago; needs new personal best to score off 6lb higher.

runners.name: King Show
runners.comment: Has not shown much in three starts to date but is back from a break; recent trial winner.
runners.spotlight: Unfancied and has not been involved in the finish in any of his three career starts but comes here on the back of a seven-week break and did win a recent trial race.

runners.name: Honest Witness
runners.owner: Arthur Antonio Da Silva, Betty Da Silva & Teresa Da Silva
runners.comment: Fair fourth on each of just two starts to date, beaten by around 3l each time; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Open to plenty of improvement after running well on both of his opening two starts (5f then 6f), finishing fourth on each occasion.

runners.name: Draco
runners.comment: Posted three straight good runs at start of the year; two lesser efforts since; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden; looked to be getting his act together when twice placed early in the year (once over this C&D) but has posted slightly lesser efforts in his last two runs.

runners.name: Talents Ambition
runners.comment: Gained second local victory in December but has found life tougher since being reassessed
runners.spotlight: Gained his second local C&D victory in December but has found life tougher since being reassessed; more needed to defy his current mark.

runners.name: Bundle Of Charm
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Colin Lo Chor Cheong
runners.comment: Produced some fair efforts in defeat this term; has placed over this trip off higher marks
runners.spotlight: Winless since early 2023 but has produced some respectable efforts in defeat this season; placed over this trip off higher marks, so not one to rule out.

runners.name: Turin Mascot
runners.breeder: Mountain View Stud & J C B/Stock
runners.owner: Dr Sheldon Tse Hiu Tung, Ken Huang Jian Hua & Tsoi Huk Yam

prev_owners.owner: Tsoi Huk Yam, Sheldon Tse Hiu Tung & Ken Huang Jian Hua

runners.comment: Snapped a losing sequence in October but hasn't made much impact in six runs since
runners.spotlight: Snapped a losing sequence with a C&D success in October but hasn't made much impact in six runs since; needs to bounce back.

quotes.race: Lengthen The Odds With BetVictor Race
quotes.quote: In Ecstasy is a progressive horse who enjoys the all-weather. We will have a look at heading back there in February for the Listed three-year-old race - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Never Peter Out
runners.comment: Highly progressive this term; clearly thriving and looks a big player once again.
runners.spotlight: Highly progressive this term with four C&D wins and a close second last time; clearly thriving and looks a big player once again.

runners.name: Ariel
runners.comment: Dual dirt winner here this season; comfortably held since a C&D success in March
runners.spotlight: Dual dirt winner at Sha Tin this season, including over C&D in March; comfortably held since and needs to take a significant step forward.

runners.name: Fighting Machine
runners.breeder: Miss J M, K J & Mrs M L Shaw
runners.comment: Placed a few times since upped in grade; underwhelming last time but can bounce back
runners.spotlight: Class 4 winner on his second start this season and has placed a few times since upped in grade; slightly underwhelming last time but has the ability to bounce back.

runners.name: Dragon Air Force
runners.owner: Au Kai Kwong & Michelle Jessica Au
runners.comment: Followed up back-to-back 6f wins with another solid effort off his revised mark; chance
runners.spotlight: Followed up back-to-back 6f wins with another solid effort off his revised mark; still improving and very much on the radar.

runners.name: Allcash
runners.comment: Yet to seriously threaten in nine local starts and others arrive with stronger credentials
runners.spotlight: Yet to seriously threaten in nine local starts and others arrive with stronger credentials; hard to fancy.

runners.name: Chill Kaka
runners.comment: Arrives in red-hot form, defying a 9lb rise last month; highly respected on hat-trick bid
runners.spotlight: Arrives in red-hot form, defying a 9lb rise to land back-to-back C&D victories last month; bids for a hat-trick and commands plenty of respect.

runners.name: Fast Speed
runners.owner: Howard Tai Wai Yin & Yim Hin Keung
runners.comment: Beaten a long way in both local starts; needs to show more before becoming of interest
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way in both local starts and needs to show much more before becoming of interest.

runners.name: Northern Beast
runners.owner: Ngai Man, Amy Wang Hong & Doris Ngai Yan Tung
runners.comment: Scored at Happy Valley in February but has struggled since moving up in grade
runners.spotlight: Scored over 1m1f in a Class 4 event at Happy Valley in February but has struggled since moving up in grade; improvement required.

runners.name: Juneau Pride
runners.comment: Highly progressive sort who has yet to finish outside the top three; obvious contender
runners.spotlight: Highly progressive sort who has yet to finish outside the top three; already a three-time C&D winner and remains an obvious contender.

runners.name: Light Years Charm
runners.comment: Made his local breakthrough in February and has remained competitive since; claims
runners.spotlight: Made his local breakthrough with a C&D win in February and has remained competitive off his higher mark since; likely to make his presence felt again.

runners.name: Top Gun

prev_owners.owner: McEnnis Racing Pty Ltd, Gandharvi Et Al

runners.comment: Looked promising early in his current campaign but recent efforts have been below par
runners.spotlight: Looked promising early in his current campaign but recent efforts have been below par; needs to bounce back to figure.

runners.name: Another World
runners.comment: Has scored in three of his eight career starts; lightly raced and still improving
runners.spotlight: Has scored in three of his eight career starts, including a tidy C&D success in March; lightly raced and still improving, high on the shortlist.

runners.name: Gentlemen Legacy

prev_owners.owner: Mrs K L Cumming, P Cumming Et Al

runners.comment: 3-10 when trained by Paul Cumming in Australia; only moderate in recent barrier trials
runners.spotlight: 3-10 when trained by Paul Cumming in Australia; only moderate in recent barrier trials; makes Hong Kong debut today.

runners.name: Prestige Ricky

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.comment: Beaten a long way at big prices on both local starts; easy to look elsewhere for now
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way at big prices on both local starts; easy to look elsewhere for now.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld, Dubai British EBF "Confined" Maiden Stakes (C & G) (No More Than 2 Runs) (Div I)
